131501.name: I.Q. Games: Wonders of the World
131501.description:
From the back of the box:

Learn about fascinating places in the world as you play this fast-paced quiz game! Each card contains five clues. Answer on the first clue, and you earn five points. If you answer after all five clues (including a picture clue), you still earn a point! The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

A "NOW YOU KNOW" section on each card contains fascinating facts to learn and tell.

131502.description: MOSD Tile Expansion Set #2 comes with 10 unique hexagon tiles. Each tile has two connected gray (wild) sides, one color on opposing side plus two unique colors on other two sides.
131502.name: Mines of the Sacred Dragon: Tile Exp Set #2

131503.description: MOSD Tile Expansion Set #3 comes with 10 unique hexagon tiles. Each tile has two colors and each color is on three connected sides.
131503.name: Mines of the Sacred Dragon: Tile Exp Set #3

131504.name: Mystery Legends: The Phantom of the Opera
131504.description:
The ruins of the opera house stand as a tomb to unrequited love. Though long abandoned, an undying ghost still wanders its halls, plotting the return of his heart's desire. Discover the history that haunts the opera house and face all of its challenges. Confront the man behind the mask and complete the final act in Mystery Legends: Phantom of the Opera, a fantastic Hidden Object Puzzle Adventure game!

Source: The Publisher Website.

131505.name: 3 Gnus und 7 Kakadus
131505.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Welcome to the number zoo! There's always a lot going on because a wild diversity of animals can be found in these enclosures: rhinos, parrots, wildebeest, cockatoos, and many more.

Keeper Fred naturally knows all the animals personally and taking care of the rascals requires a lot of work as he needs to count them, send them to the proper enclosures, and maintain order in the zoo. But who can help Fred count carefully so that no animal is lost?

With the three games in 3 Gnus und 7 Kakadus, children learn to deal with the numbers to 20, count, sort, organize and develop an understanding for varying amounts.

131506.name: Monsterquatsch
131506.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Yikes, what's going on here? Once again a small chaos monster has been at work in the house and messed things up. Why else would the refrigerator be in the bathroom? And should the bed really be in the kitchen?

In the five games in Monsterquatsch, you're going to try to catch the chaos monster in the act and clean up the house once again, making sure you know which items can normally be found in which rooms. To maintain order in Lucas' house will require good eyes, quick response, and communication skills.

131507.name: Ab durch den Dschungel
131507.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Did something just crack under your feet? In Ab durch den Dschungel, brave treasure hunters must find their way through the jungle, following tortuous paths, balancing on a log over a raging river, protecting themselves from pesky mosquitoes, and keeping an eye out for poisonous snakes.

In the end, though, these adventurers might find themselves a big sparkling treasure if they dive into the world of treasure hunters and guide themselves through the many different tasks that await them in the jungle...

131508.name: Was ist da los?
131508.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The tomcat Fridolin is very curious, so he looks at all the people on the playground and in the market very carefully. Filled with fascination, Fridlin observes the faces of both children and adults, and he sees that they show very different feelings.

In Was ist da los?, children travel with the tomcat Fridolin into the world of feelings. During the game you'll look at the depicted children and explain the many different behaviors, emotions, and situations they're experiencing.

131509.name: Entdeckerquiz Deutschland
131509.description:
Game description from the publisher:

In Entdeckerquiz Deutschland, Robby the Robot and his brilliant team of kids are going to quiz players over ten rounds on all they know about Germany.

A different question is asked each round, then all players place one of their chips into one of the four response areas on the "Quizzomat". Players then turn the wheel in the window of the Quizzomat to reveal the solution code and see who guessed correctly. Whether the subject is history, culture, or unusual features, the Quizzomat always knows the right answer. Whoever scores the most points after ten rounds wins.

131510.name: East Meets West
131510.description:
User Summary

A compilation of Duke Nukem 3D Atomic Edition and Shadow Warrior that came in an obscenely large box.

131512.name: Renaissance Kingdoms
131512.description:
Renaissance Kingdoms is a free, international, massively multiplayer online game. It's Entirely playable in a web browser, with no need to download anything. This game mixes genres in a unique way: it's a role playing game, a strategy game and a political game, all at the same time.

You will be immersed in Europe, on the eve of the coming Renaissance. You will begin the game as a lowly vagrant. Through perseverance and skill, however, you will be able to Eventually move up in the hierarchy and take a significant share in the political life of the Kingdoms.

Source: The Developer Website.

131513.name: Shogun Kingdoms
131513.description:
Shogun Kingdoms is a free, international, massively multiplayer online game. It's entirely playable in a web browser, with no need to download anything. This game mixes genres in a unique way: it's a role playing game, a strategy game, management game and a political game, all rolled into one.

You will be immersed in medieval Japan at the end of the troubled Muromachi era. You will begin the game as a humble vagrant but through perseverance and skill, you will eventually be able to move up in the hierarchy and take a significant role in the political life of the archipelago.

Source: The Developer Website.

131514.name: Native Kingdoms
131514.description:
Native Kingdoms is a free, international, massively multiplayer online game. It's entirely playable in a web browser, with no need to download anything. This game mixes genres in a unique way: it's a role playing game, a strategy game, management game and a political game, all rolled into one.

You will be immersed in Aztec Central America, about forty years before the arrival of the awful Conquistadores. You will begin the game as a humble vagrant but through perseverance and skill, you will eventually be able to move up in the hierarchy and take a significant role in the political life of the Kingdoms.

Source: The Developer Website.

131515.description:
Feudality: Dark Clouds, Pretty Flowers is a 70-tile expansion for Feudality that includes Bridge Trolls, Rainbows, the Pink Dragon, Lucky Shrooms, Bards, Hermits, and many more new tiles to add to the mix.

The Dark Clouds, Pretty Flowers is a 70-tile expansion.

It contains tiles of:
Unicorn – The Fox – Bearbarian
These three powerful beings will fight for your fiefdom.

Black Cloud – Volcano – Bridge Troll – Franz
These four tiles all have in common that you do not place them in a space on your FMC, but on that of an opponent.

Pink Dragon - Bard - Lookout - Gazebo
The tiles all modify the effects of event cards when you have them in your FMC.

Hill Goats – River Goats – Agtfos
Hill Goats must be placed on a hill, River Goats on the river.

Rogue’s Guild – Rose Garden - Rosenberg
These tiles modify baronial actions.

Caravan – The Prince
The Caravan must be placed adjacent to your keep.

Gravel-Pit Lady – Ferryman
These tiles modify your already placed tiles.

Surveyor
The Surveyor allows you to shift one of your tiles so that it comes to rest on the dividing lines between two spaces.

Apprentice Mage (white/blue)
The Wizard is a very clever guy.

Wizard’s Tower – Hermit
These two particularly powerful tiles must be “hit” directly with the die roll to access their abilities.

Dwarven Mine – Orchard Grove – Magic Forest –
Ruins – Rainbow – Lucky Shroom
These tiles do not introduce any new rules as such.
131515.name: Feudality: Dark Clouds, Pretty Flowers

131516.name: Drifter
131516.description:
User Summary

Drifter is an awesome, open-world sandbox space trading game featuring a massive galaxy with thousands of stars and endless possibilities to explore. After creating a character and can opt to live the simple life of a merchant or take work for hire, exploring, at the same time, the galaxy around you. Alternatively, you can become a notorious pirate or a fearsome bounty hunter. The choice is yours.

131517.name: Acilion
131517.description:
User Summary

Acilion is a massively multiplayer online browser game. After creating a character, you immerse yourself in a lawless medieval fantasy world overflowing with magic and all kinds of monsters. Your goal is to survive, improve yourself by training endlessly, and, ultimately, build an army to crash your opponents

131518.description:
Dominion of the Gods is a tactical miniatures game played on a board created by the players. The players buy, assemble and paint miniatures for use with the game. The miniatures come with stat cards, these stats will also be available in a rulebook. The stat card tells the player how far the model can move, how many dice it uses to attack, how many dice it gets while defending, how far its combat reach is how many hits the model can sustain before being removed from gameplay as dead and the level of faith it has in its God.

Monsters, heroes, and gods of different pantheons battle in a miniatures skirmish game. Intuitive dice-based combat. Cards list what models can accomplish, and dice rolls determine hits and blocks. Rolling the power die in special situations can prevent un-blockable hits.

Using entire pantheons to build war bands adds a twist, and models sculpted by industry greats makes for a well-executed presentation.

Players start off by choosing a God from a pantheon to play as their main character. Players then decide on a point total for the game they want to play. Once the point total is decided, each player puts together an army with models (using the models point cost) that equal up to the point total decided by the players. Players can only use models from their chosen pantheon at this time. There is the possibility that some pantheons may be able to benefit from rogue legends in the future.

Players are allowed to select one coin that they possess to use during the game. Different coins will be manufactured with different abilities. Some coins will be standard while others will be collectible items sold only during certain times of the year or at specific locations.

Models have a movement number listed in inches that they may move. Every model gets to actions, one used to move and the other used to attack or move.

Special dice are used in the game. Attack dice are six sided dice with three blank sides, two sides with a picture of a single sword (these count as single hits) and one side with crossed swords (this counts as a double hit.) Models may roll the number of attack dice that is listed in their attack statistic on the card.
Defense dice have for blank sides and two sides with the image of a shield. Defense dice are rolled as a reaction to a model being attacked. Every shield that is rolled removes one hit from the attacks that were rolled.
Lastly there is the power dice. Power dice are a special kind of dice that players get through either magic, attacking a prone model or by charging an enemy. Power dice have three blank sides, one side with a single sword (this counts as a single hit) one side with three swords crossed (this counts as a triple hit) and the final side has the word "power" on it. If the dice are rolled and the word power comes up, the defender does not receive his defense dice roll in response to this attack.

If a God is killed during the game, the faith scores of all the models on that team are reduced making them more likely to fail psychology checks. If a God is the only model left on the board, the God loses the ability to use any influence. Influence is a score that tells a God how much magic he can use every round. When a God is left without followers, he loses his magic ability.
131518.name: Dominion of the Gods

131519.name: Transcripted
131519.description:
History’s greatest battles have always been fought at scales too small for the human eye to see. The microcosm is a violent, chaotic world, where the struggle for existence rages between countless organisms every second of every day… until now. The game has changed- a disease unlike anything in nature has recently been discovered infecting humans, and is spreading fast. This xeno pathogen is unrecognizable to scientists… it is either an alien virus, or the masterwork of a brilliantly twisted nano-engineer wielding an evil sense of humor. The xeno pathogen is immune to traditional methods of treatment; only the most cutting edge weapons have any hope of stopping the disease before it reaches epidemic proportions. Enter the Nano Probe- a microscopic, experimental device controlled remotely from outside the body by a crack team of engineers and scientists that can penetrate the smallest chasms of the body to seek out and destroy pathogens wherever they may be hiding. Like a miniscule master assassin, the Nano Probe is equipped with advanced prototypical weaponry from laser blasters to homing rockets to help it destroy its quarry. Take control of the Nano Probe to annihilate this threat before it wipes humanity from the face of the earth. You, and the Nano Probe, may be all that stand between mankind and total extinction.

Source: The Publisher Website.

131520.name: Zunftblatt (Online Issue 3 - Nov 2008)
rpgissuearticle: Asien in der New World of Darkness
Die Chroniken von Narnia - Der König von Narnia
Interviews mit Oliver Plaschka und Ulrich Drees
Leserbrief zu Narnia aus dem Hause Brendow
Stimmen von der Spiel ´08 in Essen
Wushu - Die uralte Kunst des Actionrollenspiels
Zipangu - Das Land der aufgehenden Sonne
Zunftblatt Fragebogenaktion „Das beste Zunftblatt aller Zeiten“
131520.description:
Zunftblatt
Online Issue #3
November 2008

Cover art by Zoe Linnhoff

Issue 3 is focusing on Asia and Eastern themes in RPGs

131521.name: The Bloodfire Territories
131521.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the Bloodfire Territories, several tribes of mankind, once enslaved, escaped the clutches of the salamanders and their Dragon Gods. These tribes established several villages in the Plains of Lashon, called the Bloodfire Territories. This land is lush with resources and vegetation, and can support the growth of men, yet it is filled with threats-from terror-making Leviathans to packs of demons with their demon chiefs. This book is about the land, its new stewards, and their gods.
In this book you will find:

6 Pre-generated Characters, illustrated and fleshed out with tribes and resources
A full description and back story for the Bloodfire Territories
Wandering encounter charts for the Bloodfire Territories and surrounding region
A full adventure titled "Demonic Infestation"
Appendix on Demons
Appendix on Resources
Plot Hooks and Festivals
3 Color Maps and a printable color Token Sheet usable for any New Gods of Mankind Game

131522.name: Frankenstein Atomic Frontier
131522.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Patchwork Post-Apocalyptic Western Role-Playing Game in which players take the role of Frankenstein creations struggling to build their lives on the post-Atomic frontier world of the Sublime.

In Frankenstein Atomic Frontier we’ve presented a streamlined rulebook, absent of redundant and repeatitive “an rpg is” statements and designed to making starting play as fast as possible.

Frankenstein Atomic Frontier boasts:

Flexible setting.
Easy to learn rules system.
Evocative mechanics to generate the “feel” of being a Frankenstein creation.
Card based mechanics that are entirely dice free.
Fast character creation.
100% Australian made!

131523.name: Road Rage
131523.description:
From publisher blurb:

Throughout the Sublime, its angry out there on the road. The Settlement of Broken Rock needs you. Its time to burn rubber in... ROAD RAGE! This adventure for Frankenstein Atomic Frontier boasts:

Free micro-adventure, the perfect start to any campaign!
100% Australian made!

131524.name: Folks
131524.description:
From publisher blurb:

Folks, for Frankenstein Atomic Frontier, brings you… well, folks! Meet them in a Settlement, Saloon or out there in the Sublime, be friends, be foes… have them be whatever and whoever you want them to be! Folks gives you:

10 Archetypical Adam’s to encounter out there in the Sublime.
Expanded background, including religion and law enforcement
New Special Parts for your Adam.
A 100% Australian made RPG product!

131526.name: Mathable Quattro
131526.description:
Mathable Quattro is a special counting card game that combines classical games Mathable and counting points cards.
Quattro hiding in a small box for card games, two stacks of 53 cards. So if you count well, it means total supply 106 cards in the deck. All cards have number from 0-50.
At the start of every game mix whole package properly, so you don´t have too much of the same numbers together. Lower numbers are usual in the package than the high ones. Each player gets seven cards in hand, which is required to discard as soon as possible. Who do it first, is the winner of the lot.
Players must combine the numbers in hands with the results in any row or column of the table. For example, if you are over twelve and four, you play sixteen (12 4 = 16), eight (12-4 = 8) threesome (12:4 = 3) or osmačtyřicítku (12x4 = 48).
---
Mathable Quattro je speciální počítací hra, která kombinuje herní systémy her Mathable a klasického přebíjení karet.
Quattro je nejmenším bratříčkem ze čtveřice a ukrývá se v malé krabičce pro karetní hry, ve dvou sloupečcích po 53 kartách. Pokud tedy dobře počítáte, znamená to celkovou nabídku 106 karet v balíčku.
Na začátku každé partie pořádně zamíchejte balíček, ať nemáte příliš stejných čísel pohromadě. Nižších čísel je celkem v balíčku víc, než těch vysokých. Každý z hráčů dostane do ruky sedm karet, kterých se musí zbavit. Komu se to podaří jako prvnímu, se stává vítězem partie.
Hráči nyní musí zkombinovat čísla ve své ruce s výsledky v některé řadě nebo sloupci na stole. Například pokud nad sebou leží dvanáctka a čtyřka, můžete zahrát šestnáctku (12+4=16), osmičku (12-4=8), trojku (12:4=3) nebo osmačtyřicítku (12x4=48).

131527.name: Hands On
131527.description:
From the publisher's website:

Ready, Set, Go! Nimble hands and sharp eyes will lead to victory! An action packed and fun-filled game. Great for the entire family.

The Object:

The moment a card is drawn, quickly imitate the card hands pattern. The last one is the loser! Be the first, and be aware of any illogical hand combinations.

131528.name: Ballista
131528.description:
The ballista was an ancient Greek and Roman missile weapon, which launched a large projectile at a distant target.

Introduction

Ballista is an area enclosure, area control abstract game for 2 players: Black and White. It is played on the spaces of a 10x10 board. The board is divided by two red intersecting lines creating four 5 x 5 quadrants. You will also need a set of reversi pieces. The game starts out with 2 black and 2 white reversi pieces placed on the four marked squares on the board.

Play

Players decide who goes first then play alternates.

On each turn players must take two actions:

1)Move one of your color reversi pieces “ballista” exactly like a queen in Chess, orthogonally or diagonally onto any empty space as long as the piece stays within the quadrant where the move initiated from.

2)Fire a “projectile” reversi piece in your color away in a straight line orthogonally or diagonally from the piece just moved, then placing the new reversi piece in your color onto any empty space within one of the other three remaining quadrants.

Players also have the option on their turn to capture an enemy stone. Captures in Ballista are custodian, i.e., an enemy stone is captured when sandwiched between two friendly stones (orthogonal or diagonal). Captured enemy pieces are not removed from the board but flipped over to your color.

Note: A ballista or fired projectile reversi piece may not jump over a friend or enemy piece, also any friendly pieces that were projectiles may now become a ballista.

The game ends when a player has no valid move.

131529.name: Street Fighter II Turbo (SNES)
131529.description:
User Summary

The third iteration of SF2, and considered by many to be one of the most balanced fighting games ever released (and second in the series in popularity only to Super Turbo).

Besides the obvious (increased speed), the largest change over Champion Edition is new specials for the majority of the characters.

131530.description:
Bilbo Baggins lives in the quaint village of Hobbiton, but today his comfort has been shattered by the arrival of 13 Dwarves. They have convinced Bilbo to embark on a most unexpected journey – but first Gandalf, along with the Dwarves Dwalin, Kili and Fili, must find the other ten Dwarves who are lost in the Hobbit holes of Hobbiton.

In The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey, the players first build the game out of LEGO bricks, then they take turns rolling a special six-sided die. If a player rolls 1-3, he moves his figure the number of spaces rolled and uses a torch to lift a piece out of the Hobbit hole on which he landed. Hopefully the bottom of the piece shows a Dwarf. If so, the player keeps the Dwarf and play passes to the left. If a player finds a Hobbit instead, he lifts a piece out of any other Hobbit hole on the board in an attempt to locate another Hobbit; if the player finds a match, he keeps the pair of Hobbits and is rewarded with the opportunity to peek at the bottom of a piece from any other Hobbit hole.

Instead of a Hobbit or Dwarf, some pieces feature a picture of breakfast. Matching two breakfasts allows a player to take a Dwarf piece already obtained by an opponent and return it to the Hobbit hole of his choice. The last possibility when revealing a piece is to find a picture of a rune. Matching two runes allows a player to select another Hobbit hole of his choice; if he finds a Dwarf in this location, he keeps it and play passes to the left. The custom die also features a picture of a map on one side. Rolling the map allows a player to move to any Hobbit hole on the board.

After all ten Dwarves have been found, the player with the most Dwarves wins. The game comes with variant rules, including one that shifts the location of Hobbit holes by swinging portions of the board into different configurations. Another variant requires players to find Thorin, the leader of the Dwarves, last. Another places Bilbo in one of the Hobbit holes.
131530.name: The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey

131531.name: Super Scrabble
131531.description:
User Summary

Take Scrabble on the go with the portable Game Boy version. Play against a friend or one of the 5 AI levels. The built in 40,000 word dictionary will make sure no one is cheating.

131532.name: The Simpsons: Bart vs. the Juggernauts
131532.description:
User Summary

Bart is a contestant on the TV show Juggernauts (think American Gladiators) and must play through several events to make enough money and continue on through the four weeks of broadcasting.

131534.name: The HitchHiker's Guide to Polaris
131534.description:
From Introduction:

Welcome to Polaris RPG. This Guide is meant to be a general purpose introduction to the Polaris RPG universe. It contains a basic explanation of the rules, general information on skills, races and other game related data. The DM's Guide: All you ever Really Needed to Know About Hyperspace and Pan-Dimensional Travel takes a more in depth view of some of the particulars and explanations of the game’s plot, background and physics. If you are a player of Polaris RPG, we recommend that you do not read the DM's guide; it may generally spoil some of the fun of the game. This guide also assumes that you are marginally familiar with the genre of Role Playing Games as that it does not make an in depth explanation of what role playing is. If you have never player an RPG before, however, this may actually be a good place to start, since we are going to explain it to you like you are and idiot.

131535.name: The Broodmother
131535.description:
A supplement for use with The Brainer playbook.

From Introduction:

Mother bear? Shit. She ain’t got nothin’ on a brainer and her little nest.

131536.name: The Catalyst
131536.description:
A supplement for use with The Battlebabe playbook.

From Introduction:

I’ve never been one to tell anybody else what to do or how to be, but I do know this: things got to change.

131537.name: The Living God
131537.description:
A supplement for use with The Hocus playbook.

From Introduction:

Folks will tell you there’s no gods left in Apocalypse World. They’ll say there are no messengers to tell us of heaven’s plan, because there is no one up there to make one. But maybe they’re wrong.

131538.name: Rockit Science
131538.description:
Rockit Science is a game with a steam punk meets the energy industry flavor that was commissioned by XTO Energy to hand out as a holiday gift for its employes.

The concept is simple, just draw a card and move accordingly and try to be the first player to reach the end of the path. The game is functionally equivalent to Candy Land.

131539.name: The Loner
131539.description:
A supplement for use with The Gunlugger playbook.

From Introduction:

I know I seen you somewhere before, darlin’, tho’ I can’t quite put my finger on it. Anyhow, if you’re gonna start putting bullets in me sometime today—for what I did or didn’t do to you and yours—perhaps we should just settle this right now.

131540.name: The Valkyrie
131540.description:
A supplement for use with The Battlebabe playbook.

From Introduction:

Hail to the day that gleams about us! Hail to the sun that shines upon us!
Hail to the light that overcomes the night Hail to the world in which we live! You are forever mine, my inheritance, my own: laughing at death!

131541.name: The Wurm
131541.description:
A supplement for use with The Hoarder playbook.

From Introduction:

Surely this broken and blasted world will someday be made whole. People may be bloody, dirt-covered animals, but they’ve all got that little sliver of person still rattling around inside of ‘em. The animal doesn’t want to die, but the person doesn’t want to be forgotten. One day, this shit’ll be over and, then, you’re gonna make damn sure that people remember.

131542.name: The Fallen
131542.description:
A supplement for use with The Quarantine playbook.

From Introduction:

Way out there, beyond the reach of the maelstrom, when you ask the stars and the darkness between for answers, something else responds, something ancient, formless, and terrible. Would you like to hear it?

131543.name: The Coot
131543.description:
From Introduction:

Nowadays it’s pretty rare you see someone walking around that was alive before it happened. Sure, plenty of folks you meet look to be about a hundred, but it ain’t time that wore them down.

Once in a great while, you may come across an old codger that came by his gray hair the old fashioned way – by living a long time. Most of ‘em are obviously crazy, driven mad by who knows what part of the psychic feedback that rushes in at unguarded moments. Most of the rest have been crippled by mistakes (made by them or others) when they weren’t spry enough anymore to get out of the way.

But there are a few old-timers that remain nimble and seem to have held onto most of their wits. Along the way they’ve picked up some tricks that keep them breathing in the newly harsh world. It’s likely that they have some memory of the before times, but they aren’t necessarily willing to talk about it. No, they’re just trying to make their way, same as everyone else, relying on what they have and what they can get.

131544.name: The Devoted
131544.description:
A supplement for use with The Brainer playbook.

From Introduction:

In this rotten hell of a world, it's hard to get close to anyone. But there is SOMETHING that's always there for you, to listen to your hopes, your fears, your secret confessions. Sometimes, when you're completely alone, you can almost feel the hot breath on your ear as it whispers back.

131545.name: The Feral Kid
131545.description:
From Introduction:

You ain't got nothing, you ain't got no family, you just got you.

131546.name: Speed Dating
131546.description:
In Speed Dating, each player has twelve cards in hand: six with female characteristics, and six with male characteristics. The main player for the turn selects three cards from his hand and lays them down, describing his character – for example, for a male character: "war weapons collector, spends his holidays in Kazakhstan, likes movies about gladiators". Then each other player must select three cards from his hand and convince the main player that she (or he) is his best match. The main player then selects the turn's winner.

Speed Dating feels like a minimalistic and hilarious role-playing game, or like an adult version of Once upon a Time, or a more involved version of The Big Idea.

131547.name: Castlot
131547.description:
User Summary

In the world of Castlot, set in Britain's 6th century Medieval era, you can choose the righteous Bright Knights of King Arthur fighting for the resistance, or the formidable Dark faction of Lord Blackmore, attempting to overtake the kingdom.

Castlot is a free browser MMORPG. It introduces multiple innovative features, such as the Framing system, to enhance gameplay, an array of troop types and more.

131548.name: 3D Game Alchemy
131548.description:
Back of Box

Jam your way through new levels. Create your own madness. And never again see the light of day.

More than 2,400 new levels!

Experience the wildest and most innovative game worlds, created by avid gamers from around the world.

DoomShell 5 - A 3D Game Alchemy Exclusive

The easiest and best game interface-- just point and click... DoomShell 5 does the rest for you.

131550.name: DOOM Companion
131550.description:
User Summary

A compilation containing more than 1,000 new levels for DOOM and DOOM II.

131551.name: Infectonator 2
131551.description:
User Summary

In Infectonator you take on the goal of infecting humans with a virus which turns them into zombies. You gain money as you kill them, this money can be used to upgrade your zombies to make them more dangerous, or buy secondary weapons such as grenades and canister bombs, or special single use zombies.

131552.name: Spy Hunter II (1987)
131552.description:
User Summary

The sequel to Spy Hunter has two screens which allows cooperative action. Use the classic weapons to keep the terrorists from hitting you and running you off the road. The view has been changed from a top-down view to behind the car, so you get more of a driving feel and can see turns and enemies in the distance.

131553.name: Les Fugitifs
131553.description:
Les Fugitifs is a strategic game for 2 or 4 people.
The theme of the game is the escape of four men from a city. The men need to find their way to the center of the city and then out of the city as quickly as possible. Each of the players tries to find their way and also obstructing the other players in their progress.

It is a tile placing and moving a character game.

Each turn a player can move his character on the board, place tiles or turn a tile on the board.

131554.name: Timber
131554.description:
User Summary

Chop down the trees within the time limit to continue on and add to your score. Avoid the forest animals and don't get crushed by any falling trees.

131555.name: D!Zone 2
131555.description:
Back Cover

Play these incredible new levels of DOOM for the best challenge yet!

IT'S AN ADVENTURE BEYOND BELIEF!

Includes 1000 new levels for DOOM and DOOM II including new game layouts, maps and a DOOM interface that are perfect for first time DOOM players as well as seasoned veterans. In addition, included are utilities, sounds, music and graphic add-ons - for the best challenge yet! You will be amazed hour after hour. All are fully play-tested - challenging even the most battle-hardened among the "DOOM"ed.

D! - The ultimate DOOM and DOOM II interface! In D!'s main menu you can change skill levels, challenge another player, select turbo, respawn, select no monsters or fast monsters and much more! The randomizer creates new games by randomly changing "mobile items" such as guns, demons, walls, maps, etc... every time you play D!ZONE.

131556.name: Wacko
131556.description:
The player assumes the role of Kapt'n Krooz'r, a small, green alien within a bubble-topped spaceship. The goal of each level is to eliminate the monsters, accomplished by shooting twin pairs in succession. As the player progresses, shooting monsters out of order creates mutants that must be unmatched before they can be eliminated.

Source: Wikipedia, "Wacko", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

131557.name: The Fool
131557.description:
Who said that only brave knights on white stallions can become Heroes? Help The Fool become a hero and save the beautiful princess Catherine from the jaws of a terrible dragon! Travel across the kingdom and explore different locations as you set off on an epic journey in this fun Hidden Object Puzzle Adventure game. Discover that a Hero lives in every one of us in The Fool!

Source: The Publisher Website.

131558.name: The Kid
131558.description:
From Introduction:

In the golden age, children grew up loved and well-fed and inside a fucking home, with a family and all that. Now, you're lucky if your parents don't sell you for a bottle. As for a mentor, a home, or some respect? In Apocalypse World, that's all shit you've got to fight for, 'cause nothing comes free. You, child, what are you willing to risk for it?

131559.name: The Rat-Pack
131559.description:
From Introduction:

"Where do these fucking kids keep coming from?! I kick them out and when I turn around there’s another one behind me. Don’t they have any mothers? Any good-fornothing fathers? Little fuckers keep stealing my food and my knives. Those were good knives!"

131560.name: The Ruin Runner
131560.description:
From Introduction:

Choppers need bikes. Drivers need cars, gunluggers need guns, hardholders need armor and rebar and whatnot. Who the fuck knows what savvyheads need down in their shops. Trouble is, folks ain't makin stuff like they used to in Apocalypse World. So you gotta go out there and find it, or something near enough.

And for someone who knows where to look, it's all just sitting there for the taking ...

131561.name: The Tribal
131561.description:
From Introduction:

Gone are the old ways, and the good ol' days. What happens when you've forgotten how to speak, how to act, how to be 'civilized?' You reinvent yourself, and take what you can from the dead world. You've taken the scraps of memory left in the ruins, and from it, a new order - a new culture - has arisen. One that can survive the toxic air, the things that roam, and worst of all, other people.

When the last of your machines break down - when everyone's dying for a drop, you will thrive.

131562.name: The Witch
131562.description:
From Introduction:

In Apocalypse World there are folk who can do things -- things that others can't, maybe even things that no one could do back in the Before. Isn't that special? Since the dawn of time, there've been those that could do stuff the rest couldn't. The old woman who knew things she shouldn't. The man who could be in two places at once. This psychic miasma isn't new; it’s just louder now.

131563.name: Hyborian Saga
131563.description:
From designer notes:

First off, Simon Carrier's "World of Conan" was a heavy influence. Some of the playbooks are almost directly from his hack (Sorcerer, Sellsword) and yes, he gave me permission to use his stuff. Thanks again.

Second, because I recently changed the Wyrd move from "swear an oath" to "discern the unnatural" some things might need to be changed in the playbooks. This also makes the Augury move a few of the playbooks have different. I made a half-hearted attempt at what Augury does now in The Sage's playbook.

the Stats are:

Allure =Hot
Fierce =Hard
Grace =Cool
Wits =Sharp
Wyrd =Weird




"Inflict Brutality" is the same as "Go Aggro"
"Wade into Battle" is the same as "Seize by Force"
"Strive against Peril" is the same as "Act under Fire"
"Discern the Unnatural" is like open your brain but for all the weird supernatural stuff in the Hyborian Age.

User note: Includes The Barbarian, The Cultist, The Horseman, The Monster, The Rogue, The Ruler, The Sage, The Sellsword, The Siren, The Sorceror, and The Witch playbooks.

131564.name: Level XI
131564.description:
Level XI uses the components and basic rules of Level X and can be played only in conjunction with the base game. Now your playing pieces can be placed on this supplemental board in addition to the tracks on the main game board. The pieces are not moved here, but they stay where you once placed them - however, you may remove them for other use at any time giving up your position.
The playing pieces on the highest spaces of the Level XI board earn you special points at the end of the game – and you can even score for more than one marker. Beware: you may miss a playing piece you placed on the supplemental board for the regular tracks - but if you are too late for it, the best spaces will be occupied there.

131565.name: Trans-Siberian
131565.description: Traverse the greatest landmass on Earth and harvest the riches of the East. Trade between cities in and around Siberia, investing the profits in railroads to facilitate your transports. Work together and against each other in conquering the frozen taiga and the endless steppes. Pay to use your competitors' connections, and watch your pile of currency grow as they use yours. Make the smartest trades and claim the most strategic routes in Trans-Siberian, and you might sit with the most railroads, resources, and money when the game ends and the winner is crowned.

131567.description:
INTRODUCTION

Mapello is a Reversi derivative that includes some special pieces that add new features to the game. These pieces are placed on the board to create a particular board configuration before the main game starts: this is called the setup phase.
A given board configuration may be played repeatedly, with players taking turns to play as black and as white. Since each board configuration will have its own nuances, repeated play enables players to experiment with strategies best suited to each setup.
Alternatively, Mapello can be played in free-play mode. In free-play mode, players take it in turns to setup the board. In order to encourage balance in the setup, the player not setting up the board has the option to play as black or as white (hence to move first or second).

The extra pieces are as follows:
- Walls: They act like the walls of the board border, but placed inside the board. They are immovable obstacles that cannot be played on.
- Bonuses: They reward the player with extra points when captured.
- Jokers (addition by Néstor Romeral Andrés): They are placed on the border and act as pieces of the colour of the player in turn.

By combining these pieces, players can create millions of different boards.

COMPONENTS

- Game board of 10x10 squares. The inner 8x8 board is used for playing, while the border is only used to place the jokers during the setup phase.
- 64 Reversi discs (black/white).
- 8 walls (gray squares).
- 8 bonuses (blue discs).
- 8 jokers (red squares).

SETUP PHASE

Optionally, the players may agree some constraints on the number of each type of piece to be placed during the setup phase. Then, subject to these constraints the setup player places their chosen number of pieces. Walls and power-ups can be placed anywhere on the inner 8x8 area (except on the four centre squares), and jokers can be placed anywhere on the outer 10x10 border. The game commences with an initial 2x2 configuration of black and white pieces in the following diagonal pattern:
PLAYING PHASE

Two players (black and white) alternate turns placing a piece with their colour facing up onto an empty cell of the inner 8x8 board. Black always plays first. Each piece must be placed adjacent to an opponent's piece (either horizontally, vertically or diagonally). Then, all the opponent's pieces that are trapped in a contiguous straight line (either diagonal, vertical, or horizontal) between the newly placed piece and an existing piece of that colour, or a joker, are flipped over to the player's colour. A legal move must case at least one opponent piece to be flipped. If a player cannot make a legal move then they pass.

If a player places a piece on top of a blue bonus disc, they take the disc (this will score 3 points at the end of the game).

The game ends when neither player can make a legal move. Players count the pieces of their colour facing up and add the points of the blue discs. Highest score wins. Over a series of games the first aim is to win the most games. In the event of a tie in the number of games won, the point difference over the set of games decides the winner.

Re-implements:
Othello
131567.name: Mapello

131568.description:
Deep within the rain forests of the Yucatan, rival teams of treasure hunters have recently discovered the lost city of Codinca. In the center of the once great citadel stands a stone temple. Local legends tell of great treasures that lie buried beneath the temple, but despite many weeks of searching no doorway has been found.

On the top of the temple stands a square stone altar. A small totem stands in the center of this, surrounded by a pattern of sixteen carved tiles. Examining them closely you discover an intricate series of mechanisms which allow the tiles to switch places and turn over, which reveals that each tile has a stone side and a gold side. Carvings on each side of the pillar indicate that a sequence of four key patterns must be made with the tiles to open the temple. Can you be the first to unlock the secrets of Codinca?

In Codinca, each player has control of a set of four matching symbol tiles: Air, Water, Earth or Fire. Players take turns attempting to move their tiles into a series of four specific key patterns indicated on the key discs drawn at the beginning of the game; those patterns are a block of four, a line of four, four corners (can be four corners of any nine tiles as well as outside corners) and a diagonal line of four.

On each turn a player must either switch and flip one of their own tiles with any adjacent tile, or switch one of their tiles with any adjacent tile and switch the same or another of their tiles with any adjacent tiles or flip two tiles, one of which must be one of their own tiles. In addition, players are allocated three Spirit Card that gives them the bonus move choice of Line Push or Rotate Four. This allows players to disguise their planned moves. On the back of the Spirt Card is a Trap Pattern. This can be used to change a set display of tiles from gold to stone and visa versa to match the pattern on the Trap Pattern. Players can match their required patterns in any order, and the first player to match all patterns wins.
131568.name: Codinca
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 121 - Codinca Kickstarter project with BackSpindle Games
Episode 66 - Codes and Keys
Episode 80- Cry Havoc and Our Still Gotta’ Get/Play List
The Game Pit Podcast: Episode 63 - UK Games Expo 2016
The Polyhedron Collider Cast - UK Games Expo 2016

131570.name: Inner City
131570.description:
From inside the book,

"Inner City is a contemporary role-playing game. That is, the players in the game assume the roles of the characters in Inner City while playing. In order to play this game, one of the players must assume the role of City Master, the referee of the game. The City Master must, with the help of this rule book, pass arbitrary judgement upon the actions of the players in the game and the outcomes of these actions. The other players imagine themselves as, or in other words, assume the roles of, people in a slightly alters modern-day city. Generally speaking, the city of Inner City is what a man from another planet might expect of an average American city after watching several days of prime-time television. Rampant violence, corruption, good cops, bad cops, villainous criminals, and organized crime are the mainstay of Inner City. So!, be your favorite crook, cop, private investigator, or whatever, and above all have fun!"

Contents

Inner City Rule Book
Game Map
Set Of Dice
Sheets Of Play Money

131571.name: Family Ties: Back into the Fire
131571.description:
From the front page:
Family Ties
A Three-Round Shadowrun 3rd Edition Virtual Seattle Adventure
Round 2: Back into the Fire
By Scott Spencer, T. J. Lucas & Jason I. Gonding

It has been away since you got fragged in the last charlie foxtrot, and Claudia has another job for you. Things can only get better... right?

131572.name: Family Ties: Fit to be Tied
131572.description:
From the front page:
Family Ties
A Three-Round Shadowrun 3rd Edition Virtual Seattle Adventure
Round 3: Fit to be Tied
By Scott Spencer, T. J. Lucas & Jason I. Gonding

One more to the breach? Mr. Johnson calls you in to take care of some unfinished business in this conclusion to the Family Ties event.

131575.name: Grunting: The Race for Fire
131575.description:
From the publisher:

It is a time before time. When men and dinosaurs roamed the earth together, and the wheel had just been invented. Men and women roamed the plains in their loincloths, hunting mammoth, and creating the first communities. Language is just starting to find its feet, and some bright little cave-sparks have begun to harness the power of the landscape and the animals around them to produce higher standards of living for their fellow men. However, one thing is missing, FIRE! With fire, men can have metals, heat, better food, warmth, stronger, deadlier weapons, and command the fear of the animals around them. Fire is indeed mighty, and it’s what you need to get to survive.

You do not have FIRE. But someone nearby does, or knows how to get it. The FIRE must be yours…

Welcome to Grunting: The Race for Fire.

User note:

Players are restricted from communicating with each other except via drawings and a limited game vocabulary of 60 words or so.

131576.name: Concurrent
131576.description:
Concurrent is a tabletop adaptation of the PC game, Risk 2, which is a computer adaptation of the classic board game, Risk.

Instead of the standard turn-taking that occurs in Risk, Concurrent utilizes a system where the players determine their troop deployment and attacks simultaneously.

The game consists of a game board, representing various countries and territories across the Earth, with connections between the countries by borders and some lines across continents and to island countries/territories. In addition, there are cards which have the various countries/territories listed on the card, and plastic figures which represent the player's army.

At the beginning of the game, all cards are passed out to the players, which represents the starting countries for each player. Afterward, the players are allowed a certain number of army units, relative to the total number of players, which they are allow to place on their starting countries.

At the beginning of each round, players are given a piece of paper to write all their actions on. Included is new unit deployment (based on total countries controlled, largest connected empire, continents controlled, and any matching card set the player can turn in), attacks, and the player's surge attack. Players may attack any country using army units they control on adjacent countries, but must leave at least one unit in their country as a defender. In addition, players may elect to make one surge attack, where if one of their attacks is successful, after all other attacks are resolved, they may make one more attack to attempt to conquer another country.

Once all players have completed their decisions for the round, they reveal said decisions, deploy new units, and announce all attacks. If there are any border clashes (two countries trying to attack each other), they are resolved first. Battles are resolved using custom 12-sided dice. There are multiple dice that are rolled relative to the army size. Each die is numbered 1-6, but the distribution of numbers changes relative to the army size (eg. the larger the army, the more likely the die is to roll higher numbers). Each player rolls the die, with the player rolling the lowest number losing a number of units relative to the smallest army (the larger the army, the more units lost per roll). In the event of a tie on the die roll, both players reroll. The battle is over once one attacking army in the border clash is eliminated.

After border clashes are resolved, mass invasions are resolved. Mass invasions occur when multiple countries attack the same country. This can be multiple armies from one player, or more than one. Mass invasions are resolved the same as border clashes, the only difference being that, unlike border clashes where there is not a specific attacker, the attacking player wins ties. Just like border clashes, the player who loses the roll also loses units relative to the smallest army size in the battle. The mass invasion is completed when one of the armies is eliminated.

Invasions are then resolved, which are the same as mass invasions, but are only from one country to another. After invasions are resolved, spoils of war are resolved. Spoils of war occur when two or more players attack the same country in a mass invasion and multiple attacking armies remain. Spoils of war are resolved like border clashes, where ties are resolved with a reroll.

After all attacks are resolved, players will resolve the surge attack they noted on their paper. Surge attacks are resolved like invasions, or mass invasions if multiple players surge into country. In the event of a successful mass invasion surge attack, the players resolve the conquest with a spoils of war.

Each round occurs the same as listed above, until one player finishes the round with a previously agreed upon control limit (60% control of countries, 80%, etc). That player is the winner of Concurrent!

131577.name: NFL Kicker 13
131577.description:
Experience the glory of being an NFL’s top kicker!

Play the ultimate football game of the season on mobile, featuring all 32 NFL teams and the authentic 2012 uniforms and equipment.

Pick your favorite team, customize your jersey and kick field goals and punts across 3 game modes.

Take the challenge and compete with Facebook friends, unlock classic & alternate team uniforms and upgrade your stadium into a high tech temple to football.

Source: The Developer Website.

131578.name: Amiga 2000
131578.description:
Aimed at the high-end market, the original Europe-only model adds a Zorro II backplane, implemented in programmable logic, to the custom Amiga chipset used in the Amiga 1000. Later improved models have redesigned hardware using the more highly integrated A500 chipset, with the addition of a gate-array called "Buster", which integrates the Zorro subsystem.[4] This also enabled handoff of the system control to a coprocessor slot device, and implemented the full video slot for add-on video devices.
Like the earlier Amiga 1000 and most typical PCs, and unlike the Amiga 500, the A2000 came in a desktop case with a separate keyboard. The case was taller than the A1000 to accommodate expansion cards, two 3.5" and one 5.25" drive bays and, like a traditional PC, it lacks the "keyboard garage" of the Amiga 1000. The A2000 has space for five Zorro II proprietary expansion slots, two 16-bit and two 8-bit ISA slots, a CPU upgrade slot, a video slot, and includes a battery-backed real-time clock.[5]
The A2000 offered graphics capabilities only exceeded among its contemporaries by the Macintosh II, a system which sold for about five times the Amiga's price. Also like the A1000, the A2000 was sold only by specialty computer dealers.
The A2000 was largely succeeded by the Amiga 3000 in 1990.

Source: Wikipedia, "Amiga 2000", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

131580.description:
A casual, resource-management game about nature, beauty, and connections.

This is an unusual game because it is dual-purpose. Firstly, and most importantly, it is a good game: fun and interesting, and especially so when played with friends. However, at the same time, it is also designed to share and promote understanding and appreciation of nature.

The game is centered around plant cards. Every plant card has a point value, and the winner of the game is the first player to collect 10 points. Plant Cards grow and change in response to randomly drawn Event Cards, and player-used Resource Cards. There are thirteen different species of plant in this game, and each has its own personality, which means that each responds to Events and Resources in different ways.

To be successful, you must collect, trade, and play Resources in order to improve the plants on your own landscape, foil your opponents' plans, protect yourself from dangerous Events, and defend yourself from the snarkiness of your opponents.
131580.name: Fire and Flora

131581.description:
From the official website:

"Soccero is the football boardgame that delivers the most exciting and realistic football experience! The game consists of two players or managers moving the player figures and the ball on the game board using dice. The player who has scored more goals by the end of the game wins. The game is designed to serve the skilled and strategic mind - but just as in real football, luck can always bring an unexpected challenge!

The Basic Rules make it easy and fun to get into the game. Later the managers may choose to follow the Extended Rules. The extended rules will add more realistic football features to the game turning it more challenging. The extended rules contain special situations such as goal kick, corner kick, throw-in, free kicks and penalty kick."

The second edition of Soccero has upgraded components and updated rules including a new kick die to determine routes of the ball.

Re-implements

Soccero (first edition)
131581.name: Soccero (second edition)

131582.name: Plaque Attackers
131582.description:
When brushing isn’t enough the Plaque Attackers come to the rescue to save your teeth from decay. But this time they really have their work cut out for them as the four plaque leaders are rushing forward for a tasty meal of tooth!

Out last the Plaque Lords attack until they give up and leave for an easier meal.

Plaque Attackers is a dice rolling game where you and your allies work together to stay alive until the survival meter runs out.

131583.name: Nový mejdan
131583.description:
Go on a real party with unrestrained entertainment and a number of pitfalls. The game is great, especially when meeting the company of close friends. Joint moments full of fun!

Each player has two same color pieces with which progresses to a party and then back home to bed after party. First player marching with one, and only after a successful trip with the other one.

Players roll a dice, make move and complete tasks; such as beg coin from other players, make them give their hair, tell some story etc.

---
Vydej se na opravdový mejdan s nevázanou zábavou a množstvím nástrah. Hra je skvělá, zejména sejde-li se společnost blízkých přátel. Společné chvíle plné zábavy!

131584.name: Cestujeme po hradech a zámcích
131584.description:
The purpose of this game is to travel around the Czech countryside and visit 12 different castles, learn about their history and learn to manage given resources.
The goal is to get all cards and castles (12 in total, from each of the three colors for 4 pieces) - each card with a picture of another castle.
A player can end the game, even if the card gets at least 10 castles, while he may miss a maximum of two colors of 1.
Thus, the game ends but only in the case where this is for itself to be favorable. In the event that the game fails to get at least 10 different cards, the game ends when all the pictures of castles have been played.
The player, who has the most money at end wins, even if he does not have all the cards and castles.

---
Cílem hry je získání kartiček všech hradů a zámků (celkem 12, od každé ze tří barev po 4 kusech) — každá kartička s obrázkem jiného hradu.
Hráč může hru ukončit i tehdy, když získá kartičky alespoň 10 hradů a zámků, přičemž mu smí chybět od dvou barev nejvýše po 1 kuse.
Takto však ukončuje hru pouze v tom případě, pokládá-li to pro sebe za výhodné. V případě, že se během hry nepodaří získat alespoň 10 různých kartiček, končí hra tehdy, když jsou všechny obrázky hradů a zámků vydány.
Vyhrává ten hráč, kterému zůstane nejvíc peněz, i když nemá všechny kartičky hradů a zámků.

131586.name: Born by Fiends
131586.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

The Companion has gone dark, and now something stirs in the heart of Elturel itself. What chance does the honor- bound church of Torm have when faced with an adversary that has neither morals nor compassion? A Living Forgotten Realms adventure set in Elturgard for characters of the Heroic tier (levels 1-10). This adventure is the first part of a trilogy; we recommend that you play ELTU4-1, ELTU4-2, and ELTU4-3 in order with the same character, if possible.

rpgseries: SPEC - Living Forgotten Realms Core Special Adventures
131587.name: Raging Shadows
131587.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

“Shadows long at rest stir, and they hunger for all Faerûn.” Was the oracle Saharel talking about Netheril? Are they responsible for the dark forces now raging in the Dalelands? This is a Special (combat intensive) Living Forgotten Realms adventure set in the Dalelands for characters of the Paragon tier (levels 11-20).

This adventure is chapter two, and the Paragon tier introduction, to the Desolation series. The series has both Heroic and Paragon tier adventures and it is not expected that a player can play both tracks with the same PC.

131588.name: The Price of Freedom
131588.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

The Dusk Ports of Returned Abeir are considered fairly nice places to live. That is, if you aren’t one of the citizens their cruel ruler, the Green Duchess, decides to devour for a snack. A Living Forgotten Realms adventure involving the Scions of Amber meta-organization set in Returned Abeir for characters of the Paragon tier (levels 11-20). This adventure is the first part of the Scions of Hope trilogy.

131589.name: A Dream Frozen in Amber
131589.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

The swallowed stronghold of Djerad Kusold has long been sought by those hoping to use its cache of dragonbane amber to finally rid Returned Abeir of the last of its dragon rulers. But can a legend truly bring salvation, or is it just a dream frozen in amber? A Living Forgotten Realms adventure involving the Scions of Amber meta-organization set in Returned Abeir for characters of the Paragon tier (levels 11-20). This adventure continues a Major Quest that began in ABER4-1 and concludes in ABER4-3.

131590.name: A Little Rebellion
131590.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

The cruel reign of dragons within the Dusk Ports is a misery that can be suffered no longer. Will the spoils of a recent expedition to Melabrauth be enough to spark a revolution to finally drive the heartless tyrants out? A Living Forgotten Realms adventure involving the Scions of Amber meta-organization set in Returned Abeir for characters of the Paragon tier (levels 11-20). This is the third chapter and the conclusion of the Scions of Hope Major Quest, which began in ABER4-1 and continued in ABER4-2.

131591.name: Adventure in Talis
131591.description:
In this Interactive Fantasy Text Adventure Game, your mission is to help the Village of Talis from trouble. Adventure of Talis combines BGG, VGG and RPGG together:

- VGG: the final file will be a small, single .exe file, and need .NET Framework at least ver 2.0. Recently all Windows version already have .NET Framework ver 3.0 or higher, so it can be played easily.

- RPGG: you start with STR=1, INT=1, AGL=1, HP=1, GOLD=0, TIME=0. You will improve your stats along the way.

- BGG: you are summoned to a village (the Village of Talis), and the people there play modern board games! (what? why? how? Nope, I will not spoil the surprise ).

And: in the game you will find many clues about many games. If you can mention the answer, you will get GeekScore. This is a geek side-mission, for fun!

This game has a NOTES button that will bring you to the Notes Screen, which features:
- Auto map. It draws the map as you go around between locations!
- A place to write notes & clues
- Mission & progress reminder
So: no need to prepare any paper+pencil/pen!
(of course, you may ignore the NOTES button and do it the old fashioned way: draw your own map!)

Download the game on www.jackdgames.com (on FREE GAMES menu)

131592.name: Policajti
131592.description:
Ever wondered how life is at the police station? Definitely do not expect a large bureaucracy, you'd better get ready diaphragm! As a target for criminal bullet as a torture device laughter ...
To play, you will need:
Two six-sided dice
Pencil and paper for counting points
Matches or coins to progress cards and inserted them into action
Try out what it's like to be a true guardian of the law. Learn to use service weapons to fight criminals, starting with hooligans and thieves, through repulsive deviants, to the rough and dangerous mafia assassins. You collect royalty, grant and fulfill orders. And the best is awarded the title police president!

Each player starts with four random cards. Then you prepare pencil and paper which is for tracking current status of policemen level; very level means more cards during turn. At each turn, players have a total of three events. Usually, they will all revolve around playing cards. The most important thing in the entire game cards are interventions and arrest that brings gamers the most points to policemen. To do this you need set of card and support of a partner or have necessary equipment (body armor, torch etc.).
Includes: 108 playing cards, rules, ranks, police summary


Zajímá vás, jak vypadá život na policejní stanici? Rozhodně nečekejte velkou úředničinu, raději si připravte bránice! Jako terč pro zločineckou kulku, i jako mučící nástroj smíchu...
Ke hře budete potřebovat:
Dvě šestistěnné kostky
Tužku a papír na počítání bodů
Zápalky nebo mince na rozpracované karty a do nich vložené akce


Vyzkoušíte si, jaké to je, být opravdovým strážcem zákona. Naučíte se používat služební zbraně, bojovat s kriminálními živly, počínaje chuligány a zlodějíčky, přes odpudivé devianty, až po drsné mafiány a nebezpečné vrahy. Budete sbírat hodnosti, udílet i plnit rozkazy. A ten nejlepší získá titul polecejní prezident!
Obsahuje: 108 herních karet, pravidla, hodnosti, policejní přehled

131593.name: Doctor Who: Adventures in Time and Space – Gamemaster's Screen (11th Doctor)
131593.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




user summary

a four panel Gamemasters Screen for Doctor Who: Adventures in Time and Space – The Roleplaying Game (11th Doctor)

publisher blurb
Packed with all the information a Gamemaster needs for easy reference during a session of Doctor Who, this 'deluxe' thick screen will last for years of Adventures in Time and Space.

131594.name: The Adventures of Star Saver
131594.description:
User Summary

Tony and his sister are LAPD working the streets when they get abducted by aliens and separated. Tony meets a mech and they decide to team up to find Tony's sister. Run and gun as Tony and find power-ups to help you stop the alien invasion.

131595.name: Aerostar
131595.description:
After the end of the Sixth World War, the Earth has been rendered inhospitable and uninhabitable by humanity. The Intergalactic Council ruled that Earth could once again be used by humans and sent people there to restore civilization there. Meanwhile, mutants have prospered in the long-lost wastelands of Earth and were unwilling to allow the humans to have it again. The Intergalactic Council has sent in a lone fighter called Aerostar to defend the Earth from a second act of total destruction.

Source: Wikipedia, "Aerostar (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

131596.name: All-Star Baseball 99
131596.description:
User Summary

The first game in the All-Star Baseball series, featuring season play and extra features like home run derby.

131597.name: Altered Space: A 3-D Alien Adventure
131597.description:
Altered Space: A 3-D Alien Adventure is a 1991 video game produced for the Nintendo Game Boy. The basic concept is that the player is an astronaut trapped on an alien spaceship who has to try to find his way out while avoiding aliens and continually replenishing his oxygen supply. This was the first isometric view game on the Game Boy.

Source: Wikipedia, "Altered Space", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

131598.name: Amazing Tater
131598.description:
Amazing Tater is a puzzle video game for the Game Boy from Atlus. The game features a password system. It is the sequel to Kwirk.

The player must guide a potato to the exit of each level, which consists of several obstacles. By pushing crates, the player fills up holes that can then be crossed. Different shaped crates and holes create puzzle like situations. The player must also manipulate rotation devices to reach the goal.

There are four different modes in the game. These include a practice mode, a "normal" puzzle mode, a mode specially designed for beginning players and an "action" mode containing two stories (either Mega Picnic or Puzzle Forest).

Source: Wikipedia, "Amazing Tater", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

131599.name: Arcade Classic No. 2
131599.description:
User Summary

A compilation cartridge featuring the arcade games Centipede and Millipede.

131600.name: One Epic Knight
131600.description:
One Epic Knight is an endless run game for the iPhone, iPad, and iPod Touch where you play as... one epic knight, recovering stolen Loot from a winding medieval dungeon.

The Epic Knight is always running – you swipe left or right to change lanes, and also swipe left or right to turn corners. The Knight will jump if you swipe upwards, and slide if you swipe downwards. Use these moves to position the Knight to avoid traps, collect Loot, pick up Swords and Shields to defend himself, and snag other goodies like Meat and Mana Crystals.

The dungeon is perilous! Be aware of collapsed walls, spike traps, chasms, and of course, Gorks and Jelly Cubes. These are all among many dangers the Epic Knight will encounter.

You can spend your hard-earned Loot to improve your Sword and Shield, boost the effectiveness of Rampage and Mana Madness, and even make more valuable Loot appear in the dungeon. Also, there are lots of Potions that you can buy to make the Epic Knight even more epic! For more information on all of these items, check the Info section of the website.

Source: The Developer Website.

131601.name: Arcade Classics (GB)
131601.description:
User Summary

A compilation title featuring the arcade games: Super Breakout and Battlezone.

131602.name: Atomic Punk
131602.description:
Atomic Punk, released in Europe as Dynablaster and in Japan as Bomber Boy, is a video game released for the Game Boy by Hudson Soft and licensed by Nintendo, as part of the Bomberman series. It was the first game of the series to be released on the Game Boy.

There are four modes of gameplay in Atomic Punk, including two single player modes and two multiplayer game modes.

Source: Wikipedia, "Atomic Punk", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

131603.name: Barbie Game Girl
131603.description:
User Summary

Barbie needs an outfit for her upcoming date with Ken. Guide Barbie through 6 levels of mayhem so that she can make it to her date on time.

131604.name: Bart Simpson's Escape From Camp Deadly
131604.description:
Bart and Lisa go to spend the summer at a camp, which proves to be the dangerous Camp Deadly run by Mr. Burns's nephew, Ironfist Burns. His intentions are to make sure that the children suffer and have as little fun as possible.

Bart Simpson's Escape from Camp Deadly is a side-scrolling 2D platform game. It is single-player-only, and the player controls Bart. Lisa's role in the stages is giving Bart boomerangs to use against the various enemies. His default weapon is spit wads, and in the cafeteria stages: the barely edible food offered at the camp.

Source: Wikipedia, "Escape from Camp Deadly", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

131605.name: Battle Arena Toshinden (GB)
131605.description:
User Summary

A 2D fighting game based mostly on the Playstation game of the same name, with some story and characters slightly altered.

131606.name: Wordner
131606.description:
A party-style card game where players use their creativity to finish prompts by building off of starter words. These are judged by another player who selects his/her favorite. The player who submitted this is then awarded a point.

The game begins with one player being chosen as the judge. A blue prompt card and an orange starter card are pulled from the deck and read out loud to everyone.

The remaining players finish the prompt by writing a phrase that incorporates at least one of the starter words. These phrases are known as wordners, and may make starter words plural, change their tense, and add other words to them.

The players submit their wordners on a piece of paper to the player on the judge's left, who reads them out loud. The judge selects his/her favorite, and the creator of this is awarded a point represented by the round's blue card.

Now, the player to the judge's left becomes the judge and a new round begins. The first player to collect 5 blue cards wins!

131607.name: Reservoir Dogs
131607.description:
"Reservoir Dogs" The board game

Six professional criminals are hired by Joe Cabot and his son Nice Guy Eddie for a job. Not know each other and remain anonymous, hidden under color names: Mr. Orange, Mr. White, Mr. Pink, Mr. Blonde, Mr. Brown and Mr. Blue. Prepare thoroughly robbery diamond store, but police shows up unexpectedly at the time of making a slaughter robbery resulting in the deaths of several police officers, and employees. All suspect that there is a traitor infiltrated in the group.

Thieves who manage to survive and get to the warehouse with the diamonds will win the game, but there is an undercover agent who will try to sabotage them. Police will also further complicated the getaway. Besides the briefcase with diamonds can change hands and perhaps one of the robbers take not to share with others

131609.name: Monopoly Casino: Vegas Edition
131609.description:
User Summary

A host of classic casino games set in Vegas and played against the typical array of (AI) metallic Monopoly characters. Adjustments to the game rules are quick and easy, navigated via point-and-click menus. Games are played mainly with the mouse.

131610.name: LOOPZ
131610.description:
" The memory game that gets you moving"

Tune up both your reflexes and memory by waving your hand in loops that can sense your motions. Seven game modes available for 1-4 players, including a mode that allows you to create your own music.

- Repeat the Beat
- Rhythm and Flow
- Versus Mode
- Reflex master
- Musicology
- Freestyle DJ
- Music studio

(Battery included!)

Players compete against each other or the game by repeating sounds or combinations of sounds played by the game. Moving your hand over a sensor in the loops triggers a correct or incorrect response from the game. Sometimes you must use both hands to trigger a correct response. The game demands both memory ability to replay the right sequence of sounds as well as dexterity in moving your hands to the correct location(s). The non-game modes teach music scales and you can create songs with the correct hand placement in the open loops or "LOOPZ".

131611.name: Tricky Wildlife
131611.description:
In Tricky Wildlife, each of the players is a wildlife manager who's trying to keep many different animal species in his wildlife park, while also preserving the food chain of predators and prey and helping endangered species.

The food chain of animals has top predators who eat the lower predators, who in turn eat the next species down the "animal pyramid", who in turn eats the lowest prey – for example: Sharks eat Penguins, Penguins eat Fish, Fish eat Shrimp. Missing a prey animal means that the higher animal type starves, which gives you penalty points as a wildlife manager. Thus, you want to maintain all species in your wildlife park, especially the rarest species as they give you prestige points.

In each of the eight game years (i.e., rounds), you can add 1 or 2 animal groups to your park; each group first consists of 1-4 animals of one species. When you attract them to your park, these are young animals. They can grow old and die naturally after five years, but to do this they need enough prey to feed on during their lifetime. Otherwise they starve. At the same time, higher predators in the food chain can eat these animals.

An animal's age is shown by its location on your lifetime track, which uses four sticks to divide the track into five sections (i.e., years). After each year, you shift your rightmost stick to the leftmost side, which ages all of your animals by one year.

When you don't have all four different species, you gain one penalty point per missing species (and higher level animals may starve). If you have the most (or second-most) of an animal which was rare before, you score 1-2 prestige points. After year eight, you add the number of your animal groups to your prestige point total to calculate your final score.

The challenge in Tricky Wildlife is to balance your desire for prestige points with the need to preserve your complete food chain.

131612.name: Fishy!
131612.description:
It’s getting pretty crowded down here, and if you want to last in this underwater arena, you’ll need to outsmart and outmaneuver the larger predators, all the while building your strength by eating any smaller prey you can find. The pond is yours for the eating. It’s up to you to feed or be fed upon

Source: The Game Website.

Arrow keys direct your fish about the watery field.

131613.name: Fishy!
131613.description:
Move your Fishy! Collide with smaller fish to eat them, but avoid bigger fish who will eat you!

Source: The Game Website.

Use the arrow keys to navigate your fish about the dangerous waters.

131614.name: Façade
videogamehonor: 2004 IGF Awards Seumas McNally Grand Prize Nominee
131614.description:
Façade puts the player in the role of a close friend of Grace and Trip, a couple who recently invited the player to their home for cocktails. This pleasant gathering, however, is somewhat damaged by the clear domestic confrontation between Grace and Trip upon the player's entry. Making full use of the incorporated language processing software, Façade allows the player to type sentences to "speak" with the couple, either supporting them through their troubles, driving them farther apart, or being thrown out of the apartment.

Incorporating elements of both video gaming and drama, Façade takes advantage of voice acting and a 3-D environment, as well as natural language processing and other advanced artificial intelligence routines, to provide a robust interactive fiction experience. The player can take an active role in the conversation, pushing the topic one way or another, as in an interactive stage-play. These stage-plays are stored as script text files which can be read after the player has finished.

Façade was released for PC in July 2005, as a free download from the InteractiveStory.net web site.

Source: Wikipedia, "Façade (interactive story)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

131615.name: Neo Scavenger
131615.description:
How long can you survive the post-apocalyptic wastelands of NEO Scavenger? In the near-future, supernatural activity and human warfare have fragmented mankind into pockets of civilization struggling to survive in wild and dangerous lands. You awaken alone in an abandoned facility with no food nor water, and only a hospital gown and some mysterious items as clues to your identity.

NEO Scavenger is a flash-based browser game, where you must survive in the wasteland long enough to figure out who you are. Each turn you must decide where to go, how to scavenge for supplies, and how to deal with anything and anyone you encounter. And with each passing minute, the pit in your stomach grows, your dehydration worsens, your muscles tire, and your body temperature drops in the cold autumn air. Choose your starting abilities carefully, because they and your wit are the only tools you have in the apocalypse!

Source: The Game Website.

131616.description:
Take your place alongside Jules Verne's most famous characters – or try to anyway! Captain Nemo is ready to designate a second officer on the Nautilus, and you need to prove your knowledge in five key areas that are dear to the Captain.

Over the six rounds of Nautilus, you must take divers to the bottom of five fields of knowledge: Science, Exploration, Navigation, Engineering and War. In each round, five Domain cards are placed face up on the game board, then players take five Diver cards in hand, with values ranging from 1 to 14. At the end of the round, the Diver values played on both sides of the Nautilus determine how the Domain cards are allocated. Special cards grant special abilities to each player.

At the end of the game whoever has scored the most points in a field claims that field – and whoever wins a majority of the five fields wins!
131616.name: Nautilus

131617.name: Microsoft Xbox DVD Movie Playback Kit
videogamehwversion: Microsoft Xbox DVD Movie Playback Kit
131617.description:
User Summary

An infrared receiver that plugs into the Xbox and a standard TV-looking remote that enables wireless movie playback.

131618.name: Mad Barrington's Gyre
131618.description:
In Mad Barrington's Gyre players compete to accumulate the shares worth the most bottle caps by the end of the game. "Why bottle caps?" Because in the post-apocalyptic future of flying castles, giant robber baron cockroaches and mutated broccoli.... bottle caps are the coin of the realm.

Each player starts with a identical set of cards and can play, buy or sell cards each turn that improve their deck's purchasing power or allow them to impact the value of shares (Guns, Ammo, Food, Water, Meds & Pennies) directly or indirectly through rumour cards or affecting the number of stock value cards in play.
