Shares are bought and banked separately from each player's main deck but the stock value cards that determine the value of the shares are bought and sold from a common pool that is manipulated by the players throughout the game.

As well, each player has a character card that gives them a distinct bonus in the game ranging from Humbles Wuggles-Roach's ability to buy Ammo shares at a reduced rate to Lord Fat Pockets ' improved starting bottle caps and Mad Barrington's ability to buy rumour cards on the cheap.

131619.name: Bug in a Rug
131619.description:
From the game box:

"The Game of Rhyme and Reason.
In this hilarious cross between Chinese whispers and drawing charades you start by inventing a rhyme... Anything from "A Rat on a Mat"... to "A Fish on a Dish"... or even "Plaice in Space" The next player then has to draw your rhyme! Moving clockwise, the initial rhyme is hidden and the drawing interpreted as a new rhyme... ... and that is where the fun begins! With everyone drawing and guessing at the same time it's a crazy, frantic, befuddled muddle of a game!"

At the end of a round points are scored for drawing a phrase correctly and for recognising the original rhyme. Several rounds are played and the winner is the first person to score 20 points.
Contents: game pad, pencils, score pad, rules

131620.name: Naruto: Path of the Ninja
131620.description:
User Summary

Naruto: Path of the Ninja is a video game released in Japan for the Game Boy Advance. For its US release, it was ported to the Nintendo DS.

The sequel to this game is Naruto RPG 2: Chidori vs. Rasengan. That game was skipped in the US, with Naruto: Path of the Ninja 2, the third game in the series, being released instead.

131621.name: Naruto: Ninja Destiny
131621.description:
User Summary

Naruto: Ninja Destiny (Shinobi Retsuden in Japan) is the first 3D Naruto game to come to the Nintendo DS.

It has sixteen characters ranging from Gaara and Rock Lee to one-tailed Naruto and lv. 2 Cursed Seal form Sasuke. You can battle against the computer, play against your friends wirelessly, enjoy a single player story mode, or single player mode where you fight several computer-controlled opponents. The story mode goes from the Neji/Naruto fight in the Chūnin Exams until the dispute between the three Sannin. A sequel to this game was later released.

131622.name: Das Schleswig-Holstein-Spiel
131622.description:
A simple trivia game played on a map of the German State of Schleswig-Holstein.

A long track winds around the State, starting in Hamburg and ending on the Isle of Sylt. Movement is decided by a die. There are four categories of questions:
A = General knowledge
K = Culture
W = Economic
P = Politics and History
Obviously, all the 500 questions in the game have some connection to Schleswig Holstein.

There is an interesting shortcut that may be taken where no questions are asked. Instead you roll the die and if you get a number from 1 to 5, you move two spaces. But if you roll a 6, you must go back 15 spaces.

First to reach the end (Ziel) wins.

On a little bit of extra trivia, the board shows clearly that the Eastern neighbour to Schleswig-Holstein is, in fact, the DDR (East Germany). As the game was published in 1989 and the wall came down that year, then this might be the last non-historical game to feature the DDR as a neighbouring country.

131623.name: Crazy Cakes
131623.description:
Crazy Cakes is a race game where players try to be the first to stack their 12 triangular wooden pieces on top of each other to represent 12 layers of a cake. Be the first to match the recipe card and win that card.

The challenge is that each piece is 3 sided, and each player has two of each flavor but the sides are different. EX: Each player has two strawberry pieces - 1 piece will have two vanilla sides while the other has two chocolate sides, use the wrong side of that piece and the puzzle (cake) can't be made. This is when the frantic fun begins!

It's the "Game of High-Stacking fun."

131624.name: Check vs Mate
131624.description:
Chess - the unrivalled champion of strategy games has been attracting players of all ages for centuries. Check vs. Mate takes up the mission of adapting the time honoured classic for the 21st century, seeking to breathe new life into the board-game without abandoning the essential concepts that have made it so timeless.

Queen from B4 to E7, checkmate. While normally the game would be finished here with little fanfare, Check vs. Mate takes the moment of victory a step further. The queen suddenly comes to life and gracefully glides across the game board towards the King, a victorious smirk adorning her face. As she approaches the King's square her hands begin to faintly glow, then suddenly plumes of fire spring forth from her outstretched hands and engulf the King, leaving nothing more than a pile of ashes on the square formerly occupied by one of the competing rulers of the checkered kingdom. Now that's checkmate!

Source: The Publisher Website.

131625.name: Ark of Lost Souls
131625.description:
From the publisher's webpage:

For my house. For my father. For my vengeance, and death to that which cannot die.”
–Unknown vox transmission, intercepted near Mideal in M34

The Space Hulk Mortis Thule drifts silently through the void of the Jericho Reach, and with it comes devastation, ruin, and woe. Do you dare breach its hull and uncover its sanity-shattering secrets?

Fantasy Flight Games is pleased to announce the upcoming release of Ark of Lost Souls, a supplement for Deathwatch! This unique tome is both a three-part adventure set onboard an infamous Space Hulk, and a Game Master’s guide to Space Hulks in general.

Told over thee gripping chapters, Ark of Lost Souls’ included adventure will take your Kill-team to the brink of both sanity and survival:


Peril on the Horizon—En route to break a siege at a newly-founded Watch Station, the Kill-team is waylaid and met with a terrible fate.
Survival—Stranded and alone, the Kill-team must find their way to salvation, locating unexpected allies along the way.
Darkness at the Core—The Kill-team must overcome the horrors of the Mortis Thule and make their escape, but it may cost more than they are willing to sacrifice.


What’s more, GMs can use the included Space Hulk Generator to create unique adventures set in the forlorn corridors of their own cursed Space Hulks!

131626.name: Stavropol Bashni
131626.description:
Stavropol Bashni is a stacking game from the Checkers family. It features shared pieces. As in all Checkers games, the aim of the game is to leave the opponent without a legal move. It is played on a traditional 8x8 Checkers board with stones that are suitable for Bashni, i.e. stackable and with kings being turned men or pieces of a different color, as most traditional Russian sets are.

The rules follow Bashni. In short, when a man or king is captured, it is not taken from the board, but put under the piece which captures the men. This way, stacks are formed. Generally, to topmost of piece of a stack decides which player the stack belongs to, how the stack moves, it is the piece that is promoted on reaching a back rank, and it is the piece that is captured. If the topmost piece of a stack is captured and the next piece at the top belongs to the opponent, the stack switches allegiance and belongs to the opponent then.

The difference to Bashni is that pieyes are shared - as in Stavropol Checkers. A player may move stacks owned by the opponent, too, according to the rules for the topmost piece. The exact winning condition is therefor: a player loses when it is his turn and the stacks belonging to him have no legal move.

Online play:

igGameCenter

131627.name: Stage Chaser
131627.description:
Stage Chaser is a bicycle race themed board game. It allows players to compete against each other in any of the world’s greatest bike races; including ones they’ve just made up.

The board is made up of interchangeable terrain mats which, when fitted together, form the profile of a stage. The stage can be flat, hilly or mountainous – whatever the players choose.

Each player is in a charge of star rider. They move their rider along the board by playing action cards, whose values vary according to the kind of terrain they are played on. The majority of the action cards show other riders in the race (team mates of the star riders) who can be slipstreamed, but there are also ‘attack’ and ‘block!’ cards. Players need energy tokens to move forward when they play attack cards and these are fought over during the race. Block! cards allow players to sabotage the moves of their competitors.

The aim of the game is to cross the finish line first. If just one stage is played, the winner of the stage is the winner of the game. If more than one stage is played, the winner of the game is the player with the best overall score when all the stage results have been added together.

131628.name: 2 in 1
131628.description:
This two player game is packed in an small box and offers two variants.
1. Each player has four pawns which are placed in the corners of the board, specifically the corners that present one field (dot). The object of the game is to reach the corner of the opponent with all four pawns (like Halma). Jumping pawns, both own and adversary's, is allowed.
2. The second is an Asalto-like game. One of the players has only one pawn, the other four, The object of the game is to encircle the one pawn. The four pawn player may move his pawns only in de forward direction. The one pawn player can move each desired direction, Jumping is not allowed.

131629.description:
This Promo Research introduces the Stock Market (Borsa).
If a player chose to use this research, he will gain extra money.
131629.name: 1969: Research Promo 2012

131630.name: Memo Grand Prix
131630.description:
A car race game that includes elements of Memory.

Each player is given a set of 20 cards. Your set is shuffled and layed face down in two rows of 10 cards. This will be your 'track'.

Every turn, a player turns over two cards. If they match, his car can move on to one of them if one of the two cards is 'next in line' on the track. Thus, the first thing to do is to get a matched card on one of the two start cards. Having acheived that, you want to get a card face up in row 2, and so on. If you do not find a match,your turn is over. If you do find one, you can turn over two more cards and keep going until you fail to expose a matching pair.

The first player to reach row 10 on his track, wins.

131631.name: Battle Unit Zeoth
131631.description:
Battle Unit Zeoth is a scrolling shooter developed by Jaleco for the Game Boy in 1990 which saw a North American port one year later in 1991.

Battle Unit Zeoth takes place in the future where mankind is invaded by a race of alien robots known as the Grein. The Earth’s forces were triumphant in battle and the Grein forces fled the Solar System. However, as they retreated, the Grein left behind a secret underground base filled with self-replicating Grein machines.

Forty-two years after the Earth’s victory, the Grein base opened and a new attack force decimated the city of New Age. To retaliate, Earth’s military has stored a mecha that specializes in alien combat known as the Zeoth. It is the Zeoth’s assignment to stop the attack force, go into the Grein secret base and destroy the mechanical occupants before a new invasion force arrives.

Source: Wikipedia, "Battle Unit Zeoth", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

131632.name: Battletoads (GB)
videogameversion: North American SEGA Game Gear edition
131632.description:
Essentially the player takes on nearly exactly the same type of side scrolling action found in the NES game, with similar but simplified graphics and enemies. It is only a single player game and starts out in a level similar to the NES game as well. The task is also similar, with the player playing as Zitz having to rescue both of his partners, Rash and Pimple.

However, there are plenty of differences in the levels and range in difficulty when encountering enemies or obstacles. The same "over-the-top" finishing combos can also be found in the Game Boy release.

As in the case of the original NES game, the Game Boy game is also notoriously difficult to beat, requiring fast reflexes, memorization of obstacles, and patience.

Source: Wikipedia, "Battletoads (Game Boy)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

131633.name: Zunftblatt (Print Issue 1 - Mar 2009)
rpgissuearticle: Mystery Rummy – Fall 1: Jack the Ripper
Verehrte Leser des Zunftblattes/ Hallo Zunfties
Warhammer Fantasy Rollenspiel - Die alte Welt
Western City - Im Western was Neues
131633.description:
Zunftblatt
Print Issue #1
March 2009

Cover art by Zoe Linnhoff

This issue is focusing on the USA.

131634.name: Cavaliers of Mars
131634.description:
From publisher blurb:

Return now to dying Mars in its last age of glory!

A planet of flashing swords and choking sands, of winking courtesans and lantern-lit canal cities. Mars, where fortune and death are two sides of the same obsidian chit, where lost cities and dry oceans stretch between the last bastions of civilization. Where the First Martians, the monument-builders, are but a haunted memory. Where the Red Martians become decadent and reckless in their last days. Where the Green Martians rule the wastes, remembering a history whose weight would crush a lesser people.

Tonight, find yourself in Vance at festival time. When revolutionaries strike a visiting prince, you’ll need to explore the city’s dark underbelly, before racing across its towered tombs! Save lives, end lives, and earn your water!

Live, fight, and love on Mars, a world of red death and strange mystery, a world of savagery and romance.

Includes:

A complete adventure set in one of dying Mars’ greatest remaining cities.
The innovative Wushu rules, for high-flying, swashbuckling adventure.
Five pre-generated player characters, ready to get into the heart of the action.

131635.name: MTV's Beavis and Butt-Head (GB)
131635.description:
User Summary

Beavis and Butt-Head want to join Todd's gang, and they figure he'll have to let them if they break him out of jail. Work your way through several side-scrolling levels to get to the prison to reach Todd and help him escape.

131636.name: Ultima Forever: Quest for the Avatar
131636.description:
Ultima Forever: Quest for the Avatar, also known as Ultima Forever or Ultima4Ever is a free-to-play, cross-platform, online, action role-playing game developed by Mythic Entertainment and published by Electronic Arts. It is formally a part of the Ultima series. Information was previously released by BioWare in mid-2011 and more information was released on July 11, 2011. It was officially announced at the San Diego Comic-Con International on July 12, 2012 and it was fully released for iOS on August 7, 2013.

Mythic states that the game will provide "fully integrated, cross-platform play".

Gameplay

The game is based upon Ultima IV, but is considered by Mythic to be an "action role-playing game". Ultima Forever includes both online play with a group, as well as a single-player mode. Unlike Ultima IV, there is a Lady British character instead of Lord British. This is due to Richard Garriott retaining the trademark rights after he left Electronic Arts. Mythic has emphasized that the Virtues from the Ultima series will play an important part.

Ultima Forever features a top-down isometric point of view, with "hand-painted backgrounds and 3D characters."

Source: Wikipedia, "Ultima Forever: Quest for the Avatar", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

131639.name: Bionic Battler
131639.description:
User Summary

The robots have rebelled and are looking to take over mankind. You must suit up in your battle suit and take them on in the Labyrinth of War, a deadly maze where they are trying to hunt you down. Find them first and destroy them before they find you.

131640.name: Black Bass: Lure Fishing
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
131640.description:
There are only two lakes to fish at and a limited set of lures. Casting is done on an overhead view with a meter for the direction and another meter for the shadow of the fish. Trout, pike, catfish, and the infamous black bass can all be caught in this game.

The Game Boy Color version allows players to play against 99 AI-controlled fishermen. Tournament hours are twelve non-real time hours long and all locations are fictional. Each game originally came with a 40-page instruction manual and a precautions booklet. Both versions of the game notify players when they have lost their lure and/or their fish through a text-based message. Once a player runs out of a certain kind of fishing lure, it cannot be recovered until the next gameplay.

Source: Wikipedia, "Black Bass: Lure Fishing", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

131643.name: Pyramid (Volume 3, Issue 47 - Sep 2012)
rpgissuearticle: A Brief History of the Thieves' Guild
Random Thought Table: Look at What's Already in the Closet
Safes and How to Open Them
131643.description:
"Steal" Outwits "Steel"!

We're practicing our thievery skills by taking this . . . subject seriously! This month's issue of Pyramid -- the PDF magazine for roleplayers -- is devoted to rogues, crooks, and those who hope to stop them. Our kleptomaniacal compendium includes:


"May the Shadows Guide You" -- Adds to the possibilities presented in GURPS Powers: Divine Favor. Discover a god who grants miracles to rogues and those who promote liberty in all its forms.
"Who's Gonna Buy This?" -- An overview of finding buyers for stolen goods, a GURPS template for a fence, and a sample character suitable for GURPS Banestorm or other fantasy settings.
"A Brief History of the Thieves' Guild" -- A look at how feasible the idea of a cohesive organization of rogues is. GURPS Hot Spots: Constantinople, 527-1204 A.D. author Matt Riggsby examines several real-world, pre-modern criminal groups in this rules-light feature.
"Monster Slavers" -- This issue's Eidetic Memory by GURPS Fourth Edition co-architect David L. Pulver. Step into the shadowy world of those who deal in humanoid laborers. It provides a list of useful gear and a template suitable for GURPS Dungeon Fantasy campaigns.
"The Emperor's Finest" -- A guide to the opposition for criminals in the Roman Empire in the mid-200s A.D. Now you can add more details about the Roman justice system to your campaign set in GURPS Fantasy's "Roma Arcana," GURPS Imperial Rome, or "Roma Universalis" (from Pyramid #3/20: Infinite Worlds). The article gives suggestions for suitable GURPS character traits, as well as three templates for Roman agents and rogues.
"Safes and How to Open Them" -- A brief history of safes and safe-breakers, plus GURPS guidelines and new gear for overcoming all manner of strongboxes.
"Dealing With Rogues" -- Methods for promoting party unity when someone in the group prefers to work outside the law, plus an assortment of professions for folks who want roguish abilities while still holding socially acceptable jobs.


This issue also includes a Random Thought Table that looks at how rogues can use recent GURPS releases, Odds and Ends with adventure ideas to put a spin on old thieving tropes, plus a Murphy's Rules whose humor could sneak up on you. With this month's Pyramid, you'll think you've heisted the motherlode of useful gaming info!

131644.name: Ka-pow! The Superhero Team-up Game
131644.description:
Welcome True Believers! Ka-pow is an action-packed card game of super-heroic mayhem. Create a heroic identity, form a superhero team and then battle the worlds super-villains and save the earth.

Each player takes on the role of a superhero, fighting for truth and justice as part of a superhero team made up of the other player’s superheroes. Your team must foil the diabolical plots of a series of nefarious super-villains and in doing so the superheroes will receive victory points based on their contribution towards defeating each super-villain. At the end of the game the superhero with the most victory points is the winner.

As you will see, the superheroes must work together to defeat each super-villain, otherwise the villain will win and all of the players will lose! However, once all of the super-villains are defeated, only one of the superheroes can win the game. Collecting victory points calls for playing the right card at the right time, so you will need to think very carefully about which cards to use each round and how to use your superpowers in order to score as many points as possible. On the other hand, being too selfish in the use of your cards and superpowers may result in a super-villain being able to carry out their diabolical plot, and if that happens everyone will lose the game. It’s a dreadful dilemma make no mistake – but then nobody said being a superhero was going to be easy!

Compete over 3-5 story arcs to be the most heroic Superhero and earn the adulation of the public.

131645.name: Shinobi: The Ninja Training Game
131645.description:
The land of Nippon is riven by civil war and the leaders of the different factions have a number of secret missions they need carried out. As master of one of the four great Ninja clans you must train your warriors so they are ready to carry out the missions offered. But beware, if you take too long one of your rival clans may undertake a mission before you and steal the rich reward offered for carrying it out.

In Shinobi: Way of the Ninja, you control a ninja clan and must perform different missions in order to obtain wealth and win the game. The missions you are called on to carry out are represented by three Mission cards that will tell you what you need to do (the task), where the mission is to be carried out (the location), and what problems may arise that will hinder you in the missions execution (complications). Each of these things requires one or more Skill cards from your hand to overcome. For example, if the mission required the use of unarmed combat you would need to play that Skill card in order to carry it out.

Once you have collected all of the Skill cards you need you may carry out a mission and reap the rewards for your clan. Unfortunately you will rarely have the right cards in your hand to perform a mission straight away. Instead you will need to store cards from your hand for future use by placing cards face-down from your hand into one of two dojos you control. Storing cards in this way represents you training the ninjas in your clan to perform a mission.

Keeping track of the cards placed in each dojo is challenging as you are not normally allowed to examine the cards once they are placed. You must use your powers of concentration and memory to remember which cards you have placed so that you can use them when you are ready to carry out a mission. Although this is difficult at first, you will find that your mental abilities quickly sharpen and that you will become increasingly skilled at the game. This is as it should be: being the master of a ninja clan requires great mental fortitude, and Shinobi: Way of the Ninja will test it to the utmost. However, if you get completely stuck, you can always visit the sensei who will (at a cost) allow you to examine the cards you have placed.

You receive a reward for completing each mission in the form of gold. The harder a mission the more gold you will receive, but the more cards you will need to play to carry the mission out. At the end of the game the player who has amassed the largest fortune wins.

boardgamehonor: 2012 Charles S. Roberts Best Science-Fiction or Fantasy Board Wargame Nominee
131646.description:
Merchant of Venus uses many elements that come together to form a very interesting game. Players take on the roles of space traders who move their ships through interconnected systems discovering new alien worlds to trade with. As players start to make money delivering commodities in a unique supply-and-demand system, their earnings can be used to purchase better ships and equipment (shields, lasers, engines, etc...) and construct their own spaceports (which speed up trading) and factories (which create better commodities). Variations included in the rulebook allow for interplayer combat. The player who first acquires enough total value ($1000, $2000, $3000, $4000) in cash and port/factory deeds takes the day.

For the 2012 edition of Merchant of Venus from Fantasy Flight Games, the company promises that this revision "remains true to its magnificently campy core while updating the map and game components and expanding game play in surprising ways that will cause even the most hardcore fan to celebrate." That said, the player count has been lowered from six (in the Avalon Hill edition) to four, with the four races in the game being Human, Whynom, Qossuth, and Eeepeeep.
131646.name: Merchant of Venus (second edition)
boardgameaccessory: Merchant of Venus Culture Token Stands
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast 003 – 10 Games for Essen 2015!
Episode 3: Zinger’s Wish, Chalk Dust, Interview with Ben Hillyard of Daedalus Productions, What’s Next On The Table and Game Night Themes
Episode 43 – Merchant of Venus
Episode 6: Bruges/Gaming Pet Peeves
FatCast Episode 11 - Someday, We're All Going to Die edition
If You Buy One Game - Space Games!
Low Player Count - Ep 18 - The Pick Up & Deliver Episode
Ludology Episode 51 - 50 for 50, Part 2
Origins
Show #21: Arkham Horror and Whatnot
Show #24.5 Session Report: Merchant of Venus
Show #24: Redux of our Top Ten Games Lists
Show #25: MoV AH to FFG Deltas, and Deadlands Battle for Slaughter Gulch
Star Trek Catan; Designer Tips; Venus Resolved
The Long View: Merchant of Venus

131647.name: Blaster Master Boy
131647.description:
User Summary

Radiation is destroying the earth, so Jason (from the Blaster Master series) is going underground to eliminate the source with his gun and bombs. Gameplay is based off of the Bomberman series.

131648.name: Bo Jackson: 2 Games In 1
131648.description:
User Summary

A 2 in 1 game cartridge featuring Bo Jackson playing both Baseball and Football.

131649.name: Little Magic
131649.description:
User Summary

Little Magic is a top-down puzzle game based around moving a magic stone to the goal. The protagonist, May, is an apprentice mage and the puzzles are her final exam at mage school. May can push the stone physically and blow magic bubbles that push when they pop. The bubbles can be made in three different sizes; the larger the size, the longer they last before popping. The bubbles can also be pushed by May or by other bubbles. More advanced puzzles require chain reactions of bubbles to get the magic stone to the goal.

131650.description: Arche Extra Mix 2 includes even more animals for you to board in the card game Ark before the floods come and cleanse the Earth of everything that isn't bolted down. How could you have missed all these animals the first two times you looked? And what have you overlooked this time?!
131650.name: Arche Extra Mix 2

131651.name: Boxxle
videogamepublisher: Pony Canyon, Inc. (株式会社ポニーキャニオン / Kabushiki kaisha Ponī Kyanion)
131651.description:
User Summary

This game is a Sokoban clone, the game where you must push boxes around a room to place them in predetermined locations to advance to the next level. Includes 108 levels and a level editor.

131652.name: Boxxle 2
videogamepublisher: Pony Canyon, Inc. (株式会社ポニーキャニオン / Kabushiki kaisha Ponī Kyanion)
131652.description:
User Summary

This game is based on classic puzzle game Sokoban and is a sequel to Boxxle. Push boxes around a room to place them in the desired location to advance to the next puzzle.

131654.name: Brain Drain
131654.description:
User Summary

Brain Drain is a puzzle game all about rearranging the pattern of different shapes to go back to the way they started out. You will see the computer rearrange them, and then you must put them back within the allotted time.

131655.name: Ranma 1/2: Ougi Jaanken
131655.description:
A puzzle game based on rock, paper, scissors. Hands are dropped showing the rock, paper, and scissor signs and are used to remove other hands that have the opposite sign. Its Japanese name is composed of ougi (meaning secret) and jaanken, a play on the word janken (the Japanese name for the game of rock-paper-scissors) but using the characters for evil, dark and fist. However, the furigana reading above the Japanese name is Guu•Choki•Pazuru, which translates to Rock-Scissors-Puzzle.

Source: Wikipedia, "List of Ranma ½ video games", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

131656.name: Sabotain: Break the Rules
131656.description:
Sabotain: Break the Rules is a first-person RPG based on the idea of mission-oriented adventure with varied interactions with people and places as well as varied mission types, including sabotage, infiltration, rescue, intelligence-gathering, thievery, reconnaissance, assassination, and all-out combat. Role-playing system allows characters to develop by gaining experience and spending it to improve their skills and attributes.

Storyline (summarized): Distant future. War between Empire and Confederation, and Rebels against both. Empire's secret agent infiltrates to Confederation capital with a sabotage mission to do the undercover work on framing the government leaders and performing all sorts of action on weakening the forces of the Confederation. The ways of sabotage vary from innocent to evil and it becomes difficult for a hero to decide if it is the Confederation who is bad and the Empire who is good and not vice versa. At a certain point a hero can switch the sides and start the activity on the side of Confederation resulting in crushing the forces of the Empire and peace in the galaxy. The third storyline may begin when on the way to the demolition of the Empire and the Rebels who situate in the Confederation capital and sympathize the Empire. A hero meets the dilemma of the Rebels being good and the rest being bad so the choice is: stay with Confederation or switch to Rebels' side.

Game Features:

Sci-fi environment.
Futuristic architectural and art style of the game. The beginning of a new era creates a new rush to imagination of the future
Non-linear plot with three branches to follow depending hero's decisions during the game
Character physics (simulating articulated rigid body dynamics)
Diversity of inhabitants and monsters: over 150 characters and monsters
Characters have lip-synchronization and emotions
17 core missions provide 40+ hours of gameplay
25 types of weapons of 6 types including melee, unarmed, energy, heavy, explosives

Source: The Publisher Website.

131657.name: Splattering Egg Toss Game
131657.description:
A dexterity game in which two players are each equipped with a small plastic frying pan and a squishy plastic "egg". The opponents simultaneously toss their egg to the other person, who attempts to catch it in their frying pan. This repeats until someone drops their egg and loses.

There is also a solo version in which one person sees how many times they can toss the egg up in the air and catch it.

131658.name: 1836: Short Lines in the West Riding
131658.description:
1836 is a railway operations and share trading board game in the 18xx series. Set in a 10 x 10 mile area of the West Riding area of England that had a staggering number of very small railway companies called "short lines", each of which competed very aggressively across duplicative routes.

The core features of the game:

- Highly dynamic track – There are a relatively high number of named locations that can be laid / upgraded in a variety of competitive ways to ensure that the map develops differently each game.

- Evolving trains – Each train type evolves as it is bought; e.g. there are 2* 2+1, 2* 2+2 then 1* 2X (think of it as a mini diesel that can count two cities and infinite towns). The 2+1 is rusted by the first type of four (4+2), 2+2 by the second (4+3) and so on.

- Staged Minor Companies – Minors are available throughout the game, 18 are shuffled and 4 are available in each of phases 2, 3 and 4 (all 12 available privates are visible from the start). Minors convey a benefit (control over a hex, cheaper track etc) and about half are railway companies that can be absorbed along with a "free" train that can be run immediately.

- Loans with Variable Interest Rate – When a Minor is absorbed by a Major Company it inherits the Minor's liabilities. Loans suppress stock price making stock jumps easier but the interest rate increases as loans are taken, so a balance must be found.

131659.name: Skin Game
131659.description:
From the front page:
Skin Game
A Two Round Shadowrun: Virtual Seattle 2.0 Scenario
Round 1
VS02-SA10

by Peter Bangarth

Trouble in Tsimshian. Mining executives are dying and no one knows why. A luxury, all expenses paid hunting trip is part of the cover for the investigators. Kick back in the lodge, ask some questions of the locals, buy some cool tourist trinkets... sounds like a relaxing run for once.

131660.name: Infestation: The New Z
131660.description:
First Zombie MMO
The War Z is the world's first survival mmo Zombie Game. You may have played Zombie Games before - now it's time to live one.

It's been five years since the outbreak; leaving in its wake a post-apocalyptic nightmare with ninety-five percent of the human population gone. In order to stay alive, you will need food, weapons, and other supplies. Some of you will be able to scavenge as you navigate the terrain, others will be forced to fight for survival as you encounter zombies and other players. Every decision will have an impact on whether you live or how quickly you die.

New Generation of MMO
Forget subscriptions, forget paid DLC and expansion packs.

The War Z is as simple as this - once you install the game to your computer, you will be able to get into the game quickly and play without worrying about subscription fees, no hidden fees, and no paid updates. All updates will be seamlessly delivered to you free of charge when they're released.

Add AAA graphics and effects mixed with the ability to run even on integrated video cards or low end laptops and you have a unique, fun, experience that is available to everyone

Huge Persistent World
Choose one of the hundreds of servers to play on.
Each Zombie Game world has an area of up to 400 square kilometers.

As more worlds become available, just switch between them at any time, without losing your character's data, or paying any "world transfer fees".

Start playing in our first world "Colorado", today, and prepare yourself to join other gameplay locations scattered around the world as we release more and more content.

No Classes, No Level and level caps
Create your own survival experience by selecting one of the available characters, customizing them and helping them to navigate through hostile world of The War Z.
Gain experience and spend it to learn dozens of available skills in this Zombie Game.

No classes and restrictions, no levels, or unrealistic stat modifications.

Your goal is to survive this Zombie Game and the ones that survive longest will be victorious!

Explore, Scavange, Survive!

Create your own survival experience by selecting one of the available characters, customizing them and helping them to navigate through hostile world of The War Z.
Gain experience and spend it to learn dozens of available skills in this Zombie Game.

No classes and restrictions, no levels, or unrealistic stat modifications.

Your goal is to survive this Zombie Game and the ones that survive longest will be victorious!

Source: The Game Website.

Note: The above was written when the title of the game was still "The War Z". It has since been renamed "Infestation: Survivor Stories"

131661.name: Time: A Game of Chance for Many Players
131661.description:
The time theme is very loosely pasted onto this game. The clocks used on the board and the cards could have just as easily been card denominations. This is a simple game of match.

A dealer/banker is assigned. Each player is dealt five cards face up. The dealer then deals one card face down on each of the 12 clocks on the board. In the first round of play the dealer turns up one of the twelve cards at a time. If a player has a matching card in one of his/her upturned five, then the player has to pay in the amount of chips/points indicated at that point on the board in large red letters. If the player has two matching cards, the player must pay double and so on. If the overturned card matches the time on the board at that spot, TIME is called and all payments are doubled. In this round all payments are made to the pot. After all twelve cards are overturned they are returned to the deck, reshuffled, and a fresh twelve are distributed to the twelve clock positions face down. The players keep their original five cards.

In the second round, as each of the twelve cards are overturned, payments are made to the players following the same rules as in round one. The rules do not explain the end of the game scenario. Nor do they explain if the rounds continue to alternate put/take. It is also unclear how many chips the players start with. It is suggested that the white chips equal 1, the yellow chips 2, the red chips 5 and the blue chips 10.

131662.name: The Gentle Ladies' Tea and Monstrosity Destroying & Quilting Circle Auxiliary
rpg: The Gentle Ladies' Tea and Monstrosity Destroying & Quilting Circle Auxiliary
131662.description:
From the introduction:
Bother the apocalypse. Bother demons. Bother failure. Bother many things.

The Gentle Ladies’ Tea & Monstrosity Destroying & Quilting Circle Auxiliary is a Machine Age Production. It is a game about destroying nuisances before they ruin tea. Because no matter how wicked the end of times, there's no excuse for incivility. This is not post-apocalyptic, it is proper-apocalyptic.

You will have need of dice. Four sided, six, eight, ten, twelve, and twenty. As is traditional. Remember extras for guests! Set your center piece on the credenza and gather your dice in its stead. You will have need of some notions. Buttons, thimbles, or perhaps a helping of macaroons. One shouldn’t face the forces of evil without a taste of sweetness, after all. Pencils are also quite useful!

Oh my dear! I’m so glad you could finally join us. I know Margret can be a touch, shall we say, picky about who gets these invitations, but now that you’ve risen to her approval, welcome! I thought as we’ve gotten together to craft, stitch, and destroy the blackest souls of destruction, it would only be proper as a hostess to give you every comfort. Make yourself at home, there’s tea. You’ll need honey, as we’ve no sugar cubes. Radiation does silly things to the sugar cubes, sadly.

Machine Age Productions are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution/Share-Alike/NonCommercial license. Share it all you want. If you want to sell it, talk to us first. Pretty simple, right?

131663.name: Halls of Undermountain I: Zarr's Invincible Army
rpgseries: ADAP - Living Forgotten Realms Adapted Adventures
131663.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

A noblewoman fears that her nephew is lost on a fool’s errand into the dreaded Undermountain, and she turns to a group of adventurers to rescue him. The first step is to make the entrance safe. A Living Forgotten Realms adapted adventure set in Waterdeep and Undermountain for Adventure Level 2 (which supports character levels 1-5). This adventure is found in the Halls of Undermountain sourcebook, available at retain game stores and bookstores.

This adaptation document does not present adjusted stat blocks for various tiers; any legal AL 2 table can play, but bear in mind that the stat blocks in the published adventure were written for a party of level 1 characters. We recommend that you allow at least 16 hours of playing time to complete this adventure (the equivalent of a four- round LFR adventure).

131665.description:
Theme:
You and your friends are heroes standing before the vanguard of an invading army. Use your array of very large, sometimes ridiculous, weapons to try to defeat the vanguard.

Goal of the game:
Players try to keep a grid of enemies from growing too large, all while trying to outscore the other players in the end. If the enemy army gets too large, everyone loses!

Gameplay:
Players draw a weapon from the Weapon deck. Weapons have two stats: Damage done and how many times the weapon can be swung. They use this weapon to deal damage to the enemy formation, starting with the front line. Players can keep hitting the same enemy, or proceed to an adjacent enemy. Players keep any enemies they kill. The player can cash in the enemies they've killed to draw from the Epic deck. Epic attacks function the same as a weapon, but are far more powerful.
131665.name: Drive Them Back

131666.name: Schützt unsere Erde
131666.description:
A racing game with a theme of environmental protection. The first player to collect an eco medal on all six continents and to reach his/her starting location with 1.000 eco dollars wins the game.

Players travel around the world to take part in environmental protection activities and by doing so, win eco medals. Open cards present the actions that have to be taken. There is one card fewer than there are players, so there is competition for actions.
Movement on the board is determined by dice. One can choose to use only one dice and earn 200 dollars, or use two dice and earn no money, or one can pay 500 dollars to use the plane. When a player reaches the target destination, they earn an eco medal of this continent and the card is removed from the game and replaced with a new one. If a player lands on the same space as another, he/she can take away money or a medal from that player.

The game ends when one player has earned a medal of each continent and reaches his/her home town with at least 1.000 eco dollars in his/her pocket.

131667.name: Space Battle
131667.description:
Space Battle is a power struggle between you and your opponents for control of the galaxy. This is a "take that" card game with silly cards.

There are two similar versions of the game in the box.
Everyone starts with some ship cards randomly drawn from the ship deck. Each ship gives you access to use particular kinds of weapon cards that you draw from a shared deck. These cards like "red laser" and "drones" are used to wear down other ships. Some cards destroy ships in ways outside of weaponry.

When you destroy another ship you get the printed Victory Points for it. If all your ships are destroyed you go to the deck to see if you are lucky enough to get a card that gives you another ship to stay in the game, otherwise you are eliminated from play, but victory (in one version of the game is based on points).

131668.name: Die Lieben Sieben: Heute steigt die Party!
131668.description:
Childrens dexterity game.

From the box:
The Friendly Seven want to celebrate a big party in the mansion Siebenklein. They cleaned up the house already, only the balloon decoration is missing. Four of the friendly Seven blow up the ballons and the other three hang them up.
Would you like to help the Friendly Seven to decorate the house?
A game ofskills to develop hand-eye coordination.

The game is a dexterity game for younger children.
The board is in 3 segments, with coloured spaces, at the far end a goal is constructed looking like the front of a house, with an open doorway. Players take it in turns to flick or shove a "puck", down the long gameboard attempting to stop on spaces of a particular colour, landing on a colour gets the player a token to add to their playerboard.
When all 6 different colours are collected, then the player may attempt to shoot the puck through the doorway of the house at the far end of the board to win.

131669.name: Seifenkistenrennen
131669.description:
A simple racing game for two players. Movement is determined by a six-sided die.

The game consists of a board (showing a 37-space racing track), 4 player tokens and a die. Both players try to get their soapbox derby racer (i.e. one of their two player tokens) to the finish line first. Players take turns rolling the die. The player's first token (the racer) is moved according to the result of the die roll. If the racer lands on a stop space, the player has to send his/her mechanic (= the second token) the following turns. Only when the mechanic has reached the racer, the racer can move on. The mechanic stays on the stop space until the racer lands on another stop space.

The player whose racer reaches the finish line first wins the game.

131670.name: Schnuffel
131670.description:
A children's game in which judging length and shape by touch is the central element.

Game idea: A long time ago Schnuffel, the dog, and his friends hid many bones in the garden. Now they want to dig them up again but not any old bones, it has to be specific ones. The bone has to be the right shape and size. And the dogs are chasing away each other too!

Aim of the game: To find the correct wooden bone by touch as quickly as possible in order to collect the most bone cards.

How it is played: The board shows a circular path consisting of single-colour spaces and multi-coloured dog-house spaces. Arrows next to the spaces show the direction in which the dogs move. Each player has a dog-shaped player piece. A colour die determines movement. The active player puts his/her dog on the next empty space of that colour. If he/she lands on a dog-house space, he/she is allowed to search for bones. This means that he/she puts his/her hand into the bag with the wooden bones and tries to find the bone that is shown on the top bone card. While he/she is trying to identify the correct bone by touch, the other players continue taking turns rolling the die and moving their dogs. As soon as the active player thinks he/she has found the correct bone, he/she shouts "Stop!" and the other players stop rolling. The chosen bone is compared to the one on the card. If they match, the active player gets to keep the card. The wooden bone is returned to the bag. Then the active player starts searching for the next bone. His/her turn ends as soon as either one of the other players lands on a dog-house space, or he/she chooses the wrong bone.

End of game: The game ends when all the bone cards have been used up. The player with the most cards wins the game.

Game components:
- game board
- 4 dog-shaped wooden player pieces
- 9 wooden bones (different lengths, round piece on one end, or on both, or none)
- 18 bone cards (showing the different lengths and shapes)
- color die
- cloth bag

131671.description:
Yellow Jersey is a cycling race for 2-4 players. Starting in Paris, you move your team of three cyclists around France through a series of race stages by choosing (a variable number of) movement tokens from your stack, with the token being numbered 1-6. Each round the player holding the Yellow Jersey moves first. You will need to plan how to move your bikes so that you retain maximum movement and take advantage of opportunities to slipstream. Crashes, uphill slopes, and the outside lane will slow you down, whereas downhill slopes and the inside lane may work in your favor.

The race can be conducted either way around the circuit and the first player to get one cyclist back to Paris wins. (The game includes a team winning variant.)
boardgameversion: English pre-release first edition (12 handmade wooden copies)
English pre-release second edition (22 "tile version" copies)
131671.name: Yellow Jersey

131672.name: Schizirkus
131672.description:
An educational game aimed at teaching the rules of conduct on ski pistes ("Pistenregeln").

The game combines roll-and-move elements with trivia game elements. The board shows four different skiing areas. Players move their player tokens up the ski lift according to their die roll results. Once they've reached the top, they can ski downhill (again using die roll results), but first they have to answer a question connected with skiing, such as "What is forbidden on a chair lift?", "What is important when overtaking other skiers?" etc. Apart from questions on the rules of conduct, there are general skiing trivia questions like "Where was skiing invented?" or "When did the first skiing race in Central Europe take place?"
The first player to complete four downhill races wins the game.

131674.name: The GM's Field Guide to Players
131674.description:
Publisher Blurb

Have Player Troubles?

GMs – what’s the most important part of your game? It’s your players. Without your players, you don’t have a game. Yet, it’s your players that often cause you the most grief.

Have you ever had players who

arrives on time to every game, but spends the entire session reading a book?
try to monopolize your attention?
complain that other people aren’t playing their characters right?
argue with every decision you make?




We all have. It’s hard to know how to deal with difficult players. But you don’t have to go it alone. The GM’s Field Guide to Players can help.

What’s Included

This 54-page PDF covers:


How to identify players types and how to use them to make your game more enjoyable
The five steps for dealing with all problem players
Common types of problem players and how to deal with each one
How to remove a player from your game and still look yourself in the mirror

131675.name: 3-Demon
131675.description:
3-Demon (also known as Monster Maze, though not to be confused with 3D Monster Maze) is a wireframe 1983 DOS computer game based on Pac-Man.

The player wanders through a 3-D maze, eating pellets and avoiding red ghosts. Eating a power pellet turns the ghosts green and gives the player the ability to eat them for extra points. It is a notable example of an early video game told from a first-person perspective.

Source: Wikipedia, "3-Demon", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

131676.description:
Die Windrosen is a six-tile mini-expansion for Carcassonne. Each tile depicts all or part of a wind rose (AKA compass rose). The red, full wind rose is a new starting tile, and divides the playing area into four fields.

This expansion was released at Modell-Hobby-Spiel 2012 in Leipzig. Attendees had to go on a scavenger hunt to collect clues which would permit them to obtain the expansion from the Carcassonne-on-Tour booth.

Short rules:

Orange full rose is new start tile and defines the four quarters: SW, SE, NW, NE.
Blue full rose (reg. backside) redefines the four quarters.
Orange quarter rose tiles (reg. backside) are worth 3 bonus points if put down in the corresponding quarter of the playing field, e.g. the South-West rose tile put down in the SW quarter defined by the current valid full wind rose.
Appart from that the roses have no influence on the play and the features on the tiles and other points aquired through the tile.
The blue full and the 4 orange quarter rose tiles are shuffled in the stack at the beginning.
131676.name: Carcassonne: Die Windrosen

131677.name: Život v Česku
131677.description:
In Život v Česku ("Life in the Czech Republic"), players start with a bit of free time, some volunteer work, and experience in primary school. During the course of the game, they can study at different schools, try a range of jobs, buy a house, start a family, and (alas) suffer from negative phenomena, such as an arrest.

Život v Česku, which is tailored to the Bohemian Czech mentality and environment, features a new unique gaming system that gives players a lot of latitude in what's possible within the game.

131678.description:
Bonus station card. Base game has three 'placeholder' station cards that can be cashed in for a promo of choice 'from the box'.

It was given in Essen 2011 for the buyers of the basegame

From the card:
"When Built: Agree a number with at least one other player, roughly equal to the number of games being played in the current room (or hall). Gain 1 point for every two games."
131678.name: Paperclip Railways: Messe / Grugahalle

131679.description:
Bonus station card. Base game has three 'placeholder' station cards that can be cashed in for a promo of choice 'from the box'.

From the card:
"Whenever you make the sound of a steam train while building a link, gain 1 point. Maximum of 1 point per link."
131679.name: Paperclip Railways: Top left-hand corner of Wales

131680.name: Schildkrötenreise
131680.description:
A simple, luck-based racing game for children.

The game consists of one island tile, 4 wooden turtles, 43 cards and one six-sided number die.

The island tile is the target space that all the turtles (= wooden player pieces) want to reach as fast as possible. The cards, which show either one of several sea creatures or a smaller island, are used to create a path towards the target island tile. They are placed face down.
Players take turns rolling the die. The die roll determines how far the player may move his/her turtle. The card it lands on is turned over and depending on the type of card, the turtle is moved several spaces forwards or backwards.

The player whose turtle is first to reach the main island wins the game.

131681.description:
This game is the follow on and expansion to Armored Knights North Afrika - Operation Crusader. The game does not include and map and therefore you need to have Crusader to play it.

The Commonwealth and Axis sides have taken a breather after the successful advance by the Afrika Korps in February to the Gazala Line. They have built up considerable forces and by the end of May are ready for major combat operations. Rommel gets his attack off first and makes for the fairly predictable plan of maneuvering down under the Gazala Line and then up toward the coast to cut off the Commonwealth infantry manning the Gazala Line boxes. Rommel was caught a bit by surprise in not understanding how powerful the new Grant tank was and how they would affect the performance of his own panzers. After the initial advance the Axis forces were cornered in the 'Cauldron' and spent a few days making the position impregnable, clearing away the 150th Brigade box, and then springing out to destroy the majority of the Commonwealth armor and move to the coast and then on to Tobruk.

These German Panzer forces, and to some extent the British Armor Brigades, are the strongest you will ever see in concentrated form. You will enjoy maneuvering and fighting this battle with the possibility of never having the same outcomes as the Armored Knights game system provides a variable strength and die roll modifier table that never lets a player know exactly how well his troops will fight an engagement.
131681.name: Armored Knights North Africa: Operation Venezia
boardgameexpansion: Armored Knights North Africa: Operation Crusader

131682.description:
City of Gears is a unique steampunk/fantasy game of exploration, area control, worker placement, and strategy. As the representative for your faction – the elves, dwarves, goblins, or orcs – you must race to claim ownership over the magnificent ruins of an abandoned clockwork metropolis. Each game plays in under an hour, and because only nine of the city tiles (from dozens available) are randomly chosen and placed each game, no two games ever play the same.

Each turn, you roll a number of production dice, then you move your automaton workers and perform a variety of actions (such as drawing and placing gears to reactivate areas of the city, sabotaging opponents, and activating unique steam powers) as determined by the production dice. Along the way, you will develop your factory with special powers which set it apart and provide you with powerful bonuses.

As the city is revealed and its abilities are discovered, players must concoct plans to accrue prestige and hinder opponents so that once Opening Day arrives, they will emerge victorious! Do you have what it takes to set the City of Gears in motion?
131682.name: City of Gears
boardgameexpansion: City of Gears: JUSTICE and MIGHT
City of Gears: Shadows in the Steam
boardgamepodcastepisode: Vox Republica 088: Con Season Anticipation

131683.name: Incredible Courage at Elchingen
131683.description:
Incredible Courage at Elchingen is the battle where Marshall Ney defeated the Austrian General Reisch just north of the Danube River, just before the surrender at Ulm. Ney must move 2 of his divisions over the river first and then fight a larger enemy force. The Austrians helped the French immensely by keeping themselves in their defensive positions.

The game system has a variable strength system that provides for an endless amount of replayability. This game provides an excellent introduction to the Incredible Courage game system as the forces involved are fairly small, one French Corps vs One Austrian Corps. This game has some improvements over the Incredible Courage at Austerlitz series with a better organized rulebook and Level of Order markers that better portray what level the unit is currently at.

Play proceeds based on a set of initiative die rolls and Leadership values for Division and Corps Commanders. Players then choose to either fire or move. Play alternates between the players until all divisional and corps forces have had the opportunity to move or fire. Firing is accomplished unit by unit. Units may perform assault before moving on to other Divisions. Units are modeled as Infantry Companies (150 men), with Battaion substitute counters, Cavalry Squadrons (100 mounted soldiers), and Artillery Sections (2-3 guns). Units take losses in Levels of Order, starting at 5 for regular troops and 6 for Elite troops, and when they reach 0 they are eliminated.

Players must use the tactics of the day to put the right forces in the right place at the right time to ensure the success of the mission. Putting infantry, cavalry, and artillery together will enhance your chances of success.

131684.name: Chop Chop
131684.description:
The hands are the second brain.

With Chop Chop, you can develop this "second brain" by training yourself to grab items as quickly as you can with chopsticks. Fill your plate as quickly as you can to exercise your hand, fill your belly and – most important of all – rid yourself of the plate card fro mthe current round. Let's see who can collect the most fruit and fill all of their plates first!

131685.name: CCULELE Champion
131685.description: CCULELE Champion is an action and memory game, with everyone participating at the same time to follow the poses presented to them. One by one, more poses will be presented and the challenge for you is to remember them all so that you can take actions of your own. Are you ready to challenge others to become the champion?

131687.name: King's Field
131687.description:
There was a small country called Verdite surrounded by a deep forest, encircled by fog and whirling winds. In ancient days, when a great battle was fought and many were dying, Verdite was saved by a person who then disappeared into the forest. Only the forest's drifting fog knew who this person was... The citizens called their savior the Dragon of the Forest and built a sanctuary and honored this person there. Eventually, only a legend remained and the Sanctuary was changed into the Royal Graveyard and all was silent. But, the legend says, "Someday the Dragon of the Forest shall return, bearing Magical Artifacts." However, the time has not yet come and the Sanctuary sleeps deeply...

Source: Wikipedia, "King's Field", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

131688.name: Pandemic
131688.description:
User Summary

In pandemic you have the unique opportunity to exterminate mankind by controlling a deadly virus. Based on the spread and success of your virus, you gain points towards modifying its virulence by adding new attributes and symptoms. You win if you manage to exterminate the entire world population.

131689.name: Pandemic 2
131689.description:
User Summary

In this sequel to the original award winning game Pandemic, you once again have the opportunity to exterminate mankind by controlling a deadly virus. Based on the spread of your virus, you gain points which you can spend towards enhancing the virulence of your disease. You win if you manage to kill off the entire world population.

131690.name: Pandemic: Extinction of Man
131690.description:
User Summary

Based on the award winning, highly original game Pandemic, Extinction of Man gives you ample strategic options through which to better control the evolution of your virus. This time, however, mankind is ready: You will pit yourself against the clock, as a horde of scientists attempt to research vaccines to stop you. Once again, you win if you manage to kill off the entire world population

131691.name: Pandemic: American Swine
131691.description:
User Summary

Unlike any of it's prequels, Pandemic: American Swine deals with the spread of a virulent virus: The Swine Flu. The game takes place over an extremely detailed map of the United States. You play as the government and your task is to save as much of the population as possible. You have complete control over airports, seaports, hospitals and more. Can you thwart the virus and prevent the impending doom?

131692.name: Final Cut: Death on the Silver Screen
131692.description:
Unravel the mystery of your father's death and brother's bizarre disappearance in Final Cut: Death on the Silver Screen! Your father was a famous movie director who liked to invent elaborate locks and devices. A mysterious villain demands you track down the pieces to his greatest – and perhaps most deadly – invention of all time! If you don't, your brother will suffer the same fate as your father.

Return to the family Art Deco mansion and golden era movie backlots to look for clues about a past you never knew your father had – and the dark secrets behind the villain's quest for his deadly invention.

Source: The Publisher Website.

131693.name: Sixcess Quick Start Rule-set
131693.description:
From the Introduction:

These are the bare-bones details needed to play the game. All the examples and the "bells and whistles" are detailed in the full rule-set. There is enough presented here to provide a basic run-through of the game mechanic, but does not showcase the full diversity and capability of the rules.

131694.name: Iron Grip: Marauders
131694.description:
Iron Grip: Marauders is a free-to-play online browser game with 3D turn-based battles using the Unity game engine. It has been in continuing development since the open beta was launched on January 17, 2011. The game was released through Steam, an online distributor, as part of their Free to Play catalog on September 30, 2011. Iron Grip: Marauders became available on Amazon.com through their Games Connect feature in 2012.

Gameplay
In Iron Grip: Marauders there are two parts to the game: the strategic resource management and the tactical 3D battles. Players decide on plans for scientific research, unit production, and which battles to enter. When a battle begins, the game switches to a 3D view using the Unity game engine where players are asked to deploy troops that were produced in the management phase.
The game allows PvP battles once players reach a certain level, and cooperative boss fights, where a number of players each fight single-player battles to defeat a boss for greater rewards. There are also tournaments where players play several rounds to compete for a grand prize.

Economy
There are currently three resources in the game: gold, iron, and gems. Gold and iron are earned through raids, smuggling or assault missions, and are used to produce units, construct buildings, and perform research. Gems can be purchased with real world currency. Gems can be used to buy clothes for the in-game avatar, to develop special units on the black market, to buy perks which can increase research speed, unit production speed, or XP gain, or Gems can be used to buy energy, allowing players to participate in more battles in a given day.

Battles
Marauders uses the Unity game engine to depict fights on a 3D battlefield. At the beginning of a battle, players decide whether they want to perform a raid to capture resources or attempt a conquest to capture a base. Players must then strategize to spend a limited number of deployment points by selecting which of their units to set up on the battlefield. Battles are then effected through turn-based combat. At the beginning of each turn, every unit is given eight action points which can be used to move or attack. Each unit class has associated strengths and weaknesses when attacking which must be considered in order to choose the most effective unit for a specific task.

Source: Wikipedia, "Iron Grip: Marauders", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

131695.name: Rain (Web Browser)
131695.description:
Rain is an arcade game that mixes puzzle gameplay with Tetris-like gameplay to produce a unique and challenging game. With distinct grungy graphics and its diverse gameplay, Rain is like any other puzzle game you've played!
Rain features: Four different gameplay modes, 50 different puzzles to solve, 32 trophies to unlock and automatic game saves that store all of your unlocked trophies.

Source: The Developer Website.

131696.name: Global Defense System
131696.description:
Every living thing on Earth is facing extinction. A massive barrage of asteroids are on a direct collision course with Earth. By using the best technology and military hardware available, you must destroy the incoming asteroids and save the planet. Estimates put the number of asteroids in the thousands, so expect to be shooting non-stop.

Source: The Developer Website.

131697.name: Bad Sector
131697.description:
Inspired by classic video games from the 1980s, Bad Sector is a stylized arcade game that looks and sounds like a game straight out of the past. Quick reflexes and sharp eyes are necessary to ensure success.
Bad Sector includes: bright 1980 stylized graphics, great electronic music and sound effects, three different gameplay modes that allow you to challenge yourself and over 10 different trophies that award you with various bonuses.

Source: The Developer Website.

131698.name: Heliplan Japan
131698.description:
Heliplan Japan is side scrolling city simulator that puts you in charge of your very own rescue helicopter.

Players will have to constantly adapt to changing conditions and new challenges as they attempt to rescue civilians from various cities across a devastated Japan.

The game was developed in response to the 2011 Japan disasters.

Source: The Developer Website.

131699.name: The Farm
131699.description:
Your farm has come under attack from the most unnatural collection of enemies possible: wolves, ritualistic cultists and the United States's military. It's not obvious what exactly has prompted such a conflict, but all of your enemies seem to be after the same thing: your livestock - or more specifically your sheep.

The Farm features:
eight unique challenging trophies
great looking pixel graphics
outrageously bloody and intense action
a huge number of completely unique enemies
an in-depth research and upgrade system
a mixture of traditional and out of this world weaponry!

Source: The Developer Website.

131700.name: Railway Water Towers
131700.description:
From the Introduction

Two parallel railway tracks run through the grass covered plains from horizon to horizon. The railway tracks have been laid on top of a railway embankment a few meters high. Beyond the rails, rail road ties and the gravel supporting them the embankment gently slopes down to the grassy plain. To either side of he tracks large water tanks have been constructed on top of wooden scaffoldings to provide the steam engines pulling the trains with water if needed. Beyond them the rails are flanked by the masts of a telegraph line and a dirt track, mostly used by maintenance vehicles and crews.

131701.name: Railway Tracks
131701.description:
From the Introduction

Two parallel railway tracks run through the grass covered plains from horizon to horizon. The railway tracks have been laid on top of a railway embankment a few meters high. Beyond the rails, railroad ties and the gravel supporting them the embankment gently slopes down to the grassy plain. To one side of the embankment it is flanked by the masts of a telegraph line. On the other side it is flanked by a dirt track, mostly used by maintenance vehicles and crews, running parallel to the rails.

131702.name: Office
131702.description:
From the Introduction

A quite spacious room, this office is obviously the place of work for an important or at least powerful person. Beyond the heavy double door leading in a large exotic carpet, of various reddish hues, covers the polished marble floor leading forwards towards a massive hardwood desk. A desk that downright dwarfs the fine chair in front of it. To either side of the entrance massive bookshelves cover the walls, filled to the brim with various books. Behind the massive desk, covered with scrolls, books and writing implements stands an equally massive, wheeled hardwood chair with leather cushions.

An observant person might realize that these pieces of furniture are arranged to intimidate anyone sitting on the wrong side of the desk. At the back of the desk and at its sides the walls are dominated by large ceiling high stained glass windows, which are supposed to make visitors feel even smaller. The fine glass table to the side of the door and the chairs surrounding it provide a curious counterpoint to this.

131703.name: Orcs Must Die! 2: Fire and Water Booster Pack
131703.description:
User Summary
The Fire and Water booster pack adds three new levels to Orcs Must Die! 2, as well as three Endless Mode conversions, three traps, and two enemies.

131704.name: Orcs Must Die! 2: Family Ties Booster Pack
131704.description:
User Summary
As with the Fire and Water expansion before it, Family Ties adds three new levels to Orcs Must Die! 2. It also adds three Endless Mode conversions, two weapons, a trinket, and an enemy.

131705.name: Shuffle Ball
131705.description: Players have special marbles and the slide on the 3' table. The try to have their pieces stop in the 3-2-1 zone for scoring. The directions state that players may play going the same direction or in opposite directions (unlike similar shuffle board type games).

131706.name: Soko-Ban
131706.description:
Sokoban (倉庫番 sōkoban, warehouse keeper) is a type of transport puzzle, in which the player pushes boxes or crates around in a warehouse, trying to get them to storage locations. The puzzle is usually implemented as a video game.
Sokoban was created in 1981 by Hiroyuki Imabayashi, and published in 1982 by Thinking Rabbit, a software house based in Takarazuka, Japan.

In 1988 Sokoban was published in US by Spectrum HoloByte for the Commodore 64, IBM-PC and Apple II series as Soko-Ban. A 1988 review in Computer Gaming World praised the game for being "pure and simple, very playable and mentally challenging", citing its addictive qualities. It was also reviewed in 1988 in Dragon #132 by Hartley, Patricia, and Kirk Lesser in "The Role of Computers" column. The reviewers gave the game 4.5 out of 5 stars.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sokoban", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

131707.description:
Catan Mobil is the 2012 special card for "The Rivals for Catan".

Ability of the card:
"Wird die Zahl einer angrenzenden Landschaft gewürfelt, erhalten Sie dort einen weiteren Rohstoff. Legen Sie das Catan Mobil danach auf einen anderen Bauplatz, ggf. auch auf einen des Mitspielers. Gibt es keinen, legen Sie es auf die (eigene) Ablage."

In a free translation:
"In case a number of a neighbouring territory came in the dice roll, you receive one extra material from this territory. Place the Catan-mobil in another construction field after that, even in a rival construction field. If there are no free construction fields, place it in your discard pile."
131707.name: Die Fürsten von Catan: Sonderkarte Frühjahr 2012 – Catan Mobil
boardgamefamily: Die Fürsten von Catan / The Rivals for Catan

131709.name: Black Matrix Zero
131709.description:
Black Matrix Zero is set in the same fictional world as the original Black/Matrix game, though hundreds of years prior. Three divisions of humankind share the same world - white-winged people who are called angels, black-winged people who are called devils, and wingless people. Those who have wings have great powers and pay little mind to the wingless ones. The angels rule the world via a religious organization called the Prodevon Church, which ensures both the cooperation and ignorance of the wingless people.

Source: Wikipedia, "Black Matrix (video game series)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

131710.name: Black/Matrix +
131710.description:
In the world of Black/Matrix the forces of Hell won a decisive war against the forces of Heaven. The victorious devils rewrote history and redesigned society to suit their purposes, reversing the concepts of good and evil. The descendants of the devils, known as black-wings because of the bat-like wings that grow from their backs, rule over the white-wing descendants of the angels, whom they treat as sub-human slaves. In their society love is considered the worst of crime, and any one found guilty of love or kindness is hunted and punished.

Black/Matrix + is the second remake of the original Black/Matrix and added additional content and improved the graphics.

Source: Wikipedia, "Black Matrix (video game series)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

131711.name: Black/Matrix AD
131711.description:
In the world of Black/Matrix the forces of Hell won a decisive war against the forces of Heaven. The victorious devils rewrote history and redesigned society to suit their purposes, reversing the concepts of good and evil. The descendants of the devils, known as black-wings because of the bat-like wings that grow from their backs, rule over the white-wing descendants of the angels, whom they treat as sub-human slaves. In their society love is considered the worst of crimes, and any one found guilty of love or kindness is hunted and punished.

Black/Matrix AD is the first remake of the original Black/Matrix and added additional content as well as improving the graphics.

Source: Wikipedia, "Black Matrix (video game series)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

131712.name: Lingon, lådvin och långkalsonger
131712.description:
"Lingon, lådvin & långkalsonger" is an entertaining game where you win or loose points based on how typically swedish you behave.

The game contains 300 questions about everything from Eurovision song contest and croqs shoes to the swedish sausage "falukorv".

The rules state some examples on how to play the game but leaves a lot to the players to decide. But the main course of the game is that a question is given about how you would act/think in a certain situation (there are also some traditional quiz questions). The players then say or write down their answers. After this points are added/subtracted according to the backside of the card. The winner is the player with the most points at the end. This player is a so called "Svensson", a typical swede.

131714.name: Summon Night
131714.description:
The games take place in Lyndbaum, a world similar to medieval Europe with the inclusion of modern factories and railroads. Lyndbaum is surrounded by four other worlds: Loreilal, the land from where mechanical creatures come; Silturn, the land of yokai; Sapureth, where angels and demons live; and Maetropa, from where half-humans, magical beasts, fairies and other mythical creatures hail.

Source: Wikipedia, "Summon Night (series)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

131715.name: Summon Night 2
131715.description:
The games take place in Lyndbaum, a world similar to medieval Europe with the inclusion of modern factories and railroads. Lyndbaum is surrounded by four other worlds: Loreilal, the land from where mechanical creatures come; Silturn, the land of yokai; Sapureth, where angels and demons live; and Maetropa, from where half-humans, magical beasts, fairies and other mythical creatures hail.

Source: Wikipedia, "Summon Night (series)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

131716.name: Summon Night 3
131716.description:
The games take place in Lyndbaum, a world similar to medieval Europe with the inclusion of modern factories and railroads. Lyndbaum is surrounded by four other worlds: Loreilal, the land from where mechanical creatures come; Silturn, the land of yokai; Sapureth, where angels and demons live; and Maetropa, from where half-humans, magical beasts, fairies and other mythical creatures hail.

Source: Wikipedia, "Summon Night (series)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

131717.name: Sokoban
131717.description:
Sokoban (倉庫番 sōkoban?, warehouse keeper) is a type of transport puzzle, in which the player pushes boxes or crates around in a warehouse, trying to get them to storage locations. The puzzle is usually implemented as a video game.
Sokoban was created in 1981 by Hiroyuki Imabayashi, and published in 1982 by Thinking Rabbit, a software house based in Takarazuka, Japan.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sokoban", available under the CC-BY-SA License.


User Summary

This is the first published game to to use the Sokoban box pushing puzzle. It was made for the NEC PC-8801 and had 20 levels.

131718.name: Sokoban 2
131718.description:
Sokoban (倉庫番 sōkoban?, warehouse keeper) is a type of transport puzzle, in which the player pushes boxes or crates around in a warehouse, trying to get them to storage locations. The puzzle is usually implemented as a video game.
Sokoban was created in 1981 by Hiroyuki Imabayashi, and published in 1982 by Thinking Rabbit, a software house based in Takarazuka, Japan.
Sokoban 2 (1984) (NEC PC-8801) with 50 levels.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sokoban", available under the CC-BY-SA License.


User Summary

Sokoban 2 was released on the NEC PC-8801 in 1984; it was the second computer game to use the Sokoban box pushing puzzle. It had 50 levels.

131719.name: Westward: Core Rulebook
rpg: Westward: A Steampunk Western Roleplaying Game
131719.description:
From the Kickstarter page:

The Past: Humanity has left Earth centuries ago on a one-way trip in search of new life, to start over on a new world. Most of the travelers did not survive, but those who lived, found a new home on a massive, alien world. They named it Westward, as it spins in a polar opposite direction of Earth…

Now! This is when you arrive on Westward. Three hundred-forty three years after the first colonists crash-landed, Westward is rife with hostilities, from dangerous wildlife to scant resources. While the colonists started with advanced technologies, they quickly realized the need to reverse engineer their ideas to adapt to a new world. Despite all their technological knowledge, much of Humanity lives in rural and badland settings. Everyday, these people struggle for survival and are barely able to produce enough food.

A dependency on steam power emerged with advances in manipulating the unique properties of water. To keep the peace, the Central Council hired Marshalls to work with local towns. Due to the disparate layout and distances between towns, the law of the gun became the common law, where the Marshalls arrested, tried, and convicted most criminals on their own.

With an inherent reliance on steam and bullets, Westward is a fast-paced and cinematic Steampunk Western setting.
