With deep roots in telling a story that holds the elements of both the Steampunk and Western genres, the game focuses primarily on Humans as a species divided, competing for the very necessities to stay alive.

131720.name: Copyright
131720.description:
In Copyright, players need to reproduce a pattern as quickly as possible using the transparent image sheets that they have in hand. Each sheet is a 3x3 grid that has a circle, a square, and a plus in three of its nine squares.

At the start of a round, one player takes four image sheets at random, then stacks them together to form a model for that round. Players receive ten sheets at random, then try to reproduce the model by flipping the sheets and stacking them any way they like; the sheets do not have to overlap perfectly, but a player will lose points for any non-perfect overlaps. How does a player indicate which squares in his stack are to be considered the solution? Through the use of a 3x3 grid that has a thick black outline; each player has one of these in addition to the ten sheets.

As soon as a player recreates the model, the round ends. Each player scores one point for each square in the model that she reproduced in her image; whoever ended the round receives one bonus point, scoring 10 points (instead of nine). All players then lose one point for each row and column that "sticks out" from her 3x3 black-bordered grid. Players then shuffle the sheets and start a new round.

When a player's score totals 20 or more points, the game ends and this player wins.

131721.name: Morningstar:  Descent to Deadrock
131721.description:
In this point-and-click adventure game your space ship crash-lands on a desolate planet. Your captain is wounded, your engineer: dead. You need to repair your vessel and solve the mystery of the planet to make it out of there alive.

Source: The Developer Website.

131722.name: Hetherdale
131722.description:
Is the legendary City of Hetherdale real or only a fairy-tale made up by an 18th century madman? What dark mysteries does it hold? Find out as you play Dr. Heather Montrose, a young scholar destined to uncover the secrets of Hetherdale.

Source: The Developer Website.

131723.name: Nick Toldy and the Legend of Dragon Peninsula
131723.description:
User Summary

In this point-and-click fantasy adventure you play as Nick Toldy, an aspiring young knight. You arrive at Dragon Peninsula endeavoring to unravel the mystery and rescue the princess from the clutches of the dragon.

131724.name: Balance of Tower
131724.description:
User Summary

In this physics based skill game you endeavor to transfer a number of blocks from point A to point B with the help of your mouse. Balancing the blocks is crucial as well as difficult. It will indeed take every ounce of your dexterity to prove yourself worthy of moving on to the next level...

131725.name: Battlemorph
131725.description:
Battlemorph is a game released on CD for the Atari Jaguar in 1995. It was an exclusive release for the system.

Battlemorph is the successor to Cybermorph, a 1993 pack-in title for the Jaguar system. The game takes place 30 years after the original and is set in the same universe, The Pernitian Empire.

The game is regarded as an improvement on its predecessor Cybermorph.

Source: Wikipedia, "Battlemorph", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

131726.name: Hover Strike: Unconquered Lands
131726.description:
Hover Strike: Unconquered Lands is a CD remake of a Jaguar cartridge title that was released in October 1995. The CD remake featured improved graphics and additional levels.

The cartridge version of Hover Strike was also released in 1995. The game puts you in the role of the pilot of a hovercraft tank. The game allows you to shoot your way through 30 different 3D levels which include terrain like ice, water, mountains and an enemy base you must infiltrate. Some of your weapons include guided missiles, grenades and lasers.

Most of the enemies in the game are low flying aircraft that follow and shoot at the player. There are also turrets and enemy hovercraft that are on the battlefield. Most of the missions order you to take down a certain amount of enemy rockets, sensors, or re-spawning bases.

Source: Wikipedia, "Hover Strike: Unconquered Lands", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

131727.name: Vid Grid
131727.description:
User Summary

Vid Grid was a pack-in title for the CD expansion for the Atari Jaguar. It is a puzzle game that uses music video clips. The player must unscramble the video image before a song is completed. Artists featured in the game include Aerosmith, Peter Gabriel, Guns N Roses, Hendrix, Metallica, Ozzy Osbourne, Red Hot Chili Peppers, Soundgarden and Van Halen.

131728.name: Pz8 Two Pages Wargaming Rules Collection
131728.description:
A collection of miniature wargaming rules that are only 2 pages (A4) long: the Pz8 rules are intended for a small table, ideally with "micro" models, play fast (from 30' to 1 hour) and are solo friendly.

Classic miniature wargaming mechanics are used, in the simplest possible way, but trying to keep a minimum degree of realism and allowing historical tactics. All rules use D6 for resolving combat. Some of the rules, like the WW2 and Modern land, use rulers for movement and weapons ranges, while others use a grid system, like the WW2 and Modern aerial (hexes) the WW1(squares) and the WW2 naval (large areas). Representational scales vary from 1 base of miniatures = 1 Battalion or 1 Platoon, to 1 model = 1 aircraft or ship, again depending on the rules set.

Available as a free .pdf the Pz8 Wargaming Rules Collection includes:

- Pz8 WW2 rules
- Pz8 1950-75 rules
- Pz8 1975-2010 rules
- Pz8 Sci-Fi rules
- Pz8 WW2 Divisional rules
- Pz8 1939-41 Naval rules
- Pz8 WW2 Coastal rules
- Pz8 Space rules
- Pz8 WW1 Divisional rules
- Pz8 1935-65 & WW1 Aerial rules
- Pz8 1965-75 Aerial rules
- Pz8 Colonial Wargame rules
- Pz8 Fantasy Wargame rules
- Legio VIII Ancient / Medieval Wargame rules

131729.name: Siebenstein
131729.description:
Aim of the game: Each of the players tries to create the L-shaped sign of the Flying Crane with his/her pieces. Their opponent tries to block him/her.

Each player has 9 pieces, 7 normal pieces and two blocking pieces in a different colour. Each player tries to get 4 of his/her pieces into an L-shaped position. The active player can either move one of his/her normal pieces (one space horizontally or vertically, and only onto empty spaces) or move one of their blocking pieces (up to two spaces horizontally or vertically, or one space diagonally).

The player who manages to create the sign of the Flying Crane wins the game.

131730.name: Halls of Undermountain 2: Tombs of Dayan
rpgseries: ADAP - Living Forgotten Realms Adapted Adventures
131730.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

A noblewoman fears that her nephew is lost on a fool’s errand into the dreaded Undermountain, and she turns to a group of adventurers to rescue him. A clue to his whereabouts might be located in a section of the dungeon once used as tombs. A Living Forgotten Realms adapted adventure set in Waterdeep and Undermountain for Adventure Level 2 (which supports character levels 1-5). This adventure is found in the Halls of Undermountain sourcebook, published by Wizards of the Coast.

This adaptation document does not present adjusted stat blocks for various tiers; any legal AL 2 table can play, but bear in mind that the stat blocks in the published adventure were written for a party of level 1 characters. We recommend that you allow at least 16 hours of playing time to complete this adventure (the equivalent of a four- round LFR adventure).

131731.name: Halls of Undermountain 3: Scaly Doom
rpgseries: ADAP - Living Forgotten Realms Adapted Adventures
131731.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

A noblewoman fears that her nephew is lost on a fool’s errand into the dreaded Undermountain, and she turns to a group of adventurers to rescue him. Between the adventurers and the final step in the search stands nothing short of a full-scale lizardfolk invasion. A Living Forgotten Realms adapted adventure set in Waterdeep and Undermountain for Adventure Level 2 (which supports character levels 1-5). This adventure is found in the Halls of Undermountain sourcebook, published by Wizards of the Coast.

This adaptation document does not present adjusted stat blocks for various tiers; any legal AL 2 table can play, but bear in mind that the stat blocks in the published adventure were written for a party of level 1 characters. We recommend that you allow at least 16 hours of playing time to complete this adventure (the equivalent of a four- round LFR adventure).

131732.name: Benjamin Blümchen: Sicher zur Schule
131732.description:
A roll-and-move game that aims at teaching children how to safely get to school (traffic rules).

The game consists of a game board, 4 player pieces, 16 cards, 60 plastic chips, a number die and a colour die. The board shows a path to school. The aim of the game is decided by the players - either being first to reach school or winning the most chips.
Players take turns rolling the number die and move their piece according to the die roll. If you land on a space with a circle next to it, you earn a chip. Reaching a stop sign means you have to stop. On your next turn, you roll the colour die and can move on if you roll green. Landing on a space with an exclamation mark means you've put yourself in danger (board shows a dangerous situation) and you lose a chip.
There is also a variant that uses cards: Before crossing a road, you have to answer a road safety question printed on one of the cards.

131733.name: Ropascris
131733.description:
User Summary

Remember Rock-Paper-Scissors from your childhood years? Well, here it is again, in the newest Tetris style puzzle game by Red Herring Labs. Try to eliminate as many blocks as possible by simply obeying the same rules as in Rock-paper-scissors.

131734.name: D100II System Reference Document
131734.description:
An OGL System Reference Document based on the first edition Mongoose Runquest System Reference Documents. Contains all the rules necessary for play in the original second edition, particularly the re-released Gloranthan Classics from Moon Design.

(Publisher blurb)

131735.name: Castles
131735.description:
Castles is a game for 2-4 players. Each player will try to build the biggest and superb castle. The player with most victory points wins.
Each player receive a building ground sheet with 4x7 building spaces, a gate token, a castle token and 32 wall tokens in one color.
The wall tokens from all player will be mixed face down in the middle of the table. This will be called stone pit.
In each round every player draw two wall token from the stone pit for his castle. Each correctly placed wall token will count one victory point.

In Castles werden die Spieler zu ideenreichen Baumeistern, welche aus dem vorhandenen, aber leider nicht immer passenden Material einen prächtigen (und möglichst vollständigen) Palast erbauen sollen. Dabei helfen Vorstellungskraft,
Improvisationstalent und architektonische Schadenfreude.

131736.name: Les Masques de Nyarlathotep
131736.description:
The newly-released French edition of the complete Masks of Nyarlathotep.
Box set.
From the publisher's website:

in French
De New York à Londres, puis du Caire au Kenya et de l’Australie jusqu’en Chine, affrontez les sombres cultes new-yorkais, la Fraternité du Pharaon Noir ou les Adorateurs du Grand Désert de Sable, jusqu’à défier l’incarnation du Chaos Rampant : Nyarlathotep lui-même !

Partez à l’aventure avec Les Masques de Nyarlathotep et découvrez une campagne entièrement remaniée :
• Des scénarios jouables dans n’importe quel ordre
• Plus de 70 plans et 80 aides de jeu parfaitement détaillés
• Des centaines de photos d’époque, sélectionnées pour leur précision historique
• Une espérance de vie revue à la hausse pour les téméraires investigateurs
Les Masques de Nyarlathotep se composent d’une introduction générale et six grands chapitres. Chacun d’eux est présenté dans un livret dédié, et un fascicule complémentaire regroupe toutes les aides de jeu. En bonus, découvrez la boite d’allumettes du Tigre Trébuchant.

New York, premières lueurs de l’aube.
Un corps sans vie est découvert dans une chambre d’hôtel.
Parviendrez-vous à découvrir ce qui se cache derrière  Les Masques de Nyarlathotep ?

Contenu de la boîte : 8 livrets (672 pages au total)
Livret 1 : Introduction et annexes utiles
Livret 2 : Chapitre new yorkais
Livret 3 : Chapitre londonien
Livret 4 : Chapitre égyptien
Livret 5 : Chapitre kényan
Livret 6 : Chapitre australien
Livret 7 : Chapitre chinois
Livret 8 : Documents à distribuer
Bonus : La boîte d'allumettes du Tigre Trébuchant

in English
The most exotic country ever written for the RPG Call of Cthulhu awaits you!

From New York to London, then from Cairo to Kenya and Australia to China, confront the dark cults New York, the Brotherhood of the Black Pharaoh or the worshipers of the Great Sandy Desert, to challenge the incarnation Crawling Chaos: Nyarlathotep himself!

Go on an adventure with Masks of Nyarlathotep campaign and discover a completely remodeled
• scenarios playable in any order
• Over 70 shots and 80 gaming aids perfectly detailed
• Hundreds of vintage photographs, selected for their historical accuracy
• Life expectancy revised upwards for the adventurous investigators Masks of Nyarlathotep consist of a general introduction and six chapters. Each is presented in a booklet dedicated and complementary booklet includes all aid gambling bonus, discover the matchbox Stumbling Tiger.

New York, the first light of dawn.
A lifeless body was discovered in a hotel room.
Can you discover what lies behind  Masks of Nyarlathotep ?

Box Contents: 8 books (672 pages total)
Booklet 1: Introduction and useful appendices
Book 2: Chapter New Yorker
Book 3: Chapter London
Book 4: Chapter Egyptian
Book 5: Chapter Kenyan
Booklet 6: Australian Chapter

131737.name: La Boîte à Quiz
131737.description:
The Box provides seventy-eight quizzes. Each card contains a fact and number of questions on a common theme.
Answer correctly and score a point. The player with the most points wins.

Several other rules are proposed including soloplay rules.

131738.name: La boîte à questions WWE
131738.description:
Similar to La Boîte à Quiz.

Questions about WWE and wrestling.

The Box provides seventy-eight quizzes. Each card contains a fact and number of questions on a common theme.
Answer correctly and score a point. The player with the most points wins.

131739.name: La boîte à questions Asterix
131739.description:
Similar to La Boîte à Quiz.

Questions about Asterix.

The Box provides seventy-eight quizzes. Each card contains a fact and number of questions on a common theme.
Answer correctly and score a point. The player with the most points wins.

131740.name: La Boîte à questions insolites
131740.description:
Similar to La Boîte à Quiz.

Topics are nations and customs, words and phrases, inventions and discoveries, history and geography etc. A thick booklet contains extensive responses.

The Box provides seventy-eight quizzes. Each card contains a fact and number of questions on a common theme.
Answer correctly and score a point. The player with the most points wins.

131741.name: La Boîte à énigmes  spéciale police scientifique
131741.description:
Another version of the La Scatola degli Enigmi.
Twenty-five murder mysteries in three levels of difficulty. The game master becomes aware of the full puzzle with its solution, and then reads the beginning of the investigation to the players. These can then ask questions that will be answered by yes or no. The gamemaster can help players by giving up three indices.

131742.name: La Boîte à énigmes pas si scientifiques que ça
131742.description:
Another version of the La Scatola degli Enigmi. This time the riddles refer to areas very familiar, and we wonder why we never asked these questions before. The answers, in turn, are often a good sense appalling.

Players or teams compete in puzzle-solving (sometimes timed, sometimes not) in order to score points in different categories. The first team (or player) to score a point in 4 of the 6 categories wins the game.

Every turn, the current player/team draws a card and hands it to the Dealer, a non-competitive figure that reads it aloud and then manages the competition between the people trying to solve the riddle.

131743.name: La boîte à Quiz junior
131743.description:
Based on the La Boîte à Quiz the game is more suitable for young audiences. The box contains everything needed to play except an hourglass, paper and pencil.

Topics are animals, plants, the earth, the human body, space, history and science. Each card contains a fact and number of questions on a common theme. Answer correctly and score a point. The player with the most points wins.

131744.name: La Boîte à énigmes junior
131744.description:
Junior version with fantasy theme

Players or teams compete in puzzle-solving (sometimes timed, sometimes not) in order to score points in different categories. The first team (or player) to score a point in 4 of the 6 categories wins the game.

Every turn, the current player/team draws a card and hands it to the Dealer, a non-competitive figure that reads it aloud and then manages the competition between the people trying to solve the riddle.

131745.name: La boîte à questions
131745.description:
Similar to La Boîte à Quiz with 150 general knowledge questions.

The Box provides seventy-eight quizzes. Each card contains a fact and number of questions on a common theme.
Answer correctly and score a point. The player with the most points wins.

131746.name: La Boîte à culture générale
131746.description:
160 cards featuring 300 questions with six categories ("Letters", "Science", "History", "Geography", "Arts "and" Sports "). A book with a general introduction, the rules and the detailed responses of the tests.

Each card contains a fact and number of questions on a common theme. Answer correctly and score a point. The player with the most points wins.

Several other rules are proposed including soloplay rules.

131747.name: Sierra 7
131747.description:
User Summary

Sierra is a top secret task force with a special assignment: Neutralization of various private militia forces on an all out war with each other. You are Sierra's 7th operative. Will your superior skills and tactics be enough to counter the sheer numbers and brute strength of the opposition?

131748.name: Pathways (Issue 19 - Oct 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Review: 101 Special Materials and Power Components
Review: Cerulean Seas: Waves of Thought
Twenty Questions with Ryan Costello, Jr
131748.description:
Pathways
Issue #19
October 2012
Pathways to a Witching good time!

Cover art by Mark Hyzer

131749.name: Savage Insider (Issue 6 - Oct 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Character Gallery: Halloween Jack and Halloween Jill
Character Gallery: Meara of the Cold Woods
What a Man's Got To Do
131749.description:
Savage Insider
Issue #6
October 2012

How do you incorporate holidays into your games?

Cover art by Aaron Acevedo

131750.name: THON
131750.description:
THON is a fast-paced tactical miniatures wargame for two or more players pitting the Starlight defending Thonians against the ruthless Sons of Ord. Will you defend the Warfront or raze it to ash?

Players play the role of the LAR, their faction's supreme leader, and control an elite force led by a Commander or Overlord.

THON uses a simple and elegant D6 system called SCOMA - Shooting, Combat, Movement, Armor.

www.thonthegame.com

boardgameimplementation: Mansions of Madness: Second Edition – Suppressed Memories – Figure and Tile Collection
131751.description:
Game description from the publisher:

"Briefly summarized, it hinted at a hidden race of monstrous beings which lurked somewhere among the remoter hills – in the deep woods of the highest peaks, and the dark valleys where streams trickle from unknown sources. These beings were seldom glimpsed, but evidences of their presence were reported by those who had ventured farther than usual up the slopes of certain mountains or into certain deep, steep-sided gorges that even the wolves shunned." –H.P. Lovecraft, "The Whisperer in Darkness"

Venture into the unknown with Mansions of Madness: Call of the Wild! Five new scenarios and eleven double-sided board tiles plunge investigators into the mysterious backwoods, shaking the foundations of what players have come to expect. The keeper has even more surprises at his disposal, and at times must solve ritual puzzles and seek out clues. A focus on outdoor maps encourages non-linear exploration, and new Allies assist in combat while driving the macabre narrative. Survive the wilderness in Call of the Wild!
131751.name: Mansions of Madness: Call of the Wild
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 43: Castles of Mad King Ludwig and Game Purchase Decision Making

131752.name: Tactical Assassin
131752.description:
User Sunmmary

You are a sniper on a number of tactical missions of assassination The difficulty of the missions gradually increases. Prior to each mission you receive a briefing. You need to figure out how to tactically shoot your target dead before he gets alarmed and foils your plans, leading to your own demise in the game. Being precise is critically important as you do not often have more than one or two available shots.

131753.description:
This is an abstract game with two boards. The action board is a 2X2 square grid with four actions (Place, Place, Move, Remove) in the spaces. The network board is also a 2x2 square grid but the pieces are placed on the 9 vertices of the grid.

Each player has five workers that use to take actions and/or place on the network board. Each turn a player has two actions per turn (except for the first player on the first turn who only has one action). To take an action a player takes one of their own workers from their supply and places it in an empty space on the action board and resolve the action accordingly. Instead of taking an action they may they may pass on one of their available actions - if they do so they must remove one of their workers from the action board (if they have any).

The three types of action on the action boards are:
Place: Place one of the activating workers in the Network board. Take the worker from either the General Supply or the "Place" Space just activated.
Move: Move either player's worker on the Network Board to an adjacent vertice or move either player's worker on the Action board to an adjacent space (do not activate the action under the moved worker).
Remove: Remove either player's worker from either the Network Board or the Action Board. The worker is returned to the player's general supply.

The game ends immediately when a player has three workers in a row on the Network Board.
131753.name: Five Worker's Morris

131755.name: Ország, város, híres ember
131755.description: Hungarian trivia game. Random draw a letter to different categories (country, city, famous man) each round. The players try to write things with beginning the suitable letters. What somebody else did not write is worth one point. The player collect the most points is the winner.

131756.name: Kérdezz ! Felelek
131756.description: The game "Kérdezz-Felelek" (Ask me - I answer) presents well-known faces of literature and arts, geographical locations, rare species of fauna and abstractions. During the game we retrieve our knowledge from our memory whilst we learn new things. Players move along the board based on their answers and whoever crosses the FINISH line first, wins.

131757.name: Durance
rpghonor: 2012 Indie RPG Award - Best Production - Runner-Up
2012 Indie RPG Award - Game of the Year - Runner-Up
2012 Indie RPG Award - Most Innovative Game - Runner-Up
131757.description:
Publisher blurb:

On a remote planet orbiting a distant star...
...the worst criminal scum from a dozen star systems have been dumped, charged with building new lives under the watchful eye of Authority. Within a brutal hierarchy of savagery and servility, convicts and guards alike must make hard choices. Every colonist has their own code of conduct and their own aspirations—aspirations that invariably come at the expense of everyone else. This dangerous new world is too small for everyone to succeed. In fact, it may well be too small for anyone to succeed. Only the shrewdest, the toughest and the luckiest will get a chance to find out. Will you be among them?

Durance is a fast-paced, low-prep, highly collaborative game in the tradition of Fiasco. Players in Durance assume the dual roles of convicts and guards trying to survive on an outrageously hostile planet. The thin veneer that separates the two classes tends to erode during play, raising questions about corruption, justice and mercy.

131758.name: Landmaus & Stadtmaus: Sherlock Maus
131758.description:
A roll-and-move game based on the cartoon series "The Country Mouse and the City Mouse Adventures".
The aim of this cooperative children's game is to lead all 4 pawns through the story of the stolen diamond and to solve the case together with Emily, Alexander and Sherlock Mouse before Notail Nogoodnik, the thief, is seen five times.

The board shows a track consisting of lots of coloured spaces and pictures from the cartoon series. There are four pawns. Players take turns rolling the colour die. The active player moves a pawn of his/her choice to the next space of the colour on the die roll (all players can move all pawns). If a pawn lands on a yellow space, one of the twenty, randomly distributed face-down tiles has to be turned over. If it shows a picture from the board, the pawn is moved to the corresponding space. If the tile shows Notail Nogoodnik, it stays face-up and the player's turn is over.
To get a pawn to the finish line, the spaces has to be reached exactly.

If all four player pawns reach the finish line, all players win together. If five tiles showing Notail Nogoodnik are turned over, they all lose together.

131759.name: cHTeMeLe
131759.description:
cHTeMeLe the first HTML5 certified boardgame, the nearly collaborative and nearly educational game about HTML language

The aim of this new board game is fairly easy : create THE HTML page with the cards you have to hand... the game is played from 2 to 5 players, each player endorses a web browser (Firefox, Safari, Chrome, Opera, Explorer). Lay out your tag cards, and respect the web standards and rules and accumulate points. Play the "events" cards to step in each others browser's way (crash, bug, etc.) or help you in the race for building the web page.

131760.name: Damage Inc.: Pacific Squadron WWII
131760.description:
From rear box cover

Rule the Air, Win the Day!
Take to the skies and pilot over 30 accurately represented aircraft as you engage in the greatest aerial battles of WWII. From the attack on Pearl Harbor to the fierce Battle of Iwo Jima, fight your way across the Pacific Theater and defend your nation's freedom.

* Fly over 20 single-player and co-op missions spanning 10 historically accurate maps.

* Engage in head-to-head dogfights with up to 8 players on the PlayStation®Network.

* Perform intense carrier take off and landings.

131761.name: Pacific AV8R Flightstick
131761.description:
From the box cover

Styled after WWII Combat Aircraft the Pacific AV8R FlightStick is "Closer to Reality".

Box Contents

* Custom Decal Kit
* 3 buttons, realistic trigger and POV analog stick
* Historically-inspired grip with soft-touch rubber finish
* Integrated throttle enhances realism
* Aircraft-inspired toggle switches

Works great with Damage Inc.: Pacific Squadron WWII. Also works with:

* Birds of Steel
* Birds of Prey
* Hawx 1
* Hawx 2
* Apache Air Assault
* Heroes over Europe
* Blazing Angels
* Blazing Angels 2

131762.name: Tactical Assassin 2
131762.description:
User Summary

You are an assassin undertaking missions to exterminate targets. Pay close attention to the briefings and be swift and precise. Additionally, you use an array of weapons at your disposal.

131763.name: Tactical Assassin Substratum
131763.description:
User Summary

In this third revision of the highly original Tactical Assassin game you can witness the rush of 9 brand new missions of shooting and slashing your target to pieces. You have to be as fast as possible while avoiding mistakes at the same time.

Bottom line: Be swift and accurate. No setbacks will be tolerated.

131764.name: Tactical Assassin 3
131764.description:
User Summary

Stealth... Accuracy... Speed of action... Sharp shooting...
It is these skills that will get you far in this latest version of the highly original Tactical Assassin game. Having an array of weapons and equipment at your disposal, get behind the scope and set yourself ready for some high efficiency target eliminations.

131765.name: Weapon
131765.description:
user Summary

Your chopper has crashed... Your teammates are trapped... Enemies are swarming in... You are your team's only hope towards defending your craft. Shoot to kill! Spare no-one! Each one of your kills represents a bonus towards upgrading your resources and becoming more efficient. How long can you last?

131766.name: Microsoft Pinball Arcade
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
131766.description:
Back of CD:

You'll flip over seven classic pinball machines that look, sound, and play like the real thing. Go for the high score on one groundbreaking table from each decade -- from the 1930s to the present day. The widest variety of tables, realistic ball physics, and striking graphics all add up to wickedly fast action for current and prospective pinball wizards.

User Summary:

Includes 7 tables from Gottlieb, one from each decade:


Baffle Ball (1931)
Humpty Dumpty (1947)
Knock Out (1950)
Slick Chick (1963)
Spirit of '76 (1976)
Haunted House (1982)
Cue Ball Wizard (1992)

131767.name: Microsoft Revenge of Arcade
131767.description:
Back of CD:

Remember when arcade machines gobbled up your quarters as fast as Ms. Pac-Man gobbled up dots in a maze? Now you can relive those memories with the sights, sounds, and vengefully addictive gameplay of five fantastic arcade classics, and save your quarters for something else.

User Summary:

Includes the following games:


Ms. Pac-Man
Rally-X
Xevious
Mappy
Motos

131768.name: Bicycle Rummy
131768.description:
Back of CD:

Easy to learn, fast-playing, and exciting for all ages! Discover why Rummy has been an American favorite for generations!


Nine variations of Rummy including 500 Rum, Gin Rummy, and Oklahoma Gin
Progressing difficulty levels make Bicycle Rummy a constant challenge for beginners and seasoned players alike
Play against the computer, or, at the touch of a button, pick up partners and take on opponents all over the world via the Microsoft Internet Gaming Zone
Advance skills or learn while you play by selecting step-by-step on-screen tutoring, immediate feedback on moves, hints, and replay features
Master Rummy strategy by choosing from nine game variations, creating and saving scenarios for later play and review

131769.name: Maximum Pool
131769.description:
User Summary:

3D pool simulation supporting 8-ball, billiards, snooker, and more. Supports multiple difficulty levels and options.

131770.name: Dig Dug: Digging Strike
131770.description:
Back of box:

The arcade classic returns with a dual-screen twist and all new gameplay features.


Clear 15 stages and over 80 areas. Sink the enemy bosses to advance to the next area.
Stop enemies or guide them through the tunnels with unique weapons and items.
Find and acquire items such as Fossil Fragments to unlock levels and special items to help you clear the most challenging levels.
Play parodies of classic Namco Games with Horivalou and Hori X to help Dig Dug drive the monsters into the sea.

131771.name: Mystery P.I. - Portrait of a Thief
131771.description:
Back of box:

Expose An Artful Thief!

As a world-famous P.I., you have been hired to find the priceless paintings stolen from a private art collection.

Solve the case!

Search for clues, solve puzzles, and master mini-games to crack the case in this all-new episode of the award-winning Mystery P.I. series!

131772.name: Invizimals
131772.description:
The gameplay of Invizimals has been compared to the Pokémon series, involving players capturing and raising different species of creatures, and allowing the player to battle with them, either against an AI or with others using the PSP's wireless abilities. Unlike Pokémon however, Invizimals requires the player to hunt and capture these creatures within the real world, using the concept of augmented reality, a camera attachment for the PlayStation Portable, and a physical "trap" square-shaped device used as a fiduciary marker. These monsters are spawned at different environments (determined by colors of surfaces and time of day), and the trap is used to capture the monsters. Once captured, players are able to raise and level their monsters, and allow them to learn different attacks that can be used in battle. Players can also use the trap to view their monsters, and take pictures of their collection.

Source: Wikipedia, "Invizimals", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

131773.name: Invizimals: Shadow Zone
131773.description:
The title is set to feature over 100 new creatues to collect, the ability to modify the Invizimals via name, and colour changes, as well as the ability to choose from a larger selection of attacks. Shadow Zone will also feature a new campaign, and a co-operative capture mode. The game also includes a needed trap card to play.

Source: Wikipedia, "Invizimals: Shadow Zone", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

131774.name: Invizimals: The Lost Tribes
131774.description:
Continue where Invizimals: Shadow Zone ended and explore the mysterious Shadow Zone to rescue hero Keni, or begin a brand new adventure as fellow explorers Jazmin or Alex

The title is set to feature 150 creatures to collect, with 70 brand new ones, and 80 of the community's favourite previous Invizimals.

Source: Wikipedia, "Invizimals: The Lost Tribes", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

131775.name: Hipsters: The Card Game
131775.description:
Can you become the biggest hipster? Collect cappuccinos, canvas bags, and LPs while avoiding mainstream items to prove your Cred.

Each player is uniquely assigned two traits (from the pool of Academic, Activist, Elitist, or Grungeling) and is dealt a hand of eight items. An item has a trait - one of the above four or the detestable Mainstream. In turn order, each player selects a card from that hand to play. A player can play the card on himself, which will give him positive score if it matches one of his traits and negative score otherwise. If the player already has a negative scoring card, he can play a negative scoring card on another player. After each player has chosen played one card, everyone rotates hands to the next player.

Each trait has one card of each of ten point values. If a card is played on a player who already has a card of that value, the new one covers and replaces the old card. At the end of the game, each player totals their score and adds or subtracts points for a run of at least two cards of the same color - scoring or losing a point for every card in the run, depending on whether that color is positive or negative for the player. Highest total score wins!

131776.name: Golden Oldies: Computer Software Classics, Volume 1
131776.description:
Back of Box

Have fun playing the classics!

Play and learn from four of the greatest game programs of all time -In their original, uncut, officially endorsed versions!

Adventure

Explore the deep and twisted recesses of Colossal Cave. Experience the thrills and danger of gathering treasure while using your wits to outmaneuver the peril that lurks around very corner. Here is the only version of Adventure officially endorsed by its creators, Will Crowther and Don Woods. This is the first, the original, the complete Adventure. This is the one that started it all.

"Playing adventure games without tackling this one is like being an English major who's never glanced at Shakespeare"... Whole Earth Software Catalog

Eliza

In 1965, M.I.T. Professor Joseph Weizenbaum astounded the scientific community by creating the pioneering Artificial Intelligence program, ELIZA. Eliza simulates with uncanny reality, your conversation with a psychiatrist. Hailed as a breakthrough in computer science, Eliza provided a model for generations of Artificial Intelligence research in the years to come.

Here is a faithful recreation of The Original Artificial Intelligence Classic--Eliza, in the version that has been described as, "Standing head and shoulders above previous attempts to bring the original mainframe program to the microcomputer."

Life

"There is a fantastic computer game called Life. It is played by collegiate computer hackers, by film makers experimenting with animation, and sundry others. Life was devised in 1970 by John Horton Conway, a young mathematician at the University of Cambridge and introduced to the world by Martin Gardner in the pages of Scientific American. Described as both a game and a video art form, Life has had a cult following ever since.

But it's more than that, The Life screen is a world unto itself. It has its own objects, phenomena, and physical laws. It is a window onto an alternate universe."... Wm. Poundstone "The Recursive Universe"

"The deepest of all computers games"... Whole Earth Software Catalog

"People with home computers who wonder what to do with them might try their hand at Life. It is a game unlike any other."... The Los Angeles Times

Pong

In 1972, Electronics Engineer Al Alcorn created the video game "Pong" for Nolan Bushnell's fledgling company, "Atari". He changed, forever, the way world plays.

For this edition of "Golden Oldies", Al has recreated for us, his original classic.

Experience once again, the game that burst out of Andy Capps's Bar in Sunnyvale, California and became a national craze. (We have included an alternate version with some added wrinkles that takes full advantage of your modern microcomputer's capabilities.)

131777.name: Tank Battle: 1944
131777.description:
Tank Battle: 1944 is a new exciting turn-based strategy game release for iPhone / iPod and iPad.

Instantly get involved in the action by taking command of an American armored battle group and help liberate Europe from the evil Axis power-base!

Key Features:
■12 Mission American Campaign.
■12 Unique Units.
■High Definition World War II Graphics.
■Hours of Gameplay.
■4 Pass & Play Multiplayer Scenarios.
■Game Center Achievements and Leaderboards.
■Universal App (Works on iPhone & iPad)
■Download Extra Campaigns: ■12 mission German campaign + 4 multiplayer missions.
■Bastogne campaign coming soon.

Source: The Game Website.

131778.name: Adventures Dark and Deep: A Curious Volume of Forgotten Lore
131778.description:
From the website:

"A supplement designed for use with any old school rules, allowing you to add new classes, spells, an alternate combat system, and much more!"

"A Curious Volume of Forgotten Lore is not a stand-alone game. It is a rules supplement intended for use with other games such as AD&D, Labryinth Lord, Swords & Wizardry, OSRIC, etc. It contains:

Five new character classes: bard, jester, mystic, savant, mountebank
Hundreds of new spells
A new alternative combat system that is at once streamlined and more realistic
Rules for shipborne adventures and combat
Quick and easy rules for common hazards and weather
New magic items
New monsters
And much more!"

131779.name: Break the Bricks
131779.description:
User description:

A clasic brick breaking game. The player moves a paddle at the bottom side of the screen to reflect a ball back towards the upperide of the screen where the ball breaks the bricks.
The game offers 3 different levels of difficulty (i.e. speed) and 60 different levels.

131780.name: Kairobotica
131780.description:
User Summary

In Kairobotica the player controls a mobile space platform that docks onto different planets and sends its force of Kairobots to patrol different regions.

During those patrols they will encounter a huge amount of different enemies which they have to combat. Those battles are fought like Japanese RPGs where the player can issue commands and watch the fight unfold automatically.

With each mission the player gains money and items which he can use the improve his base. Factories can be build that create new robots for his army and farms and shops produce wares that can be sold to the inhabitants of the planet.

131781.name: Last Line of Defense
131781.description:
User Summary

You, and a handful of teammates, are humanity's last line of defense against a highly virulent virus mutating all infected victims into bloodthirsty ravagers. On the bright side, you have amassed enough weaponry, special ammo and bunker defenses to aid you in fending off all 25 waves of the onslaught. A breach in your bunker, however, will signify the fall of humanity. Do you have what it takes to make it?

131782.name: Traffic Jam
131782.description:
"Traffic Jam, addictive and challenging puzzle game.

★ Tablet supported ★
Traffic Jam is a very addictive puzzle game. The objective of the game is to get the yellow car out of the traffic jam. Sound simple, but incredible challenging at the difficult level.

The game contains 5000 levels, guarantee hours of entertainment.

3 Themes included:
- Car park
- Harbor
- Ice block
- Plain block"

Source: The Developer Website.

131783.name: Potion Panic
131783.description:
User Summary

In Potion Panic you have one simple task: To mix three base ingredients in various combinations and create an array of magical concoctions. These will help you fend off, explode, burn or even liquefy and melt an onslaught of monsters before they breach your line of defense. Be resourceful and creative. How hard can that be?

131784.name: Defender (2011)
131784.description:
User description:

A tower defense game with a fantasy theme. Shoot arrows at the attacking monster and when the arrows are not enough anymore you can also use spells.

131785.name: Shoot the Apple
131785.description:
User description:

Shoot the apple is a physics puzzle. You have to shot an alien from a cannon and have to hit an apple.
There are 400 levels with many different themes.

131786.name: Bunny Shooter
131786.description:
Get your revenge against the bunnies who stole your beloved carrots in this funny and addictive physics- based bow-and-arrow shooting game!

Take on puzzles and archery accuracy challenges using a wide array ofarrows as you navigate throughout the 3 Bunny worlds, each featuring its own set of fun, yet challenging levels.

Show off to your friends and the world via Facebook, Twitter, and the Game Center leaderboard. Be prepared for a level builder soon!

Source: The Developer Website.

131787.name: Space Jump
131787.description:
User description:

A vertically scrolling jumping game like Doodle Jump.

131788.description:
In Game Over, each player is a small barbarian looking for his princess, but she's locked away in a dungeon — represented by a 5x5 square of face-down cards — and to free her you need to locate the key. To visit a room, place your character on a card, then reveal it to see what you encounter; perhaps something unfortunate like Blorks, the exit (which you can hope to use later), or perhaps even the key...

Game Over is based on the comics of the same name illustrated by Midam.
131788.name: Game Over
boardgamepodcastepisode: [Reviews] N°39-B Fin de l’enquête au port des fourmis préhistoriques

131789.name: The Deadly Seven
rpghonor: 2013 ENnie for Best Electronic Book - Nominee
131789.description:
From the publisher's website:

The Deadly Seven is a modern-era supernatural horror adventure that pits the characters against seven unwitting servants of hell. The players will have to contend with a variety of threats both direct and indirect ranging from drive-by shootings and murderous psychopaths to rogue hackers, misguided zealots, and the demonically possessed. As each encounter draws them deeper into the grip of evil, they’ll have to find the connection between their seemingly unrelated opponents to find the sinister mastermind manipulating events behind the scenes.

A multi-part adventure, The Deadly Seven can be played as an extended campaign or as 7-8 independent scenarios ranging from all-out action to tense investigations. Each segment is designed to be incorporated into an ongoing story but the story also works if you play straight through.

The Deadly Seven is suitable for any modern urban setting that includes paranormal activity. It can also be a great way to introduce the paranormal into an otherwise-mundane campaign.

The Deadly Seven is also a sourcebook on demons and the theology of demonic possession, outlining the various stages of – and rules for – possession and exorcism. These sections can be printed out as player hand-outs


150 pages of text + 30 pages of character stats + 21 pages of maps
Full Color, Fully Illustrated, Multi-Layered PDF
7+ Individual Adventure Scenarios
5 Multi-Page Maps Including Offices, Homes, & Neighborhoods.
2 Sets of Clue Cards for player hand-outs.
3 System Compatibility


Contains adult situations. May not be appropriate for individuals under 17.

131790.name: Caravan
131790.description:
From the publisher's website:'

Set in 3000 B.C.E., a time without the myths and legends we now take for granted — because they either haven’t happend yet or are happening right now. Would-be gods and previously unheard-of monsters stalk the earth openly building armies and recruiting followers.

Explore ancient Mesopotamia and take part in the birth of empires and the dawn of civilization itself. In the process, the players will to protect a trade caravan as it travels from Ur to Nineveh. Along the way, they’ll battle the desert sun, be attacked by bandits, and kicked by the camels they’re supposed to be protecting.

While mostly adventure, this book is also a bronze-ages sourcebook for the Mesopotamian region, complete with a regional map, details on the cultures of the time, and minor rules and equipment modifications for bronze gear.

Thoroughly researched, Caravan is historically accurate, or at least as accurate as you can get while still having halflings running around underfoot.


50 pages of text and illustrations
8 pages of maps

131792.name: Bonk's Revenge (GB)
131792.description:
User Summary

Take on the role of Bonk the cave boy as you flip, climb, and bash enemies with your head through prehistoric levels.

131793.name: Beetlejuice (GB)
131793.description:
User Summary

A side scrolling platformer where the player takes on the role of Beetlejuice, in search of his friend Lydia. This game is based on the cartoon series of the same name (as opposed to the movie).

131794.name: Batman: Return of the Joker (GB)
131794.description:
User Summary

The Joker is back, and it is up to Batman to fight his way through this platformer to stop him. Batman has his fists and Batarangs to get the job done through four different levels.

131795.name: Bill Elliot's NASCAR Fast Tracks
131795.description:
User Summary

Choose from three different cars to race on four different tracks. You can practice on the different courses, run a single race, setting the number of laps you would like, or take a run for the championship through multiple courses.

131796.name: Casino Funpak
131796.description:
User Summary

Visit the casino and try to make it rich. You can play slots, roulette, craps, poker, and video poker. Enter a tournament that consists of all 5 games, and try not go home broke.

131798.name: Cool Ball
131798.description:
User Summary

The player is a ball that must navigate the platform levels in order to pick up needed items and get to the exit. Bounce through a total of 99 stages to win.

131799.name: CosmoTank
131799.description:
User Summary

Shoot the enemies in first person and third person views from your space tank. Upgrade weapons and armor to strengthen your abilities while searching out and destroying military bases and enemy bosses.

131800.name: Cyraid
131800.description:
User Summary

Choose from the Fighter or the Warrior to get through the maze-like platform stages and save Natasia.

131801.name: Frozen Bubble
131801.description:
Frozen Bubble is a free software Puzzle Bobble style computer game which is available on several operating systems including Linux, Windows, Mac OS X, the Symbian Series 60, Windows Phone 7 and Android line of smartphones. There is also a single player Java applet version.
The original Frozen Bubble was written in Perl by Guillaume Cottenceau, and uses the Simple DirectMedia Layer (SDL) library. The game features 100 levels and includes a level editor. Like many popular free software/open source games, it features penguins a la Tux, who in this game shoot the coloured frozen bubbles to form groups of the same colour. Such groups disappear and the object is to clear the whole screen in this way before a bubble passes a line at the bottom.
Version 2.0 offers multiplayer play via LAN and Internet. Two players can also play on the same computer. This version is presently for Unix-like operating systems (such as Linux, Mac OS X, etc.) only. The chain reaction mode (where fallen bubbles will zoom back up to complete triplets, possibly falling more bubbles and thus creating more combos) is also available in network mode as of Version 2.0, and greatly changes the mechanics of the game.
The game is released under the GNU General Public License.

Source: Wikipedia, "Frozen Bubble", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

131802.name: Kérdezz ! Felelek: Új kártyák
131802.description:
Expansion for Kérdezz ! Felelek.

Several new cards with new well-known men/women of literature and arts, geographical locations, animals and abstractions can be used with those from the base game.

The game does not contain scoring board and tokens and not change the base game rules.

131803.name: Archipelago (Third Edition)
131803.description:
user summary

Revised rules, new layout

from the introduction

About Archipelago
Archipelago is a story/role-playing game where each player controls a major character. Player take turns directing and playing out a part of their character’s story, leading them towards their selected point of destiny, while other players interact with and influence that story.

131805.name: ScrapIron
131805.description:
A post-apocalyptic vehicular combat game for 2 to 8 players. It uses the quick setup and rapid play of a card game and combines it with the tactile and visual strategy and excitement of a miniatures game. Nothing needs to be written down during play, it's a great way to introduce younger card game players to the world of miniature gaming. Gameplay is normally 15-30 minutes and most players will understand the rules after their first game. How many wargames can fit all their rules on a single sheet of paper?

ScrapIron is 100% Zombie Free!

Players each use a miniature vehicle as their playing piece. The game was designed around the popular Hot Wheels and Matchbox lines but can be easily adapted to any size vehicle.

Players choose equipment from an Equipment Deck prior to the start of the game.

Action cards are chosen during the planning phase and placed face down. Order if play is determined randomly and actions are then carried out in that order.

When damage is dealt, cards of the Damage Deck are given to the target player. Damage cards will either assign Structural Damage to the vehicle, 10 points and the car is out of the game, or cause special effects. These effects could cause the car to spin out and face a random direction, cause the player to lose Action cards or otherwise harm the target.

When the last car remains that player is the winner! That did not take long, why not play again?

131806.name: Wicked Heroes: Children of the Mirror
131806.description:
From the publisher:

In 1724, an obsidian mirror, discovered in the distant lands of South America, was brought back to Spain. The captain of the ship went mad, the mirror went missing, but the seed had already been planted.

A seed of wickedness and evil.

The sorcery did not sleep. Over the next century, it crept into the womb of the world, infecting the innocent. Granting gifts both blessed and cursed.

Now, the children of the mirror walk our streets. Their secrets are not our own. The sorcery in their blood marks them. Makes them beautiful. Makes them dangerous. Makes them better than us.

Gifts and Curses. Those who fly. Those who can change. Those who can see. Each is given a single Gift. And a Curse. Those who become infected with the sorcery of the black mirror pass these Gifts and Curses on to their offspring.

We know the inheritors of this legacy. Their names ring in our memories. And as the mirror changes hands, almost by a will of its own, new generations are born, bearing the mark.

Each born with one Blessing, one Curse. But if one kills the other, he steals her Blessing, adding it to his own, replacing his Curse with hers.

They are faster than us. They are stronger than us. They are better than us.

Children of the Mirror. Blessed and Damned.

131807.name: Kavelspel
131807.description:
Kavelspel is a four player game. Each player has 9 tiles of the same colour. At the beginning of the game the tiles are placed on squares of corresponding colour: f.i. blue tiles on blue squares. Each group of 9 squares (in the corners) is rimmed by a line in one of the four colours, blue, green, red or yellow.
The object of the game is to move the tiles to the corner rimmed by the colour corresponding with the colour of the players tiles.
In each move the players may move one of their tiles a number of squares (1 or more) in a horizontal or vertical direction.
From the moment a player has reached the target square with one of his tiles, he is allowed to remove one of the tiles of the opponents from his target area, thus making room for his own tiles.
When a target area is filled with eight of the required tiles of the same colour, there is one square unoccupied. The only one that may fill that square at this stage of the game is the player that needs to complete the number of nine tiles in the target area. That would be his final move. However he is only allowed to move that final piece one square per turn.

131808.name: Tux Racer
131808.description:
Tux Racer is a Free Software 3D computer game starring the Linux mascot, Tux the penguin. In the game, the player controls Tux (or one of three other characters) as he slides down a course of snow and ice collecting herring. Sliding on ice makes Tux go faster, while sliding on snow allows for more maneuverability and sliding on rocky patches will slow Tux down. There are also trees to block Tux's path and flags for the sake of marking out the course.

Source: Wikipedia, "Tux Racer", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

131809.name: Voyages to the Worlds of SF Gaming (Issue 8 - Jul 1989)
rpgissue: Voyages to the Worlds of SF Gaming

131810.name: Home Alone (Amiga/DOS)
131810.description:
In the Home Alone game for the PC, the player is given from 8:00 to 9:00 (approximately 5 minutes of real time) to set up traps in order to hurt the Wet Bandits once they arrive. No further setting of traps is possible after this period. Each trap can only be triggered once and they all inflict the same amount of damage.
Marv and Harry arrive separately at the two entrances to the house. If the player touches either of Bandits, he is caught and the game immediately ends in defeat. Hurting a Bandit ten times will permanently incapacitate him. The ultimate objective is to incapacitate both burglars.
The player can trigger his own traps, resulting in no harmful effects, but the trap will instantly disappear. If the player has too few remaining traps to sufficiently hurt each Bandit, the game will continue, but victory will be impossible. Following a game, the player may enter his name into a high score list. The player's position on the list is determined by whether the game was a win or a loss; by the time taken to defeat the Bandits; and by the total damage the player inflicted.

Source: Wikipedia, "Home Alone (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

131812.name: [_BLÄNK]
131812.description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION



The information that BGG has on this item indicates that [_BLÄNK] is a non-authorized version of Cards Against Humanity. According to the designers of Cards Against Humanity, the producers of [_BLÄNK] do not have license to produce this game, thus it is set apart from the official entry of Cards Against Humanity.




A card game which involves a judge choosing a black question or fill-in-the-blank card. Each player holds a hand of ten cards at the beginning of each round, and each player contributes card(s) to the "[_BLÄNK]-Master" anonymously. The [_BLÄNK]-Master determines which card(s) are funniest in the context of the question or fill-in-the-blank card.

The player who submitted the chosen card(s) is given the question card to represent a "Siegkarte" (Win Card).

In addition, there are a few extra rules. First, some question cards are "Pick 2" or "Pick 3" cards, which require each participant to submit cards in sequence to complete their answer. Second, a gambling component also exists. If a question is played which a player believes they have two possible winning answers for, they may pay in a "Siegkarte" to play a single second answer. If the player who gambled wins, they retain the wagered point, but if they lose, the player who contributed the winning answer takes both points.
After each round, the role of the [_BLÄNK]-Master rotates around the table, and play continues until everyone decides to stop.

Gameplay is identical to "Cards Against Humanity", but was translated to German.

131813.name: Sector 57: Tournament Science Fiction
131813.description:
user summary

A tournament SF scenario for 2 players based (roughly) on classic Traveller. From p.20 of the referee's guide:

Many of the concepts in Sector 57 have been adopted from Traveller game elements. You will note that H'alster and Monorian are glorified characters from the GDW system.

NOTE: Traveller is not needed to play this scenario.

The module contains the following components:


24 page 8.5x11" referee's guide
11x25.5" (trifold) referee's shield
Players situation sheet (8.5x11")
2x player character info sheets (8.5x11")
3 additional 8.5x11" sheets with figures/maps for the scenario

videogame: Fallout: New Vegas – Gun Runners' Arsenal
Fallout: New Vegas – Old World Blues
131814.name: Fallout: New Vegas – Ultimate edition
videogamefranchise: Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)
Platinum Range (Best Selling PlayStation Games, PAL)
videogamecompilation: Fallout: New Vegas – Gun Runners' Arsenal
Fallout: New Vegas – Old World Blues
131814.description:
Fallout: New Vegas
Action role-playing open world video game developed by Obsidian Entertainment, and published by Bethesda Softworks. It was released for Microsoft Windows, PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360 in October 2010. The game is based in a post-apocalyptic environment in and around Las Vegas, Nevada.
The player takes control of "the Courier", who is hired by a delivery service to take an unknown package across the Mojave Desert to "The Strip" but intercepted, shot in the head, and left for dead by a mysterious man who steals the package. After being found by a friendly local robot, Victor, and healed by a man named Doc Mitchell, the Courier is thrust back into the desert to seek revenge and recover the stolen package. Through doing this, the player becomes caught up between various factions competing for control over the desert and it's most valuable asset, the Hoover Dam; ultimately coming to shape the future of its inhabitants.

Dead Money
In the first DLC pack, named Dead Money, the Courier is captured by an insane ex-Brotherhood of Steel leader known as "Father" Elijah and must work alongside three other captives to find the fabled treasure of the Sierra Madre Casino. The pack adds new achievements/trophies, perks, terrain, enemies and decisions for the player, as well as raising the level cap by 5.

Honest Hearts
In Honest Hearts, the Courier is part of an expedition to Utah's Zion National Park, when they are attacked by tribal raiders. While trying to return to the Mojave, the player becomes involved in conflicts between the tribes and between a "New Canaanite" missionary and an individual known as the "Burned Man", Caesar's former Legate, who, after losing the first battle of Hoover Dam, was covered in pitch, set on fire, and thrown into the Grand Canyon. The pack adds new achievements/trophies, perks, terrain, enemies and decisions for the player, as well as raising the level cap by 5.

Old World Blues
In Old World Blues, the Courier unwittingly becomes a lab rat in a science experiment gone awry and discovers how some of the Mojave's mutated creatures came to exist. Old World Blues takes place in the Pre-War research centers of Big Mountain, known colloquially as "the Big Empty" or "Big MT" (where Father Elijah had found most of his equipment prior to Dead Money, such as the bomb collars and the holorifle, along with Christine also from Dead Money). The player can also choose to either turn on their kidnappers or join with them to fight an even greater threat. This pack offers new achievements/trophies, perks, a vast area to explore, and raises the level cap by 5 like the previous two packs. The player can only explore in the area until the main storyline of the DLC has been completed, but after completing it, can return back to the area at will.

Lonesome Road
Lonesome Road concludes the story of the Courier, focusing on Ulysses, a former Frumentarii of Caesar who had discovered the "Divide": a glorious land until the New California Republic annexed it. This caused Caesar to retaliate and send a small army to seize the Divide, resulting in the NCR ordering the Courier to deliver a package which would trap the armies of the NCR and the Legion and turn the Divide into a tornado strewn land full of ghouls, called Marked Men, and other dangers. Ulysses believes the Courier to be responsible for the mess of the Divide and when he is ordered to deliver the Platinum Chip, he realizes Benny's plan and discovers the Courier to be alive. When discovering the Courier is not dead, Ulysses contacts the Courier and asks him/her to enter the Divide, evoking the start of Lonesome Road.

Gun Runners' Arsenal and Courier's Stash
Gun Runners' Arsenal adds various new weapons and weapon mods (along with new ammo types) to the game, which can be found throughout the game world. Courier's Stash contains all bonus content that was previously only available for pre-ordering the game (the Caravan Pack, Classic Pack, Mercenary Pack and Tribal Pack).

Source: Wikipedia, "Fallout: New Vegas", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

131815.name: Hobomancer
rpghonor: 2013 ENnie for Best Electronic Book - Silver Winner
131815.description:
From the publishers website:

Among the countless hobos who ride the rails looking for work in 1930s America, there exists a secret society of magicians known as the hobomancers. The hobomancers face all the same problems as rank-and-file hobos—hunger, mean-spirited railway bulls, bad hooch—but they must also concern themselves with defending reality as we know it. If the hobomancers don’t ride the rails and keep the songlines of the world in balance, dark magic will run rampant, monsters will ravage the land, and the very laws of nature will collapse.

Hobomancer is a role-playing game, designed for use with the QAGS Second Edition rules, which combines American history, folklore, and pulp fiction into a thick, rich Mulligan stew of adventure. This jam-packed 150+ page PDF includes: an overview of the songlines, the source of the hobomancers’ magic; details on the magical tradition of hobomancy; a description of hobo magic, including notable otherworldly entities the PCs can encounter; information about hobo life; a general overview of life in the 1930s; game-specific rules and character creation ideas; an explanation of hobo magic and Hobo Powers; GMing tips; game information on over 20 monsters, including the dream-snatcher, the gumberoo, and the traveling salesdemon; a full adventure, “Hobo of Hamlin”; and appendices that include a Hobomancer Timeline, Hobo Signs, Hobo Lingo, the Random Hobo Name Generator (which offers over ten million possible hobo names), ritual magic rules, useful tables, sample characters, and more.

Hobomancer features both period photographs and original illustrations by Joshua LH Burnett, Jeffrey Johnson, Juan Navarro, and Chris Newman.

131816.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The City provides those who live within it a chance to pursue their lives with a modicum of safety and comfort. However, though the outside world is kept outside, any alert adventurer strolling through the City Gate will feel the tension humming in the air.

Talisman (fourth edition): The City Expansion provides players with six new characters, three alternative endings, its own deck, and a host of shops for all your questing needs. Collect bounties listed on the Wanted Posters at the City Gate and fill your pockets with gold before doing some serious spending. Secure a steed from the Stables, pick up Pets or Potions, or head to the Armoury and the Magic Emporium. Visit The City in Talisman as you compete for the Crown of Command!
131816.name: Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): The City Expansion
boardgameexpansion: Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): The Deep Realms Expansion

131817.name: Gilgamesh!
131817.description:
From the publishers website:

Back before the dawn of history, all the world knew the name of Gilgamesh. Gilgamesh, the King of Uruk, two thirds god and one-third man! Gilgamesh, the world’s greatest warrior, who slew Humbaba and killed the Bull of Heaven! But now Gilgamesh is faced with an opponent that no man has ever defeated—death itself. Join Gilgamesh and his band of mighty heroes as they journey past the edge of the Earth, through the Garden of the Gods, and across the Waters of Death in order to find the secret of eternal life.

GILGAMESH! is an epic adventure, based on the world’s oldest epic, designed for use with the QAGS Second Edition rules. It includes an overview of the world of Sumerian myth, sample characters, guidelines for character creation, monsters, gods, useful tables, a summary of The Epic of Gilgamesh, and more.

GILGAMESH! is written by Leighton (Hobomancer) Connor and illustrated by Joshua (Leopard Women of Venus) LH Burnett.

131818.name: Death by Chocolate
131818.description:
From publisher blurb:

Halloween is finally here and everybody has one thing on their mind: CANDY CANDY CANDY. This love of sweets is completely natural but there's something decidedly unnatural happening tonight. A normal night of trick-or-treating soon turns into something dark and gruesome when the gang discovers someone might be handing out some bad treats--confections that'll turn more than your stomach.

Be sure to check your candies, kiddos.

131819.name: Dead Leaves
131819.description:
From publisher blurb:

Kids can be so cruel. And while some scars fade with time, some wounds never heal. These cut so deep, their pain lingers even beyond death. On this quiet Fall day in the neighborhood of Hansom Creek, a past victim of local cruelty comes back to seek revenge on her tormentors. Those wicked children will pay for their crimes.

Something evil is on the wind.

131820.name: Old Man Winter
131820.description:
From publisher blurb:

Winter has come and with--wait, where's the snow? It's almost the end of December and not a flake has fallen. While initially dismissed as simply an unseasonable warm spell, a curious admission from the neighborhood goody-two-shoes reveals there may be some nefarious at work here.

Think you're up for saving an entire season?

131821.name: Camp Howling Wolf
131821.description:
From publisher blurb:

Summer is the best time ever. No more pencils, no more books, you know the deal. And this year, it's going to be extra-awesome because you're spending two weeks at Camp Howland Rolf where you'll be swimming, playing sports, running around like crazy, fending off the attacks of ravenous woodland creatures...

Wait—what was that last part again?

131822.name: Among the Missing
131822.description:
From publisher blurb:

It could happen to anyone.

You were a normal kid once with a normal life and a normal family. Then things changed. There was a moment when your life took a sudden turn and you stopped being a normal kid. You became a headline, a statistic, a picture on the grocery store window. A warning for other children.

Maybe you were taken, stolen by a monster, or maybe you simply disappeared.

Whatever happened, at that moment, you became one of the missing.

Book 2: Among the Missing is an expansion to the Little Fears Nightmare Edition game. In it, we talk about what missing children mean in the world of Little Fears, how kids become missing, what happens to them next, how they can help in the fight against monsters, and how they can be saved. Includes expanded GMC rules, new monsters, information about the world In-Between, and a full-length episode titled "The Long Way Home."

131823.name: Straight Dice
131823.description:
User Summary

Straight Dice is an addictive and tricky dice puzzle game where you score points by collecting "straights" of 3 or 4 dice. This, however, is easier said than done in an ever changing board of dice. On the bright side, you have the option of changing all dice of a given color, by clicking on any die of that color.

131824.name: SAS: Zombie Assault
131824.description:
User Summary

You are trapped in a cabin in the middle of nowhere! Hordes of zombies are closing in from everywhere! Twenty gruelling waves of undead must be repelled. All you have is your one and only friend: Your trusted gun. Having the capacity to upgrade is a truly remarkable quality of your gun. But... alas! This comes at a cost. You have to kill zombies! The more you kill the more upgrades will you be able to make. Got it? Go for it!

131825.name: Civil War: 1863
videogamehonor: 2012 Charles S. Roberts  Best Pre-20th Century Era Computer Wargame Nominee
131825.description:
Journey to 1863 and relive iconic battles in an epic single player campaign or against your friends in pass and play multiplayer. Take command of the Union and fight the battles of Dover, Thompson's Station, Dutton's Hill, Stephenson's Depot and Oak Ridge! The improved engine now supports more capable Veteran units and unreliable raw units as well as the ability to change formations. Hours of gameplay included and 2 additional downloadable campaigns are available where you can continue the Union campaign or try your skills as a Confederate general.

Features
8 Mission 'First Strike' Campaign.
8 Mission 'Hoorah' Campaign.
Includes battles based on historic events.
Features both Union and Confederate forces.
7 different unit types with unique gameplay.
Generals can attach to units to increase morale.
Game Center achievements and leaderboards.
Universal App (Works on iPhone & iPad)!
High Definition graphics.
5 Pass & Play two player scenarios.

Source: The Developer Website.

131826.name: Sip and Strip
131826.description:
"Sip and Strip is an exciting game designed for swinging adults of all ages" -- so says the instruction booklet that comes from the game.

This is a Frank Bresee game, similar to nearly everything else he made, it includes a Monopoly-like board, drinks, and this time stripping. The game includes a routine board, "sip" cards and "strip" cards (standing in for Community Chest and Chance). The game can be played by two to six players or even more if you want to play with couples as teams.

The roll of the dice moves your pieces around the board and you are required to do what the squares tell you to do. Mostly this involves taking sips of a beverage, sometimes taking a Sip or Strip card. Some of the Sip cards direct personal action like "take a sip and kiss any player" and other cards require all participants to take an action, usually involving another sip of a beverage.

Each complete round of the board includes more Sip cards and more Strip cards requiring you to remove a piece of clothing. The game proceeds until the sips catch up with you (which is the point of Bresee's more notorious game "Pass Out") or until everyone has removed all articles of clothing. The game suggests the last player to remove the last article of clothing is the winner, but local rules may suggest other winners may be declared.

The length of the game depends greatly on potency of beverages, how many articles of clothes players are wearing, and natural distractions that arise from game situations. Unless all participants are really committed, the games can easily break up from prudishness or embarrassment.

131828.name: Cibola
131828.description:
Cibola is a head-to-head race to find the Seven Cities of Gold. In Cibola, players seek to collect and place the five required keys to unlock each of the seven gold statues. Players can use various tools and cunning to hinder their opponent.

There are also Silver (wild) statues for players to unlock. However, these will cause players to decrease their hand limit by one card, making their journey all that much harder.

The game ends once one of the two players has unlocked all seven statues.

131829.name: Blarney: The Definitive Word Game
131829.description:
This game consists of decks of cards each with five words and their definitions on them. The Blarney Master - chosen by the roll of the die - selects a card, then chooses one of the words by speaking it. The 3-minute timer is begun and the players have that long to write down their definition of the word.

Scoring is determined the players voting for the "best definition" and points are awarded to the player with the most votes and the player with the best definition and the Blarney Master if no one votes for the correct definition. The one with the most points gets a green Blarney stone to indicate such. That ends a round; then the Blarney Master position passes to the next player.

On certain cards, one of the words has no meaning so is simply "Blarney" and the Master must make up a plausible definition.

The game ends after 10 rounds; the winner being the player with the most Blarney stones.

131830.name: DAM IT the River Conquest Game
131830.description:
DAM IT the River Conquest Game

Great strategy board game DAM IT takes place on a grand river system. With your crew of skilled beavers you will be charged with the task of damming rivers that legends say can’t be dammed. To make matters worse your enemies on the other team will be fighting for the same goal. A good balance of military strategy and well placed dams will be the key to your success. To master this game you will have to use strategy, team work, and just a little bit of luck. During game play you and your team will be faced with tough choices, but don’t be afraid to get wet just make sure you can swim. DAM IT Two Sides… As the game begins, six beaver tribes march onto the battlefield. The Red, Green, and Yellow tribes form the Honored Beaver Alliance, fighting for peace, justice, and wood. The tribes of Blue, Black, and Purple unite to form the Midnight Warriors, fighting to protect the homeland of their ancestors. One Battle… There is an uneasy calm as both teams face each other from across the river. Each tribe raises its flag as the architects discuss their building strategy. The kings stand nobly to ensure victory, and out of the silence comes the command of a warrior: “Charge!” One River. There can be only one victor, the team with the will to Dam It.

The game Dam It is a team game that can be played by 2 players, 4 players or 6 players. Games involving 4 or 6 players are always played in teams. There are 4 ways to win.
(1)_eliminate the kings of opposing players
(2)_capture the dens of opposing players
(3)_dam the end of the main channel river and control it for 6 consecutive allied turns; and
(4)_control 50 or more worker beavers.

Game time: approximately 1 hour

Note: It’s important to spend 10-15 minutes, or so reading the rules carefully. The more time you spend learning the rules, the more fluid and enjoyable the game will be.

The five types of beavers
1. Worker beavers
2. Flag beaver
3. Warrior beaver
4. Architect beaver
5. King beaver

In Dam It, each beaver serves a different purpose and has unique skills. All +1s and +2s are numbers added to die rolls during the combat phase. The combat abilities of these beavers are summarized on the reference sheet under “Combat Statistics”.

1. Worker beavers comprise the bulk of your team. These beavers are easily persuaded. These beavers can collect wood and may be led into battle. The red and blue chips are used to represent the worker beavers of each team.
2. A Flag beaver is an elite beaver that has been trained to repel attacks. To represent this, he is given a +2 while defending. This is the beaver holding a flag.
3. A Warrior beaver is an elite beaver that has been trained in the art of war. To represent this he is given a +2 while attacking. This is the beaver with a Mohawk or with a Viking helmet (for early editions the warrior is also represented by: muscles, snorkel, eye patch, and hair).
4. An Architect beaver is an elite beaver that has studied his/her whole life to become the leader in dam construction. This beaver must be present to construct dams. If the Architect beaver is eliminated, that player can not build dams. This is the beaver holding a book.
5. A King beaver is an elite beaver that is cautious and effective in his war tactics. To represent this he is given a +1 while attacking and a +1 while defending. If this beaver is eliminated from the game, then all other elite beavers from that player are also eliminated, and that player’s turn is skipped for the rest of the game. This beaver is the one with a crown on his head.

131831.name: Atari Jaguar CD
131831.description:
The Atari Jaguar CD is a CD-ROM peripheral for the Atari Jaguar video game console.

The unit hit shelves on September 11, 1995 and retailed for $149.95. The device sat atop the Jaguar console, snapping very firmly into the cartridge slot. The drive had its own cartridge slot to allow cartridge games to be played without removing the CD drive. In addition, a "Memory Track" cartridge (sold separately) was available to store saved games and high scores for Jaguar CD games.

The CD unit featured a double-speed (2x) drive and built-in VLM (Virtual Light Machine) software written by Jeff Minter. The VLM provided a sophisticated video light show when an audio CD was played in the machine. Bundled with the unit were two games (Blue Lightning and Vid Grid), a music CD (Tempest 2000 soundtrack), and a Myst demo disc.

When the Jaguar CD was installed in a console the startup screen was different. A random 'light show' that was different every time the console was switched on was created using the VLM. However, the startup was silent and did not feature the characteristic "roar" of the Atari Jaguar.
