Jaguar CD games could include as much as 790MB of data, considerably more than conventional CD-ROMs. The designers chose to ignore established CD-ROM formats and instead created their own based on the audio CD format. While allowing for dramatically more storage on the disc, and foiling casual piracy, the format only provided limited error correction.

The drive was manufactured for Atari by Philips in the United States. The initial shipment was 20,000 units.

Source: Wikipedia, "Atari Jaguar CD", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

131832.name: SuperTuxKart
131832.description:
SuperTuxKart is a Free 3d kart racing game; we want to make the game fun more than we want to make it realistic. You can play with up to 4 friends on one PC, racing against each other or just try to beat the computer (a network multiplayer feature is planned).
See the great lighthouse or drive through the sand and visit the pyramids. Race underground or in space, watching the stars passing by. Have some rest under the palms on the beach (watching the other karts overtaking you :) ). But don't eat the bananas! Watch for bowling balls, plungers, bubble gum and cakes thrown by opponents.
You can do a single race against other karts, compete in one of several Grand Prix, try to beat the high score in time trials on your own, play battle mode against your friends, and more!

Source: The Developer Website.

131833.name: Demon Destroyer Gunn
131833.description:
Excerpts from the Box Blurb Hype

Armament for the 21st century

Your prayers have been answered

"This is the ultimate ... accessory for the ultimate game." --Computer Life

"TAC Systems has a game controller for your favorite shoot-em-up multimedia title." --Multimedia World

"Even with a great gamepad, shooting slavering demonic beasts from hell by clicking a mouse or pressing a button is like frozen pizza and lite beer--to get to the true flavor, you need the real thing...Picture a .38 special with a thyroid imbalance..." --Computer Life

- More instinctive and realistic game play!

- Works with DOOM and most 3-D action games!

- Single-handed playability!

- Quick action trigger!

- Ergonomic grip!

- Hints and cheat codes for popular 3-D action games included!

System Requirements
IBM or compatible system
Standard joystick/ gamepad connector

User Summary

The Demon Destroyer Gunn consists of a tiny thumb operated joystick mounted at the back of a large plastic gun resembling some sort of chrome-plated gatling revolver. The Gunn featured an operating trigger and a secondary control button located on the "frame" of the revolver.

131834.name: Escape & Evasion
131834.description: An solitaire game placing the player in the role of a downed aircrew member behind enemy lines. Utilizes the paragraph-driven RANGER game system. A team of active duty military pilots helped during the development of this game. It can also be linked with RANGER with one player leading a patrol to locate and recover the other player.

boardgamehonor: 2014 Origins Awards Best Traditional Card Game Nominee
131835.description:
Inspired by a love of classic video games, Boss Monster: The Dungeon Building Card Game pits 2-4 players in a competition to build the ultimate side-scrolling dungeon. Players compete to lure and destroy hapless adventurers, racing to outbid one another to see who can build the most enticing, treasure-filled dungeon. The goal of Boss Monster is to be the first Boss to amass ten Souls, which are gained when a Hero is lured and defeated — but a player can lose if his Boss takes five Wounds from Heroes who survive his dungeon.

Playing Boss Monster requires you to juggle two competing priorities: the need to lure Heroes at a faster rate than your opponents, and the need to kill those Heroes before they reach your Boss. Players can build one room per turn, each with its own damage and treasure value. More attractive rooms tend to deal less damage, so a Boss who is too greedy can become inundated with deadly Heroes.

Players interact with each other by building rooms and playing Spells. Because different Heroes seek different treasure types, and rooms are built simultaneously (played face down, then revealed), this means that every "build phase" is a bidding war. Spells are instant-speed effects that can give players advantages or disrupt opponents.

As a standalone card game with 155 cards, Boss Monster contains everything that 2-4 players need to play.
131835.name: Boss Monster: The Dungeon Building Card Game
boardgameexpansion: Boss Monster:  Final Form! Promo Card
Boss Monster: Bom-Boy Factory Promo Card
Boss Monster: Killa, Man Eating Gorilla Promo
Boss Monster: König Croak Promo Card
boardgamepodcastepisode: 006: Teaching and Learning Games
Ameritrashed: Episode #10
BGA Ep. 56 - Boss Monster vs. Munchkin
CnC Plays - Boss Monster
Episode 11 - Boss Monster
Episode 24: Core Worlds/Bruxelles 1893
Episode Forty-Two:Bad Kerning, Great Dungeons
ET62: Dracula en las trincheras con el casco prusiano
Portal Anniversary Spectacular Episode Six: Killing Mario
Strange Assembly 101 - Dalmatians
Strange Assembly 192 - Live From GenCon 2016

131837.name: Double Dragon Neon
videogamehonor: 2012 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Download Only Game of the Year Nominee
2012 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Villain of the Year Nominee
131837.description:
Double Dragon Neon is a video game in the Double Dragon series of beat 'em up games and is intended as a reboot of the Double Dragon series; As with previous installments of the series, the player takes control of martial artists Billy Lee (Player 1) and Jimmy Lee (Player 2) in their fight to rescue Marian from the Shadow Warriors gang, this time led by the super-lich Skullmageddon. The journey starts on the city streets and progresses through an outer-space fighting dojo, an Oriental-themed countryside, a genetics lab, and a graveyard before concluding at Skullmageddon's palace.

In addition to the standard punch, kick, and jump buttons and a designated run button, the player now has a evade button for dodging attacks. If the player times their evasion right so as to perfectly dodge an enemy attack, they will "Gleam" by briefly glowing red, during which time their attacks will be more powerful. The player can collect life-replenishing sodas, money to buy items from shops, and special mixtapes that can be equipped from a pause menu. Two different tapes can be equipped at once: one to grant the brothers a powerful attack that consumes a separate energy meter, and one to alter their statistics and grant special effects (such as making it easier to stun enemies or healing HP with every connecting blow). By collecting multiple copies of a tape, its effect gradually increases until it reaches a maximum capacity. Each tape's maximum capacity can be increased further by visiting a "Tapesmith" and paying him Mythril, which is obtained from defeated bosses.

In a two-player game, both Billy and Jimmy can utilize a special "high-five" technique to split and share their life meters to an equal amount, or to instantly trigger a Gleam effect. If one player is defeated in battle, the other player has a limited time to revive him before a life is deducted (unless both players are defeated together). When one player is completely out of lives, he can steal one from the other player if he has at least two left.

Source: Wikipedia, "Double Dragon Neon", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

131838.description:
This expansion contains 6 new cards for use in Autokrator.

The 6 battle cards of the Neutral Generals.
These cards are used for the attacks (raids) of the Neutral Generals.

The 6 battle cards of the Neutral Areas. (already in the base game)
These cards are used for the defense of the Neutral Areas.
131838.name: Autokrator Mini Expansion

131839.name: Maze!
131839.description:
User Summary

The player uses the accelerometer to move a ball through randomly generated mazes.

131840.name: Don Quixote
131840.description:
The land noble Don Quixote arranges his own small principality in such a way in his fantasy as he considers it correct: Knights protect its castles and borders; roads connect windmills and churches. Not all will connect in a logical way but that doesn't matter to him. He has his own image of the reality.

Every player has an identical set of 24 tiles which they will place in their own, at the start empty, principality. The order of the locations to fill is also identical.

The player who can fill his principality the best with roads and protects its castles and borders with knights will get the most points and win the game.

Source: BGG.

131841.name: YOLO
131841.description:
From the publisher's website:
YOLO is the addicting card game where the lowest score wins! Players are dealt four cards face down. Throughout the round you'll be swapping cards in and out trying to memorize which card is which number. The YOLO cards are the highest and lowest cards in the deck and can push your total into the stratosphere or save you! If you think your set of four cards is lower than everyone else's, then it is time to GO FOR IT! Why not? YOU ONLY LIVE ONCE!

131842.name: Boombot
131842.description:
User Summary

In Boombox you create bombs by pressing the left mouse button. Use the various hindrances to your advantage and let the sheer force of the explosion propel your robot towards the exit to the next level. 50 levels filled with explosive fun!

131843.name: Boombot 2
131843.description:
User Summary

In this sequel to Boombox you once again create bombs by pressing the left mouse button and propel your robot towards the exit. 50 all-new, fun filled levels and various new hindrances such as fuses, giant boulders and wooden planks await to reward you with hours of explosive fun.

131844.description:
The Congregrations is a small expansion for Karnag (Sit Down!) by Pascal Cadot.

Every player is member of a druidic congregation. Each congregation awards Victory Points to its members when they fulfill certain conditions. Before the game begins, each player draws a Congregation card. The remaining Congregation cards are put back in the box.
131844.name: Karnag: The Congregations

131845.name: Meeblings
131845.description:
User Summary

In Meeblings, you have to rescue a specified number of good-for-nothing Feeblings towards the exit to the next level. To this end, you use the abilities of your special Meeblings:
Your Hereling draws other Meeblings towards itself.
Your Thereling pushes nearby Meeblings away.
Your Gravling reverses gravity.
Your Sizzling burns holes in the ground.
Your Treebling grows into a leafy tree.
Finally, your Zapling turns electrical stuff on and off.

50 hilarious levels of meeblicious fun!

131846.name: Meeblings 2
131846.description:
User Summary

In this sequel to Meeblings, you again have to rescue a specified number of good-for-nothing Feeblings towards the exit to the next level. In addition of all the previous special Meeblings you can now use the help of two new friends:
Your Homeling which turns itself into an exit and,
Your Chameebling which can become any other Meebling.

Enjoy 50 all-new hilarious levels of meeblicious fun!

131847.name: Ongoing Dead NY
131847.description:
New York, millions of zombies, and you. Fight alone or with friends, and smash a way through
hordes of zombies. Throw your dice as if your life depends on iit, and find support and supplies in the city that now never sleeps. Clear zombies out of critical locations. Use your best tactics, throw the dice and pray for a little bit of luck. Find weapons, tools and fellow survivors. Help each other out of perilous situations. Be ready to free New York from the virus.

Either win the game or be overrun and turned into a rotting zombie.
Three games in one package!
Play alone, with a partner or against each other; all the time fighting an endless stream of the living dead.

1 or 2 player, solitaire, co-operative or against eacht other.
A new kind of dice game with a strong theme.
Luck and tactic is needed here!

131848.name: Ricochet Pyramids
131848.description:
A Looney Pyramids game in the spirit of Ricochet Robots: an 8x8 board has 9 stationary towers and 3 mobile robots. Each turn, a randomly chosen robot must move onto a randomly chosen tower. Towers and the map edge and other robots block movement (but goal tower does not block movement).

Player simultaneously try to find the smallest sequence of moves to achieve the goal, and the lowest bidder who successfully moves the specified robot to the specified goal earns a point.

3 stashes of pyramids (in 3 different colors), an 8x8 board, and an optional 30-second timer are the only equipment needed.

The full rules can be found at the Icehouse wiki: Ricochet Pyramids rules

131849.name: Pussy Flip
131849.description:
Funny Pussy Cat Flipping Fun With Your Friends. Sandwich your opponent’s cats to flip them and dominate the board in this cute multiplayer game! The player with the most cats at the end of the game wins!

Fluffy features include:

✔ ADDICTIVE TURN-BASED GAMEPLAY:
- Take it in turns to send your move.

✔ MAKE NEW FRIENDS:
- With our random player mode.

✔ GLOBAL RANKINGS:
- Claw your way to the #1 spot.

✔ CAT CHAT:
- In-game with friends.

✔ LOVEABLE ANIMATED CATS:
- That love to be picked up, stroked and petted.

✔ PURRFECT SOUND EFFECTS:
- Hear your cats meow, purr and hiss.

✔ SCORES:
- Know how many times you have beaten your opponent.

✔ FUNKY JAZZ SOUNDTRACK:
- Relax to the funky soundtrack!

✔ FACEBOOK OR EMAIL LOGIN:
- Invite all your friends to play!

Source: The Developer Website.

131850.name: Kannst Du Rechnen?
131850.description:
A game for 3 to 6 year olds, helping them with their counting skills.

There are 24 monkey cards with a maths sum on them and 24 cards with different numbers of bananas on them. Three games are described but all really relate to recognising the correct banana tile to go with the correct sum (E.g. Monkey card says 3 + 2 so the tile with 5 bananas is the correct match.

The games include a Memory game (instead of matching like tiles you match the sum to the correct banana tile, played just like Memory.

131851.name: Najemnicy Kammeonu
131851.description:
This is fantasy board game for 2 – 4 players who wander through underground corridors and rooms, fight with monsters and collect some objects.
Mechanic is standard -I go you go
The aim of this game is to find three magic objects: golden crown, diamond dagger and magic ring.
The winner is the one who leaves the underground with at least two of three magic objects.
The game probably inspired by Talisman

131852.description:
A domino variant that uses dice as well as the domino cards. Of course, the cards can be used for a standard game of dominoes except that they feature an image on half the card and letters on the other half. You match a correct initial letter to an image (M next to Moon for example or vice versa). The game is housed in an attractive tin box.

Other games are included that bring in to play the special dice. One dice is what wargamers would call a Fire Die. It has 1 x two on it, 2 x two on it and 3 times two.The other die has letters on each face, four letters or five letters. And sometimes they use the wooden Wizard figure that is included with the game.

In game 1,2,3 - Magic! each player gets a hand of five cards and 12 cards are laid out in a circle, like a clock. However, a clock with 24 divisions because the cards are laid end-on thus forming a chequered track, picture, letter, picture, and so on. The Wizard is placed on one of them. The number die is used in this game. In your turn, you roll the die and advance the Wizard that number of spaces. When he has moved and lands on a picture space, the player looks at the picture and sees if he can think of a word that describes the picture. If he can then he must check his hand and see if the word he wants to use begins with one of the letters in his hand. If he does have such a card he can return that card to the box. If the Wizard lands on a letter space the reverse applies. The player looks to see if he has a picture card that begins with the letter. The first to use up all their cards, wins.

In Enchanting Fairy, the letter die is used. Each gets a hand of cards. The Wizard is placed in the centre of the table comfortably in reach of all the players. The die is roilled and all the players look to see if they have a picture beginning with one of the letters face-up on the die. If they do think they have the right answer, they can grab for the Wizard. Whoever gets it first (several players might grab for it at the same time), announces his answer and, if correct, returns his card to the box. If he is wrong he must draw another card from the shuffled deck.The first to use all their cards, wins.

Interesting additional fact. HABA add the usual disclaimer that the game is not suitable for under threes as some components could be swallowed. Nothing unusual in that except they write it in 40 languages!!
131852.name: Zauberdomino

131853.name: Shadows of Esteren - Book 0: Prologue
rpghonor: 2013 Golden Geek Best RPG Artwork/Presentation Nominee
131853.description:
From the Foreword:

Picture a peninsula with steep hills, thick forests that barely let the sunlight through, misty valleys, and fortresses clinging to the mountainside... and beyond the oceans, the vast and mysterious Continent. In such awe-inspiring landscapes, the Shadows of Esteren role-playing game will introduce you to a gritty, realistic world, where supernatural elements are never trivial or meaningless, and where men have to face fierce threats lurking in the dark.

We are pleased to present to you Book 0 Prologue, which will help you discover the universe of Shadows of Esteren while preparing you for the first episode of the official campaign.

The first chapter, "Origins", is an introduction to the main concepts of the game as well as a general presentation of the universe. It also includes a summary of the game system, comprising all the necessary elements to play through your first scenarios. And finally, you will find six illustrated characters ready to play: Yldiane the Varigal, Arven the fighter, Ean the fugitive, Liam the Scholar, Mòr the Ionnthén, and Urvan the Blade knight. This first chapter is perfect for familiarizing yourself with Shadows of Esteren and for introducing other players to this universe.

The second chapter, "Omens", is a triptych of scenarios written by Nelyhann: "Loch Varn", a scenario exploring the confines of dream and madness; "Poison", an investigation scenario set in Melwan's Vale; and finally "Red Fall", a story of disappearance and occultism in Dearg's Vale. These three scenarios constitute the prologue to the official campaign, whose first episode will be set in Dearg's Vale.

131854.name: Three Kings (CoC)
rpghonor: 2013 ENnie for Best Adventure - Silver Winner
131854.description:
From the introduction:
Three Kings is the first scenario in the Zero Point campaign, an epic and episodic series of adventures for the Achtung! Cthulhu setting. Achtung! Cthulhu is a setting for Lovecraftian roleplaying in World War Two, allowing you to play investigators uncovering the terrible secrets of the Lovecraftian Mythos which threaten the world when humankind is already poised to tear itself apart.

This version of Three Kings is intended for use with the Call of Cthulhu roleplaying game, published by Chaosium, Inc. Everything else you need can be found there. Pre-generated characters, created using the 6th edition Call of Cthulhu rules, are provided in Appendix One on page 29, below; you can also create your own investigator characters using the Call of Cthulhu rules.

131855.name: Three Kings (Savage Worlds)
rpghonor: 2013 UK Games Expo Best Role-playing Game Nominee
131855.description:
From the introduction:

Three Kings is the first scenario in the Zero Point campaign, an epic and episodic series of adventures for the Achtung! Cthulhu setting. Achtung! Cthulhu is a setting for Lovecraftian roleplaying in World War Two, allowing you to play investigators uncovering the terrible secrets of the Lovecraftian Mythos which threaten the world when humankind is already poised to tear itself apart.

This version of Three Kings is intended for use with the Savage Worlds roleplaying game, published by Pinnacle Enetrtainment Group, and the Realms of Cthulhu setting published by Reality Blurs. Everything else you need can be found there. Pre-generated characters, created using Realms of Cthulhu , are provided in Appendix One on page 29, below; you can also create your own inves tigator characters using the Realms of Cthulhu rules. Appendix Two contains our own unique setting rules.

131856.name: Boom
131856.description:
Congratulations! You've just found a suitcase full of money on your doorstep! Wait – why would someone leave you a bunch of money? Hmm, what's this note inside the case? "Welcome to the bomb game. The rules are simple. Use the materials inside this case to kill the other nine people in the enclosed photo. Only then do you get to keep this money." You dig deeper into the case and find a bunch of electronics and a photo that depicts ten people – including you. You don't know the other people in the photo, but you know they're now gunning for you...

In Boom, you need to wipe out the other players, while keeping your distance from them so that they don't find out where you are and retaliate!

131857.name: OGL Monster Compendium: Grecian
131857.description:
From the publisher's website:

Welcome to the first of what will be many such volumes from the library of Xandegar’s Adventure Realm. This one as by no doubt you have guessed is based around the ancient Greeks. Here-in you will find a collection of OGL creatures/monsters that are based on REAL Greek mythology. From the classic Minotaur and Hydra to the lesser known White Eagle of Zeus. From the simple Striges to the down-right terrifying Charon, the Boatman of the River Styx!!

131858.name: OGL Monster Compendium: Egyptian
131858.description:
From the publisher's website:

Welcome to the second of what will be many such volumes from the library of Xandegar’s Adventure Realm. This one as by no doubt you have guessed is based around the ancient Egypt. Here-in you will find a collection of OGL creatures/monsters that are based on REAL Egyptian mythology. From the classic mummy, and sphinx to the lesser known Apep . From the simple phoenix to the down-right terrifying Sekhmet!!

131859.name: Temple of Lost Souls
131859.description:
From the publisher's website:

This adventure is designed to take low level characters through an evil-controlled province where they are needed to gain the trust of the locals. Making sure to not to be discovered by the vampires until they have reached a high enough level to deal with them without being killed. They also have to discover the hidden temple and solve its mysteries and learn the truth about the various people they meet along the way, until finally they confront the evil that lies at the end of the module.

131860.name: The Resurrection of Childra-fen
131860.description:
From the publisher's website:

This adventure continues on in the series, and is designed to take same low-level characters through an evil-controlled province where they are needed to gain the trust of the locals. Making sure to not to be discovered by the vampires until they have reached a high enough level to deal with them without being killed. After discovering the truth about the various people they previously met, they finally confront the evil that lies at the end of the module in the mountain keep, a Lich!

131861.description:
The ant queen has decided to move! So now the two top ant engineers have come to the new land, and while the nest engineering commenced smoothly, the two engineers are secretly competing to prove themselves more competent than the other ant country's first engineer!

In Ant Nest, you'll play one of the two engineers charged with designing a new nest to house the country.
131861.name: Ant Nest

131862.name: The Human and the Five Dwarves
131862.description:
From the publisher's website:

This adventure is a murder-mystery story revolving around the abduction of children and the murder of a visiting human cleric to a Dwarven stronghold and a group of dwarves (the players) who are appointed to “solve” this mystery by their clan leader in order to avoid any future complications in the negotiations for a trade agreement with the humans.

131863.name: Hotline Miami
videogamehonor: 2012 Operation Rainfall Awards Best PC Game of the Year Nominee
2013 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Audio of the Year Nominee
2013 Global Game Awards Best Indie Game of the Year Nominee
2013 Golden Geek Best Indie Video Game Nominee
2013 IGF Awards Excellence In Audio Nominee
2013 IGF Awards Excellence in Design Nominee
2013 IGF Awards Seumas McNally Grand Prize Nominee
131863.description:
Hotline Miami is a 2D top-down action video game by Dennaton Games, a team composed of Jonatan Söderström and Dennis Wedin, who had previously collaborated on Keyboard Drumset Fucking Werewolf. In the game, you take the role of a mentally unstable hitman in 80's Miami. Urged by cryptic messages on his answering machine, he goes out to kill mafioso while donning an animal mask.

Each level of the game puts the player against a large number of armed foes dispersed throughout a building, which the player then must use stealth, wits, and lightning-quick reaction to clear out. The enemies all die in one or two hits, but so does the player character. However, the player can instantly restart the level to try again. The more inventively, quickly, or brutally you can finish a level, the more you are rewarded with unlocked weapons. Throughout the game, you can retrieve more animal rubber masks, which each give you a special ability.

Hotline Miami received both Eurogamer and Rock, Paper, Shotgun's Game of the Show award at their inaugural Rezzed expo.

Source: Wikipedia, "Hotline Miami", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

131864.name: No Rest For The Wicked (2012)
131864.description:
From the Official Website:

We are a full-contact LARP inspired by the Warhammer 40,000 setting with a focus on exploration, swashbuckling and intrigue. Our game is focused around the ever changing world of the Rogue Trader Dynasties who are caught up in a quest for wealth and power on the edges of Imperial society.

Our players take on the roles of major figures in the dynamic world of the Ruhrort Sector, a partially explored area of Imperial space on the Eastern Fringes of the Galaxy. Characters can be anyone from an exceptional Imperial guardsman to a member of the sector nobility.

We run major events on a regular basis throughout the year as well as ad-hoc events throughout the year for smaller groups. For our next event, please see our calendar.


From the Official Website:

No Rest For The Wicked is a game of swashbuckling rogues and pioneers seeking adventure, fame and fortune at the edge of Imperial space.

The game and setting is based on the Rogue Trader game published by Fantasy Flight Games and the universe of Warhammer 40,000 (Games Workshop).

Being a game about rogue traders on the edge of known space, it's a game of exploration, trade, combat, politics, intrigue and ultimately: fame and fortune. Take up with a crew and explore unknown space. Watch out for dragons and exploit the untold bounties that undoubtedly await you - if you get there first.

Fight and/or bargain with the force of Chaos, mighty Ork hordes, ravenous Tyranid swarms, deadly Eldar raiders and more while you try and get as much as you can for yourself and your dynasty.

131865.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The young merchant Anna Never is a complete mystery. As she travels around Gaia she seems to unconsciously position herself to be involved with major issues and problems facing the world. Additionally she has exhibited martial abilities unheard of for a girl of her age an apparent lack of training to possess. With no known connection to any established power block, one can't help but wonder that maybe there is more to her than she is letting on ...

Light Wanderer Warrior — Lv. 45
Innate Abilities: Critical Mastery.
Destiny's Chosen: After seeing the roll for an attack that targets Anna, you may spend one Gnosis Point to have your opponent to reroll the attack.
The One: You cannot spend Gnosis to improve any roll made by Anna. However, Anna rolls an additional dice an keeps the highest when making any roll.
Stubborn: Anna cannot be included in a party that has more Dark units than Light units in it.
Void God (Ki, Attack) +3 Attack.
Libera Me (Ki, Dodge) +3 Defense.
Infinity Requiem (Ki, Attack) +1 Attack / +2 Damage. You may spend any amount of Gnosis that you wish when making the attack. Anna makes an additional Infinity Requiem attack with the same target as the first one for each Gnosis point spent when making this attack (up to 2 Gnosis points).
131865.name: Anima Tactics: Anna Never
boardgameexpansion: Anima Tactics Rulebook Saga I & II: Awakening & Rise

131866.name: The Gazebo (Issue 1 - Apr 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Five Tips for Writing a Mystery Game
So, What's Been Going on in Magic...?
rpg: Lacuna Part I. The Creation of the Mystery and the Girl from Blue City
131866.description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

131867.description:
Aeroplanes: PWS-24 is a plane card expansion for Aeroplanes: Aviation Ascendant boardgame.

The PWS-24 was a Polish single-engine passenger aircraft for 4 passengers, built in PWS (Podlaska Wytwórnia Samolotów) factory, used from 1933 to 1936 by LOT Polish Airlines. It was the only series-built airliner of domestic design ever used by LOT.

Aeroplanes: PWS-24 is a free expansion, created by Phalanx Games Polska to celebrate the release of the Polish edition of the Aeroplanes: Aviation Ascendant boardgame.
131867.name: Aeroplanes: PWS-24

131868.name: I Ate Zombies
131868.description:
Who's the hungriest Zombie among your friends? Find out with this outrageous, fast-paced party game. This game is based on the popular "I Have" card game. The winner is the first player to run out of cards. Players race each other to drop Zombie, Werewolf, Ghost, Spider, and other horror creature cards into the Darkness Pit.

Players are dealt cards with "I Ate" side up and these cards will be laid out in front of themselves, same side up. The first player reads his/her "I Ate" card. Example: "I Ate a Werewolf". After reading the "I Ate" statement, he/she flips that card over and reads the "Who Ate" side of the card. Example: "I ate a Werewolf. Who ate a Zombie?" All players then race to respond to the "Who Ate" question if they have that specific card. To respond to a "Who Ate" guestion, a player says, "I Ate a...Who Ate a...?" and places his/her card "Who Ate" side up in the darkness pit (card pile). Play continues as stated above until a player gets rid of all of his/her cards to the darkness pit.

131869.name: Don Quijote de la Mancha
131869.description: Based on the world famous novel Don Quixote de la Mancha written by Miguel de Cervantes, in this game players take the roles of Don Quixote and his fellow knights Amadís de Gaula and Tirant lo Blanc or a group of monsters opposed to them. Don Quixote will travel around the board, which represents the spanish central region of La Mancha, trying to reach victory by following and completing a route through a series of tiles that represent the different adventures that the real character has to face in the book. In the meanwhile, the other knights should protect Don Quixote from the attacks of the monsters, who will try to hurt, imprison and finally kill him to win the game.

131870.name: Viaje al Centro de la Tierra
131870.description: The game is based on the novel "Journey to the Center of the Earth" written by Joules Verne. Players take the roles of up to four adventurers who will race through the 3D board trying to be the first ones to achieve the center of the Earth and therefore win the game. To do this, they will face a hard ascension of the ancient Sneffels volcano, a descent into its dark and misterious insides and finally a nightmarish counter-clock run against the lava flowing in the center of the Earth. During the journey they might face dangerous secondary adventures but also find precious treasures. But beware! Only those adventurers to equip themselves with the right object for each stage of the journey will be able to successfully race against the others.

131871.name: Horsez
131871.description:
Horsez is a videogame released by Ubisoft on October 26, 2006 for the Nintendo DS, PlayStation 2, PC and Game Boy Advance. This PC game is the sequel to Champion Dreams: First to Ride and is also part of the second series of Petz. In Horsez, you play as Flora (this is the default name), a new member of the Sycamore Academy. Players can select a horse from one of 5 breeds and a range of colours. The player trains their horse in different disciplines, enters shows, cares for their horse, and after a few weeks gains a foal to raise.

Horsez is also known as Pippa Funnell 3: The Golden Stirrup Challenge.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Horsez,"; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

131872.name: Rappan Athuk 2: The Wilderness Areas...Continued
131872.description:
From Introduction:

Rappan Athuk is a dungeon of legend. As with any major entrance to the underworld, the wilderness around Rappan Athuk is a dangerous place—popular with bandits, marauding monster bands and worse. Rappan Athuk 2: The Wilderness Areas is a supplement to Module R2: Rappan Athuk - The Dungeon of Graves: The Middle Levels. It continues to detail the wilderness around the most famous dungeon in all the lands and allows you to set the dungeon in the location it was intended. Included in this supplement are a wilderness map and wandering monster tables for all terrain types as well as detailed bandit groups and monster lairs.

131873.name: The Incident at Fort Southridge
rpg: Westward: A Steampunk Western Roleplaying Game
131873.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




From the Introduction:

A group of travelers, organized and sent by members of Capital City’s elite, are checking in on the locals of Southridge. A recent Bandit attack has left the town shaken and splintered into two factions, as they are baffled to why a popular Steam Mech Technician was kidnapped. What are the Bandits planning? And why did they single her out?

Now it's up to these travelers, or this band of “outsiders” as the locals of Southridge call them, to piece together the events that lead up to this abduction. The Mayor, Terexx A. Smyth, seems to know a lot more than he’s saying, or is it the subtle Chief of Security, an ex-Jagger by the name of Richter, who’s really running the show?

Grab a revolver, and it's time to earn some respect the hard way.

“Welcome to Fort South Ridge…The southern-most territory in all of, well, civilized Westward. Hell, we are the only thing that’d be dividin’ the badlands from those so-called civilized people. You’re new here, ain’t yah? Well, one thing's for damn sure, you’ll learn this real quickly that we watch each other’s back here and ain’t busy stabbin’ them. Enjoy your stay. Richter will take it over from here.”
- Mayor Terexx A. Smyth

131874.description:
From the Introduction:

Players can link all four of the Peiper Pocket Battle Games to form The Peiper Dream and play a "Grand" (using the term very loosely here!) Campaign that simulates the entire series of battles with KG Peiper during the Ardennes Offensive. The Campaign Game will also require the use of one six-sided die (not included) to adjudicate certain game outcomes. There can be up to 20 turns (run through the card deck up to 20 times) in the Campaign Game.

Contents:


Campaign Game and Optional Rules
Game Turn Record Track
Sheet of 40 die-cut counters
Paying the Peiper
A Dash of Peiper
The Bagged Peiper
Just a Peiper Dream?
131874.name: The Peiper Dream

131875.name: Bloons
131875.description:
User Summary

Your main objective in Bloons is to proceed to the next level. You may accomplish this by popping a predetermined number of balloons per level. So shoot you darts, discover the secrets of special balloons and enjoy 50 levels of balloon popping fun.

131876.name: Silent Storm Gold Edition
131876.description:
User Summary

This Gold Edition includes S2: Silent Storm as well as the add-on S3: Silent Storm - Sentinels.

131877.name: The Crucible of Freya: Supplemental Adventure Ideas and Encounter Areas
131877.description:
From Introduction:

Your players have defeated the orcs in the Ruined Keep and returned to Fairhill as heroes. Now they want more! This free supplement provides further adventures set in and around Fairhill. It is an extension of the Necromancer Games module W1: The Crucible of Freya and requires that module for use.

131878.name: Bloons 2
131878.description:
User Summary

In this sequel to Bloons, you once again use your darts to pop a predetermined number of balloons, your goal always being to proceed to the next level. There are several new types of balloons and 100 all-new levels to pop your way through. Also, you now have the option to skip through an extra difficult level using your super monkey ability.

131879.name: What Evil Lurks: Domain of Hawkmoon Expansion
131879.description:
From Introduction:

Welcome to a Web enhancement for the Domain of Hawkmoon, a campaign setting introduced in Necromancer Games module
G2: What Evil Lurks and to be explored again in 2003 with the release of G9: A Lamentation of Thieves and H1: The Bonegarden.
But even if you’ve never played in the Domain, you may still readily use this material, as it’s been designed to be inserted
seamlessly into any fantasy campaign.

131880.name: Rappan Athuk: The Upper Levels - Bonus R2-47 Special Encounter
131880.description:
From Introduction:

In the fine tradition of encounter R2-47 from the classic TSR Dungeon Module D3: Vault of the Drow, this supplemental encounter features a pair of demonic lovers and their lair that can be placed in Rappan Athuk or any other dungeon.

131881.name: Shadows over Vathak
131881.description:
Subtitle: A Campaign Setting Book of Lovecraftian Survival Horror

Publisher Blurb:
SHADOWS OVER VATHAK - RISE OF THE OLD ONES
Vathak is a land of harsh terrain and frigid weather. Plague and disease have swept the land, turning cities to cemeteries. The vampire lords are fighting for power and survival. The vindari killed most of your family as their genocidal plans spread across nations. Bhriota cultist kidnapped, tortured, and ate the first girl you ever loved.

This is Vathak, before the Old Ones awakened . . .

Shadows over Vathak is a dark fantasy, survival horror campaign setting for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Combining elements of gothic horror and Lovecraftian mythos, Shadows Over Vathak introduces a world of hardship and strife on the verge of a great war with eldritch horrors. Introducing new playable races, character classes, weapons, a detail overview of the lands of Vathak and it’s history, and of course twisted aberrations to haunt any player’s nightmares.

Can you survive the Shadow Over Vathak.

131884.name: Demon Busters
131884.description:
In the game Demon Busters, the players take the role of one of five soulkeepers. Through their magical powers they mend the holes in the fabric that separate the world of men from the realms of evil beings.

The five soulkeepers agree, over the time of one year, who ever got the most accomplishments in battle, will become the head of the five soulkeepers. Each month, a demon of a thousand years, equipped with supernatural powers, leads the armies of darkness through the holes between the worlds. Now, the soulkeepers have to compete with each other. Through the use of superior magical powers they entrap and capture the demons. Once a demon is captured, the soulkeeper who entrapped him can make use of his special powers to capture even more demons.

At the end of the game, who fixed the most holes in the fabrics of the world had the highest contribution to saving our world and is the winner of the contest!

131885.name: Politics and Corruption
131885.description:
As lobby and campaign spending soars to record highs, Congressional approval ratings plummet to all-time lows. Explore the influence of money on Congress while playing this educational card game.

There are two kinds of cards in the Politics and Corruption deck: bill cards representing legislation of the 112th Congress, and capital cards that are used to solicit votes and champion bills. Players take turns playing capital cards on bills until the draw pile is exhausted. Bills pass with a simple majority, meaning more than half of the votes on a bill are in support. Bills may either occupy the center of the table or be placed in front of a player who has chosen to champion them. Championed bills earns their champion more points when passed, but costs that player a point when blocked. Players also earn points by passing bills that are favored by their party, and by ending the game with lots of cards left in their hand. The player with the most points at the end of a game is the winner.

131886.description:
The Wharfside Casino License Cards are a fun and strategic promo/expansion for Fleet!

This set of three (3) Wharfside Casino Premium License Cards can be used with Fleet as a substitute for the Fishermen's Pub.

Once the Casino has been purchased, players may take one Crate from any Boat and place it on the Wharfside Casino. They then roll a die (the Fleet die if you have it!) and take the appropriate action:

1-3) Bust! Discard the gambled Crate of Fish from the game.

4) Win! +1 Crate of Fish. Keep the gambled Crate of Fish, and place one additional Crate of Fish from the Fish Crate supply onto the Casino license card.

5) Win! +2 Crate of Fish. Keep the gambled Crate of Fish, and place two additional Crates of Fish from the Fish Crate supply onto the Casino license card.

6/Fleet) Winner Winner Seafood Dinner! +3 Crate of Fish. Keep the gambled Crate of Fish, and place three additional Crates of Fish from the Fish Crate supply onto the Casino license card.

The Wharfside Casino is fun way to add a new twist to Fleet!
131886.name: Fleet: Wharfside Casino

131887.name: Workaholic Liver War
131887.description:
The players have all arrived at the company as new employees, full of ambition and eager to work hard in order to dominate the company and rise up from a nobody to a somebody thanks to the admiration of others.

But to rise like a phoenix and transform into a dragon at the company, as everyone wants to do in Workaholic Liver War, you'll need to gain the cooperation of your colleagues while taking good advantage of your personal skills and random events inside the company walls. Experience in-fighting, develop a fantastic career, suffer from a burst liver due to all the stress and pressure, and ideally in the end get everyone else to bow to you respectfully...

131888.name: 無良商人 (Darkminded Merchants)
131888.description:
Whoever in Darkminded Merchants is most conscienceless, most unscrupulous will make the most money and win the game? Using "fresh" tofu as substitutes in your dishes? Putting unsavory sauces in the shrimp? Adding plasticizers to the drinks? If you can be this darkminded, you might just win the game.

In this war between businessmen, you must see through the black-hearted tactics of others while also being able to reap the maximum benefits possible from a time of crisis to dominate the industry and prove that your heart is the blackest of all.

131889.name: Godzilla Boom
131889.description: Nothing more for now that the Godzilla Boom name and the detail that the design is a party/card game.

131890.name: Animals
131890.description:
Animals contains 70 cards for three different level games.

• In Pets of King, each of Kings in the forest has his/her beloved pets. When these animals appear in the forest, take the chance and stay them. But, other Kings may also have same interest or unfavorable animals may also be captured. This game tests response and actions to catch different Animals cards.

• In Forest Olympic, animals in the forest join the Olympic game. Help them to win and the most effective team will seek love from animals. Players have to form Animals team to compete each round and be the first one to play all cards from his/her hand.

• In Rescue the Animals, there is a big fire in the forest! Help rescue animals to life boats. The more the Animals a player save, the more is the point the chance to win he/she gets. However, players have to be think carefully how to arrange Animals in their only life boat.

131891.description:
Lost Legends is a fantasy card game by Mike Elliott that combines a streamlined Euro game design and card drafting with an interesting fantasy theme and battle mechanic. Players take on the role of heroes trying to assemble an arsenal of equipment in order to vanquish a series of monsters that they will encounter.

The game begins with all players choosing one of five heroes each with their own strengths and weaknesses. Each player fights their own monster; this is not a cooperative game. The monster each hero will likely face is revealed to them before players draft cards for their equipment. An interesting aspect in this game is you may, if the conditions are right, evade a monster in front of you, and pass it to the hero next to you. But be aware if you do this you have to fight the monster you draw next!

Players then select an equipment card drafted from a hand of cards, and pass the remainder of the hand to your left to prepare for battle with the monster in front of them. The equipment draft continues in this manner until only one card is left in each hand, which is discarded. Players then compare their drafted equipment to their monster to determine the result of the battle! The game consists of 3 levels filled with monsters to slay and new equipment to pick up.

Players need Legend Points to win the game! These come in the form of trophies awarded for most monsters as well as sets of monsters slain. Can you defeat the monsters thrown in your path to glory and become the most Legendary?
131891.name: Lost Legends
boardgameexpansion: Lost Legends: Forest of the Damned (Queenie 2)
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 12: Lost Legends/Board Game Gifting
TDT - Episode # 318 - Live from Gen Con 2013

131892.name: Desire
131892.description: Desire is a quick-playing card game that features women in outfits that are two sizes too small. I'm not sure how that relates to the game play, but that's the only detail I can speak of for now other than the title, so there it is.

131893.name: Thomas Was Alone
videogamehonor: 2013 British Academy Game Awards Best Soundtrack of the Year Nominee
2013 British Academy Game Awards Best Story/Narrative of the Year Nominee
2013 IGF Awards Excellence In Audio Nominee
2013 IGF Awards Excellence In Visual Art Nominee
131893.description:
a minimalist game about friendship and jumping
and floating and bouncing and anti-gravity

Source: The Developer Website.

131894.name: Vietnam Battles: Snoopy's Nose & Iron Triangle
131894.description:
From the editor's website:

For some time, there had been reports that a large area of dense jungle northwest of Saigon was a staging base for the Viet Cong. Ideally situated near Cambodia, a nexus point of the Ho Chi Minh Trail, and proximal to the capital city of Saigon itself, the area that became known as the “Iron Triangle” allowed the Viet Cong to conduct well-organized and well-supplied operations into the very heart of South Vietnam. In the meantime, a hundred miles to the south, a US riverine force, comprised primarily of the newly-arrived 9th Infantry Division, began to penetrate into the hinterland of the Mekong Delta, and even into the overgrown rivulets where only ‘Charlie’ had ever operated before. In the first in the Vietnam Battles series, two games are included, Iron Triangle and Snoopy’s Nose (named after a distinctive curve in one of the distributaries leading to the Mekong River). Both games utilize the very popular Fire & Movement combat system, and is easy to play.
Units in the game are typically companies and some battalions and occasional brigade equivalents. The full spectrum of the war in Vietnam in 1967 is featured with everything from riverine craft to helicopters. Each hex represents about a half mile, and each game turn represents from about a half a day to several days of operations.
The game includes one map (22x34”) and 200 counters.

131895.name: Holy Land: The Next Arab-Israeli War
131895.description:
From the editor's website:

The premise of Holy Land is that there is a revitalization of the militant Arab world. They then challenge the Israelis, using not only conventional military forces, but also the full spectrum of conflict, including insurgency and terrorism. The game includes several possible scenario options for different types of conflict. Holy Land game shows some of the major factors involved. The Holy Land game system is based upon Decision: Iraq; there are two players in Holy Land, various Arab powers and foreign fighters, the latter possibly including Al Qaeda and Iranian support, among others, and the Israelis, with possible coalition support.
Both players have a set of pieces that represent both conventional and unconventional forces. Players move their pieces across the spaces on the map and engage in various kinds of conflict in order to destroy enemy forces, seize critical objectives, and change the Netwar Index, which is an index used to indicate how successful each side has been in meeting their goals. Furthermore, one unique feature of the Holy Land is that as units engage in combat, their effectiveness may increase or decrease as they gain experience in fighting, or become demoralized.
The game map shows Israel and adjoining countries, divided into large rectangular boxes known as regions, representing the general geography of the area. Players deploy their units into region boxes, into the “Open” area. Each region box
The game includes two maps (22x34”) and 352 counters.

131896.name: Woof and me
131896.description:
Children have pets, but do they know the responsibilities of caring for them? WOOF AND ME is an extremely unique, fun board game designed to educate young children about pet care and responsibility. Children will identify problems and solutions that relate to dogs, along with using simple counting and money exchange skills which makes WOOF AND ME an exceptionally fun, interactive learning tool!

Be the player with the most bones at the finish to win the game and choose another dog from the Animal Shelter! What a fantastic way to help pets live a safe and healthy life! Ages 6+. 2-5 players.

Fun while learning responsible pet care
Simple counting, money exchange skills and learning new vocabulary words
Identify over 100 different dog breeds
Easy to learn and socially involves players
Identify problems that dogs face - and how to solve those problems

This colorful visual educational game has received numerous positive testimonials from after school programs in the Phoenix Arizona metropolitan area.

131898.name: Sands 500
131898.description:
Sands 500 is a motor racing game for 2-6 players. The object of the game is to be the first player to have their racing car cross the finish line after an agreed upon number of laps of the circuit.

To begin the game the first player to spin a four on the Spinner goes first and has their choice of which coloured lane to place their racing car. Then the player to the left has their choice of lane and so on until all players have had a lane allocated.

The player who goes first spins the Spinner and whoever has a racing car on the same lane as the colour indicated by the dial moves the number of spaces shown in that segment. The leader can then change lanes to whatever colour they think will come up next. After the leader has chosen a lane the next player in position order can do likewise (it is permissible to have two or more racing cars in the same lane).

The game progresses with each player following the direction of course until the leader crosses the finish line either by a 'flying finish' (crossing the line on any number) or finishes on exactly the right number as decided before the start of the game.

Contents:

1x Board
1x Spinner with rules
4x Racing cars (one each of red, blue, green and yellow)

131899.name: Zombie Ace
131899.description:
Come fly the deadly skies in Zombie Ace! These undead pilots guarantee fast service to 14 destinations across the United States of America. When you need to infect the next city fast, trust a Zombie Ace to get you there!

Source: The Developer Website.

131900.name: Big Win Soccer
131900.description:
"Welcome to world class football fun with Big Win Soccer! No matter what you call the “beautiful game”, Big Win Soccer is the game for everyone.

CREATE your own unique dream team, COMPETE against opponents from around the world, WATCH your team battle it out on the pitch, BOOST your player’s passing, shooting, dribbling and other skills and get ready to hoist the Daily Trophy for the ultimate BIG WIN!"

Source: The Developer Website.

131901.name: Big Win Football
131901.description:
"Get ready to go for the end zone with Big Win Football! From the opening kickoff to the game winning touchdown, Big Win Football is gridiron game for everyone!

CREATE your own unique dream team, COMPETE against opponents from around the world, WATCH your team battle it out on the field, BOOST your player’sthrowing, tackling, running and other skills and get ready to hoist the Daily Bowl for the ultimate BIG WIN!"

Source: The Developer Website.

131902.name: Big Win Baseball
131902.description:
"Step up to the plate and swing for the fences! It is always a guaranteed home run with Big Win Baseball, the game for everyone.

CREATE your own unique dream team, COMPETE against opponents from around the world, WATCH your team battle it out on the diamond, BOOST your player’s pitching, hitting, fielding and other skills and get ready to win the Daily Pennant for the ultimate BIG WIN!"

Source: The Developer Website.

131903.name: Big Win Hockey
131903.description:
"Time to hit the ice with Big Win Hockey! From the opening face off to final buzzer Big Win Hockey is the game for everyone.

CREATE your own unique dream team, COMPETE against opponents from around the world, WATCH your team battle it out on the ice, BOOST your player’s passing, shooting, skating and other skills and get ready to hoist the Daily Trophy for the ultimate BIG WIN!"

Source: The Developer Website.

131904.description:
They were tough times, the days when swords and magic still ruled the world. A long, destructive war had ended, and the entire continent had been unified. Before the empire's subjects had even come to know peace, however, their great emperor fell victim to disease, having never declared a successor...

We must not return to that war-torn world! Thankfully you are an influential figure in the empire. Quickly lay claim to the throne and ensure the rock-solid unity and peace of the continent. Though the emperor had no son, there are seven candidates for succession, starting with the two lineal princesses. Now, let's get your favorite princess on the emperor's throne! Garner support from all over the country, clash with rival candidates and depend on your special skill!

Heart of Crown is a deck-building card game. Each player starts with the same deck, strengthens that deck with strategic cards, and finally one player will declare victory by throning the princess he controls. Each player's deck starts with seven "Rural" territory cards and three "Apprentice Handmaid" succession cards (an unreliable subject). Using the currency (coins) generated by your "Rural" territory cards, you incorporate cards from the market into your deck according to your own strategy.

Each player's main goal is to give the princess he's fielded the throne. First, collect stronger territory cards such as "City" and "Metropolis" to increase your coins, and declare fielding a princess using these coins. There are five princesses and one set of twin princesses, totaling six princess cards. Each princess has special support abilities, but with only one of each, you need to be quick to field the right princess and get the support you need!

For your princess to take the throne, you must collect Succession Points, which represent the support of your loyal subjects and influential figures in the empire. Once you control 20 Succession Points, you may declare a coronation. Your opponents get one more turn to interrupt your coronation, but if your points remain at or above 20 by your next turn, the coronation succeeds and your princess takes the throne!
131904.name: Heart of Crown
boardgameexpansion: Heart of Crown: Far East Territory
Heart of Crown: Path Before Heaven
Heart of Crown: Six City Alliance
boardgamepodcastepisode: HLG 7: Op de foto

131905.name: The Card
131905.description:
From the Back of the Case

Ultimate Casino is the best way to live out your dreams of making a forthune the easy way. You won't believe your eyes... you've been so lucky!
But you still want more and you bet everything you've got, because even if you lose, it's still only a game!

131906.description: Winter: Reaction Cards is a promotional pack of six cards for Winter that gives you advantages based on your opponents' actions. These cards can also be used with 51st State or The New Era.
131906.name: Winter: Reaction Cards

131907.name: The Book of Taverns: The Summer Orchid
131907.description:
User note: A web supplement for DM1: The Book of Taverns

From Introduction:

Most fantasy role-playing games are set in a fictional variation on medieval Europe where many of the most common meeting places for characters happen to be taverns. However, in Asian-style campaign settings the tavern (jiu dian) wasn’t quite as common a gathering spot as the tea house (cha yi guan), which often doubled for the tavern in that it usually sold food and alcoholic beverages in addition to the teas on the menu. The tea house was often second only behind the local temple as the community center in medieval China. This article presents a typical, if slightly rural, tea house called the Summer Orchid, which can be inserted easily into any Asian-style campaign setting.

131908.name: The Hall of the Rainbow Mage: The Broken Mountains
131908.description:
From Introduction:

The Broken Mountains is a web expansion for G3: The Hall of the Rainbow Mage providing additional information about the wilderness north of Hampton Hill and detailing two additional small dungeons the PCs might decide to explore based on maps they discover in Londar Brightrain’s tower. While these dungeons and encounters are designed for a party of 4 or more 8th or 9th-level characters the difficulty level can easily be increased by the DM.

131909.name: The Hall of the Rainbow Mage: Web Supplement 1: The Return of Londar Brightrain
131909.description:
User note: A web supplement for G3: The Hall of the Rainbow Mage

From Introduction:

It is very likely that Londar is resurrected during the PCs adventure giving rise to a possible future villain or long-term adversary. The PCs might also somehow find themselves allied with Londar who might direct them into further adventures. Londar’s stats and description are given here for the DM to use as a friend or foe of the PCs in the future.

131910.name: Dead Man’s Chest: Cannibal Hearts
131910.description:
From Introduction:

This web enhancement for Dead Man's Chest (d20 3.5) by Necromancer Games was written by Lance Hawvermale, with Matt McGee and Robert Hunter.

Those who own Dead Man's Chest know all about the wondrous items called cannibal hearts. Here are four new and original hearts to add to those appearing in DMC.

131911.name: A Family Affair: The Mystery of the Emerald Shield
131911.description:
From Introduction:

This adventure assumes the PCs are around 15th level, but completing K1: A Family Affair first is not necessary.

The mystery surrounding the Emerald Shield provides sailors with countless tales to tell at night. Empty of crew and even furniture, yet landing with nary a scratch, this “ghost ship” as it is often referred by superstitious sailors has stumped scholars for decades. While the PCs are aboard Shark Bait, the pirates willingly tell tales of the valuable treasure that disappeared from the ship, along with its crew. Everyone speaks of Olarin Held, a storyteller in Martyn’s Nest who knows more about the Emerald Shield than anyone.

131912.name: Attack of the Phantom Karate Devils
131912.description:
User Summary

A Game by John Orthel, Phantom Software

Brief Synopsis

The Master and his daughter have been killed at the hands of ominous phantoms. You take the role of a brave karate warrior to avenge their deaths. The Attack of the Phantom Karate Devils is a 2D combat title that features all kinds of martial arts maneuvers. Various levels include an underworld and the outside of a dojo.

In order to avenge the murders, the karate warrior must use an arsenal of maneuvers to banish foul demons and animated items to the realm from which they came. While the phantoms are silhouettes of fallen karate experts, animated items, such as katanas and throwing stars, move across the screen from time to time to threaten the hero as well.

131913.name: Christmas Madness!!!!: A Very Demented Christmas Special
131913.description:
From Introduction:

In the farthest, northern reaches of the known (and not-so-known) world, in a forest as old as time, there lives a wizard who goes by the name Nicholas of Myrna, but whom everyone else variously calls “Saint Nicholas,” “Good Ol’ Saint Nick,” or “That Fat, Red Bastard,” depending on their particular outlook on life. He’s not an especially jolly man, contrary to popular belief. In fact, he’s rather neurotic, but we’ll get to that a little later.

131914.name: King's Bounty
131914.description:
Beginning of the Adventure:

Heralds carry tidings all through the land: the battle for King’s Bounty is at hand! Fearless adventurers from throughout the kingdom gather forces under their banners, while prominent lords fortify their castles to withstand a siege. The whole world has turned upside down in the fever of war: dwarves have been seen defending the elves’ woodland strongholds against legions of the undead, great dragons have razed ancient obelisks to the ground, while heroes have used both brute force and cunning to capture enemy castles. The King can barely keep up with awarding commanders their well-earned titles for valor and heroism on the field of battle, and there’s not a single distinguished title that hasn’t already changed hands at least a dozen times. After all, it’s not the strength of your castle or the size of your army that counts — only the favor of the supreme ruler will decide who ultimately merits receiving the King’s Bounty.

Gameplay:

Based on the bestselling video game of the same name, King’s Bounty is a board game that’s played with cards. The players take control of one of five races — elves, dwarves, orcs, humans or the undead — and use their armies to capture castles and obelisks, earning victory points in the process. However, the main battle will be fought over titles, which are far more valuable than land in ensuring victory. At the end of the match, the players who have completed the required objectives earn the titles and the victory points that go with them. Finally, the scores get tallied up, and a winner is determined.

Game contents:


48 Troop cards of 5 races


Every race except for humans has 9 troop cards: 3 archers, 2 fighters, 2 wizards, 1 hero and 1 monster. Humans have 4 archers, 3 fighters, 3 wizards, 1 hero and 1 monster.


36 Property cards, including 24 Castle cards & 12 Obelisk cards


Castle cards. Every race except for humans has 6 castles: 2 towers, 2 fortresses and 2 citadels. Humans don’t have any castles.

Obelisk cards. The game has 4 obelisks with powers 1, 2 and 3. All obelisks are neutral (meaning they don’t belong to any one race) and each yields 2 victory points.


21 Title Cards



1 Last player card



1 Rulebook

131916.name: Blaster Master 2
131916.description:
User Summary

The player controls a vehicle with a mounted cannon and the ability to jump. Platforming elements play at least as large of a role as the run-and-gun portion.

131918.name: Challenge & Reply
131918.description:
Tabletop miniatures naval wargame, designed for small scale (1:3000 or smaller) miniatures. 1 mini=1 ship, rules are designed for large actions, and are relatively simple, allowing for fairly simple bookkeeping (6+ ships per A4/letter sheet easily). Considerable detail is still preserved, such as ships carrying multiple size classes of guns per arc (ahead, broadside & aft), differing effects of boiler hits due to fuel type, etc. Submarine & aircraft actions are included, as are formations and campaign tracking.

Naval lists are included for Royal Navy & Kriegsmarine. Layout & typeface are rather old-fashioned in appearance.

131920.name: Sryth
131920.description:
Sryth is a single-player, story-driven fantasy RPG you play right in your web browser. 'Sryth' is also the name of the world in which your adventures take place.

The word 'Sryth' is pronounced in one fell syllable, with the 's' and the 'r' blending together and the 'y' producing a short sound, as in the word 'myth'.

In the world of Sryth YOU are the hero!
You'll assume the role of a brave adventurer (a character you will create and customize) and will then set out in search of fame, fortune, and of course...adventure! However, you're not just any ordinary adventurer...

In Sryth, the game's storyline revolves around you. You're the main character -- perhaps the greatest adventurer since the glory days of Tallys -- and your actions and decisions will not only shape your destiny, but perhaps alter the course of history!

Source: The Game Website.

131921.name: Farewell to Fear
131921.description:
Full Title: Professor Anderssen’s Omnibus Works, Titled Farewell to Fear, Proposing the Advancement of Culture and the Abandonment of Barbarism

Publisher Blurb:
"God save the queen, because we’re too busy saving ourselves. The status quo is never the answer; it is always the problem. History is written by the victors. Since the past has been taken from us, we’re going to write the future."

"Afflict the comfortable. Comfort the afflicted. Always demand better. Complacency is humankind’s greatest enemy. Do not suffer the fate of the elves. Shed your romantic notions of plutarchy, monarchy, patriarchy, ecclesiarchy. This is the real world. Take control."

- Kennuise Political Tract

Farewell to Fear is a game about revolution, change, and bringing modern ideas to fantasy. The world isn’t perfect, but we want you to change it. Preparation, discovery, truth, experimentation, forward-thinking, these are your weapons.

It’s a little Moorcock meets Marx. Dragonlance meets Dead Kennedys. Lord of the Rings meets Locke. Elric meets Eco.

Farewell to Fear includes:

Our world, Arduise, presented in fictional research, anecdote, and quotations. Everything’s subjective; so nothing is set in stone.
Rules for playing Farewell to Fear. Our rules focus on revolution and critically-approaching problems.
Hundreds of seeds for telling your own stories, access to dozens of character options, and guidelines for making your own characters and adventures.




Welcome to Arduise. Now change it.

Character Classes
We opted not to have “canon” character classes. We’re going to be doing somewhere around 25 in the next year. You’ll be able to download them.

131922.name: Priest Hunter
131922.description:
From the publisher website:
Character Classes
We opted not to have “canon” character classes. We’re going to be doing somewhere around 25 in the next year. You’ll be able to download them here.

User Summary: Character class playsheet for the Priest Hunter.

131923.name: Operative
131923.description:
From the publisher website:
Character Classes
We opted not to have “canon” character classes. We’re going to be doing somewhere around 25 in the next year. You’ll be able to download them here.

User Summary: Character class playsheet for the Operative.

From the summary: You’re never seen. Your presence, your actions, everything you do is a blind for something else. You might sneak in, going like a ghost to your target. You may blend so perfectly with the people around you that not a living soul could identify you. You may take on a new persona so complete the gods themselves forget you. Why? That depends on who’s footing the bill.

131924.name: Chevalier
131924.description:
From the publisher website:
Character Classes
We opted not to have “canon” character classes. We’re going to be doing somewhere around 25 in the next year. You’ll be able to download them here.

User Summary: Character class playsheet for the Chevalier.

From the summary: War’s a dirty business, it’s your job to make it look good. You’re a gentleperson’s officer, high ranking and expertly trained. You’re as deadly with a sword as you are with a word and while your focus appears to be well choreographed violence, you’re real purpose is diplomatic. The hope is that if a Chevalier and your retinue arrive at a conflict, the threat of your abilities to kill tend to be enough to get everyone willing to listen and compromise.

131925.name: Anthropologist
131925.description:
From the publisher website:
Character Classes
We opted not to have “canon” character classes. We’re going to be doing somewhere around 25 in the next year. You’ll be able to download them here.

User Summary: Character class playsheet for the Chevalier.

From the summary: You just can’t stop digging. Whatever it is, no matter how deeply you dig. there’s more to study. The idea of dead civilizations fascinate you, and better yet, entire races wiped out by who knows what. You’ve dabbled in living cultures and the graves of those gone before and revel in your understanding of people as fit human behavior into neat, organized patterns and norms.

131926.name: Barely Even a Crime
131926.description:
From the introduction:

In the aging lower merchant class neighborhood of Cobbler’s End, the Church of the Hero is asking for donations. And they’re getting them at an alarming rate.

Priests of the Church ask, and all of the older people of Cobbler’s End are turning out their pockets and purses, scratching together ever last mouse they can find. Grown children have found the dead changed wills and at least one couple has leased their teenage grandchildren in service to the Church. (This is technically legal, but generally frowned upon.)

Is there any truth to their claims that they can contact the dead for the sake of the living?

This meddling, while legal, is very likely to draw the attention Priest Hunters, and what is a small series of questionable activity could turn into full scale turf warfare in the blink of the eye. And the casualties may be those who have already lost the most.

131927.name: Shade (Alpha)
131927.description:
From publisher blurb:

When I was a kid, I was infatuated with ghost stories. I read everything and anything I could find about ghosts. I didn’t discriminate between fiction and dubious nonfiction and folklore. I don’t remember all, or even most, of the stories now. Mostly I’ve retained fragments without context. I remember a Victorian child who fell down a flight of stairs, leaving a blood stain at the bottom that would return, undeterred after every cleaning day. I remember the witch’s jawbone, and how her spirit would leave fruit and toys for poor sick Mrs. Bell, even while it consumed her husband’s life. I remember the hitchhiker’s abandoned jacket, and her tombstone.

I only remember those fragments now, because I grew old enough to stop thinking about ghost stories and to start thinking about work and codependent relationship and role-playing games about post-Reconstruction racism. I also grew old enough to realize I had lost something, or many things.

Shade is a ghost story game. It’s also a game about how life diminishes us, and how death (or our ideas about it) empowers us. It’s a simple narrative role-playing game that can be played in a single sitting.

Shade uses a custom deck of personality cards to guide each character’s journey through life, and their transformation after death.

131928.name: Tradeoff
131928.description:
TradeOff is the game of stock market supremacy. It pits two to six players against each other in one simple challenge - to make the most money on the stock market so as to out-bid each other for luxury items. However the stock market is volatile and unpredictable. Take-over bids, profit warnings, insider trading and much more, all contribute to make TradeOff an exciting and strategic roller-coaster ride from beginning to end.

HOW IT WORKS: The mat acts as the stock market and consists of four stocks. During the course of the game each stock's value independently rises and falls as dictated by the cards that players collect. Players can predict these rises and falls by studying their own cards and watching how their opponents are investing.

Making an investment is easy. Players select a stock they think will rise in value and simply place a number of their chips on the mat next to the stock's share price marker. Profit and losses are easily calculated by either using the numbers printed on the mat or by using the free app available on our website. But it's not only the cards that determine how the stock's values will change. When players invest in, or sell an investment, the stock's value rises or falls accordingly. This gives players the chance to be nasty to each other by reducing the value of their opponents investments!

Throughout the course of the game auctions are held for luxury items. During these auctions players must out-bid each other to secure the purchase of the item. The first player to obtain the requisite number of luxury items wins the game.

131929.name: Jabberwocky: a diceless battle game for fantasy armies
131929.description:
Tactical scale tabletop miniatures game. A diceless mechanic means A always beats B always beats C... but B can get advantages to beat A, etc.

For instance,
Double ranked pikes can not be defeated in frontal attacks
but
Blades defeat Pikes in frontal attacks

Therefore, you CAN defeat double ranked pikes in a frontal attack if the attacking unit is Blades. Similarly, you read down a list of conditions until you get to the first applicable one & use the result.

Figure scale & numbers, & base sizes, are left up to the player. The intended standard game size is 10 stands. Rules allow for play of historical battles, but also include rules on monster types & abilities, magic effects, etc. A number of army lists and a point-build system are included.

131930.name: Wo sind Schaf & Co.?
131930.description:
Before Framer Bert can take his tractor out in the field, he must quickly feed the animals on his farm. But where are they anyway? They've been hiding in their stables!

In Wo sind Schaf & Co.?, you'll find out who can help Bert find the animals so that he can get on with his work. Whoever has some luck with the dice and good eyes will finish his puzzling animal farm first.

131931.name: Elder Sign: The Log of the Persephone – Promo Location
131931.description:
The Log of the Persephone is a mail order card from Fantasy Flights Games. The card can only be acquired by using the order form in the back of the novel 'Bones of the Yopasi' also by FFG.

The card provides a new location for Elder Sign based on the Novel.

Update March 30 2013: The card was (sparsely) given away on TableTopDay by retailers who received the goodie-box.

Update February 5th 2014: The card was found in the gift bags sent out to backers of Season 1 of Shut Up & Sit Down

131932.name: Häuptling Puzzlenase
131932.description:
The cheeky Indian boy Puzzlenase would like to be a brave Indian chief one day, so each day he runs around the village and practices searching for trails that barely exist. Through his curiosity he discovers new things.

In Häuptling Puzzlenase only sharp eagle eyes and a good memory can help you remember and find all that the Indian boy is looking for.

boardgamehonor: 2013 Games Magazine Best New Word Game Winner
131933.description:
KerFlip! is a fast-thinking word game that rewards you for making anagrams from a group of letter tiles faster than your opponents can. At the beginning of each round, players simultaneously drop a predetermined number of tiles onto the board, then quickly flip them all ivory side up. (The fronts of the tiles are ivory, while the backs are orange.) At this point the round is a free-for-all, with players racing to call out one word each. If the last player is taking too long to call a word, any of his opponents can "hurry" him by starting the timer; if he doesn't call out a word in 15 seconds, he busts, scoring nothing.

Once every player has called a word for the round, they score points in the order they called out the words, so the first player who called scores first, the second player second, etc. The first time a tile is used – that is, while its ivory side is face-up – the tile is worth 10 points. Once it's been scored, flip (or "KerFlip") it to its orange side, reducing its value to 5 points for all other players who used it in the same round. Some tiles, identified by a small number in the bottom right corner, are "premium tiles" that award players cards with bonus point values.

At the end of each round, return any unused (ivory) tiles to the draw pouch and sweep all used (orange) tiles into the collection chutes in the game box. The game lasts 15-20 minutes (about 10-12 rounds) depending on the number of players (2-4). To clean up at the end of the game, pick up the game box and gently shake it to funnel the tiles into a collection cup under the board.
131933.name: KerFlip!
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 14: Holey Pants, Batman!

131934.name: Die Wilden Fussballkerle: Das Wilde Fußball-Quiz
131934.description: Another game in this popular TV franchise. Players take turns to ask the other players a question about the TV show, football rules or football tips. The most right answers, wins.

131935.name: Operation Shingle: The Anzio Beachhead
131935.description:
From the editor's website:

To reinvigorate their stalled Italian campaign, the Allies landed a reinforced corps at the small coastal town of Anzio, just 30 miles from Rome and the German supply arteries. A hesitant advance and a rapid German reaction set the stage for a nip-and-tuck battle for the beachhead.
This classic campaign is covered using the Fire & Movement system at one kilometer per hex and one day per turn. The standard unit is the infantry battalion, which can be strengthened by a multitude of tanks and other heavy weapons, plus fire support markers rated for different weapon types up to and including a massive heavy bomber strike.
